original: bzlog par zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du'o //üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs @243a * //
analyzed: bzlog par zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du'o // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs @243a * //
translated: ‚ÄúReverted‚Äù means ‚Äúturned into something else.‚Äù

original: pas len 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: pas len 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you say that the object . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe response is as follows: The object of recognition exists in the present.

original: ngo shes pa'i yul da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ci mngon sum snga mas bzung ba'i yod pa nyid las tha dad dam /
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i yul da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ci mngon sum snga mas bzung ba'i yod pa nyid las tha dad dam /
translated: Is the existence of the object of recognition different from the existence of the object apprehended by the prior perception?

original: 'on te nge nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te nge nyid yin /
translated: Or is it the same?

original: gal te tha dad na de'i tshe rang gi tshig nyid kyis tha dad du bstan pa'i phyir khyed cag gis khas blangs pa nyams par 'gyur la /üîΩkho bo cag gi ni 'dod pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te tha dad na de'i tshe rang gi tshig nyid kyis tha dad du bstan pa'i phyir khyed cag gis khas blangs pa nyams par 'gyur la / kho bo cag gi ni 'dod pa grub pa yin no //
translated: If it is different, then you have undermined your own position by your own words, and we have established our own position.

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe gang gis snga ma'i blo yis rtogs pa yin zhes brjod pa de ji ltar blo snga mas mi rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe gang gis snga ma'i blo yis rtogs pa yin zhes brjod pa de ji ltar blo snga mas mi rtogs /
translated: If you say that the object of recognition is not different from the object of the prior perception, then how can you say that the prior perception does not cognize the object of recognition?

original: 'di snyam du gal te sgra la sogs pa las skad cig ma nyid tha mi dad pa yin na yang de bzung na ma bzung bar brjod pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te sgra la sogs pa las skad cig ma nyid tha mi dad pa yin na yang de bzung na ma bzung bar brjod pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even though momentariness is not different from sound, etc., it is not apprehended when sound, etc., is apprehended, then it would be the same for you.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: chos can sgra bzung na yang de las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma bzung ngo zhes rnam par gzhag par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos can sgra bzung na yang de las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma bzung ngo zhes rnam par gzhag par ni mi bya'o //
translated: When the subject, sound, is apprehended, it is not the case that momentariness, which is not different from it, is not apprehended.

original: 'on kyang de bzung du zin kyang nges pa skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ma nges so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzung du zin kyang nges pa skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ma nges so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But even though it is apprehended, it is not ascertained because there is no cause for the arising of ascertainment.

original: nyams su myong ba nyid tsam las nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid tsam las nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained merely from experience.

original: de ni don du ga nyer ba dang goms pa dang drin du gzo ba la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don du ga nyer ba dang goms pa dang drin du gzo ba la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it depends on the object, familiarity, gratitude, etc.

original: khyed la ni de lta bu srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed la ni de lta bu srid pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not possible for you.

original: mngon sum snga ma yang nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum snga ma yang nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the prior perception is also of the nature of ascertainment.

original: des kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na de las tha mi dad pa'i da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid kyang nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des kyang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na de las tha mi dad pa'i da lta'i dus su yod pa nyid kyang nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If one ascertains the intrinsic reality of a thing, then one also ascertains its existence in the present time which is not different from that.

original: de ma nges na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yang de bzhin du ma nges pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du tha la bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma nges na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yang de bzhin du ma nges pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du tha la bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not ascertain that, then one does not ascertain the intrinsic reality of the thing, because the intrinsic reality is not different from that which is not ascertained.

original: gang yang the tshom za ba'i dngos po yod pa na gtan la phab pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid yin no zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang the tshom za ba'i dngos po yod pa na gtan la phab pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid yin no zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Also, this refutes the statement by some that when a thing is in doubt, the recognition of the reason for the ascertainment is valid knowledge.

original: 'di la the tshom za ba'i dngos po yod pa na gtan la phab pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la the tshom za ba'i dngos po yod pa na gtan la phab pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: When a thing is in doubt, the ascertainment does not exist,

original: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan skye ba na yang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du ngo shes pa mthong ba ni the tshom mi za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan skye ba na yang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du ngo shes pa mthong ba ni the tshom mi za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when other similar things arise, recognition is seen to be like sound and so on, and there is no doubt.

original: gang yang / cig shos kyis ni don rtogs pa'ang //
analyzed: gang yang / cig shos kyis ni don rtogs pa'ang //
translated: And also: The other understands the object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /üîΩrjes su dpag pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la / rjes su dpag pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text says, ‚ÄúInference and so on . . .‚Äù

original: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gang gi spyod yul te /
analyzed: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gang gi spyod yul te /
translated: ‚ÄúInference and so on‚Äù refers to inference and so on, such as the statement, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced.‚Äù

original: yul la mngon sum gyis gnod pa srid pa yin na /
analyzed: yul la mngon sum gyis gnod pa srid pa yin na /
translated: If it is possible for the object of that inference and so on to be undermined by perception,

original: de tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition.

original: @243b gnod bzhin du yul yin pa nyid kyis don la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @243b gnod bzhin du yul yin pa nyid kyis don la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an object that is undermined, it is not nondeceptive with regard to its object, like the cognition of someone with an eye disease.

original: nges na / cig shos kyis ni don rtogs la //
analyzed: nges na / cig shos kyis ni don rtogs la //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe other one realizes its object,

original: mngon sum gyis ni gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: but perception is different,‚Äù

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni ma 'brel pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni ma 'brel pa nyid de /
translated: then that is incoherent.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang mngon sum thu bo nyid du brjod pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro // gang yang mngon sum thu bo nyid du brjod pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: don la mi slu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don la mi slu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the statement, ‚ÄúPerception is the foremost,‚Äù is also incoherent, the root text says, ‚ÄúIt is not nondeceptive with regard to its object . . .‚Äù

original: tshad ma rnams kyi tshad ma nyid ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi tshad ma nyid ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is the valid cognition of all valid cognitions.

original: don thob par nus pa'o //
analyzed: don thob par nus pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to attain the object.

original: de yang tshad ma thams cad la khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma thams cad la khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: And that must be accepted for all valid cognitions.

original: des na ci'i phyir mngon sum 'di thu bo nyid du 'gyur yang ci ste mngon sum kho na don la mi slu ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir mngon sum 'di thu bo nyid du 'gyur yang ci ste mngon sum kho na don la mi slu ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, why would direct perception alone be the most important? Why would only direct perception be nondeceptive with respect to its object?

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: Why would inference and so on not be?

original: de yod min na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yod min na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIf that does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i don la mi slu ba nyid de med pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i don la mi slu ba nyid de med pa yin na /
translated: If the nondeceptiveness with respect to its object does not exist,

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then inference and so on would not be valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni don la mi slu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni don la mi slu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because the reason for the convention of valid cognition is nondeceptiveness with respect to its object.

original: de yang 'di la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'di la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that does not exist for them.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa 'dis //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa 'dis //
translated: If inference is not nondeceptive,üîΩthen it is not a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang bral gyis smras pa'i tshad ma dag dogs par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang bral gyis smras pa'i tshad ma dag dogs par byed de /
translated: If you say that inference is nondeceptive,üîΩthen why is it not a valid cognition?

original: rjes su dpag pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that inference?

original: brjod 'dod nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod 'dod nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe sun, etc., that are desired to be expressed,‚Äù etc.

original: des smras pa /üîΩblo mi mthun pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po brjod par 'dod pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: des smras pa / blo mi mthun pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po brjod par 'dod pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni /
translated: He says,

original: de'i dus su bcad pa'i zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus su bcad pa'i zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin te /
translated: The consciousnesses of the sun, moon, planets, stars, etc., which are the bases of disagreement, are the objects of the moon, sun, planets, stars, and so on, which are defined at that time.

original: sa dang 'brel pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa dang 'brel pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the sun, moon, planets, stars, and so on, which are not observed to be related to the earth, are the objects of expression of the consciousnesses of the sun, moon, planets, stars, and so on.

original: dus dang por byung ba'i lha spyin gyi zla ba dang nyi ma dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: dus dang por byung ba'i lha spyin gyi zla ba dang nyi ma dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is like the consciousness of Devadatta‚Äôs moon, sun, planets, stars, and so on, which arose at the beginning of time.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa yul yin no zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gzi brjid la sogs pa'i rdzas yul yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa yul yin no zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gzi brjid la sogs pa'i rdzas yul yin pa'o //
translated: The sun, etc., which are the objects of the desire to speak, are the objects of the substance of the sun‚Äôs brilliance, etc.

original: sa dang 'brel pa nyid du mi dmigs bas zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni ri mo la sogs par gtogs pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa dag gis 'khrul pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sa dang 'brel pa nyid du mi dmigs bas zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni ri mo la sogs par gtogs pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa dag gis 'khrul pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: The qualification ‚Äúnot perceived as connected with the earth‚Äù is for the purpose of avoiding error with regard to the cognition of the sun, etc., which are the objects of the cognition of the sun, etc., that are included in a picture, etc.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan te /
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means different from that.
That is to say,

original: ma yin pa'i dus shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i dus shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is the cognition of a time that is not that.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma gzhan 'di yang yin te gang dag gzugs nyid la sogs pa spyi la brten pa dang / gang yang de'i rten dang / gang yang de'i yul can gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma gzhan 'di yang yin te gang dag gzugs nyid la sogs pa spyi la brten pa dang / gang yang de'i rten dang / gang yang de'i yul can gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
translated: This is also another proof of that: Those which are based on the universals of form, etc., and those which are their bases, and those which are the direct perception, inference, and comparison of their objects, and those which are the verbal testimony of the scriptures of the wise, all of these are the means of knowing the universals of form, etc.

original: sgra dang ; dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / dpyod pa dang / grub pas bstan pa dang / the tshom dang / phyin ci log dang / ma des pa dang / rmi lam dang / rmi lam gyi mtha'i shes rab kyi khyad par de dag thams cad ni bdag nyid thob ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang ; dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / dpyod pa dang / grub pas bstan pa dang / the tshom dang / phyin ci log dang / ma des pa dang / rmi lam dang / rmi lam gyi mtha'i shes rab kyi khyad par de dag thams cad ni bdag nyid thob ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: All of these‚Äîsound, memory, recognition, analysis, the teachings of the learned, doubt, misconception, carelessness, dreams, and the wisdom at the end of dreams‚Äîdo not immediately cease upon being attained.

original: shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / brjod bya nyid dang / yod pa dang / med pa gang yang rung ba nyid dang / yod pa dang / med pa las tha dad pa'i shes bya'i yul can gyi shes pas gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / brjod bya nyid dang / yod pa dang / med pa gang yang rung ba nyid dang / yod pa dang / med pa las tha dad pa'i shes bya'i yul can gyi shes pas gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang /
translated: They are not objects of knowledge, not objects of comprehension, not objects of expression, not existent, not nonexistent, not objects of knowledge that are different from existent or nonexistent objects of knowledge, and not objects to be eliminated by a consciousness that has existent or nonexistent objects of knowledge.

original: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i rjod par byed pas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / rigs mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i rdzas ldan ba dang rnam par dbye ba las skyes pa sgra'i 'bras bu'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i rjod par byed pas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid dang / rigs mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i rdzas ldan ba dang rnam par dbye ba las skyes pa sgra'i 'bras bu'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The object of the sound that is the effect of the sound that has the substance of the similar and dissimilar types is the object of the sound that is the effect of the sound.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nonexistence prior to the existence and so on.

original: de la gzugs nyid la sogs pa spyi la brten pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs nyid la sogs pa spyi la brten pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the form itself and so on are based on the generality of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni de'i rten no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni de'i rten no //
translated: The basis of those forms and so on is the basis of that.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the pot and so on.

original: grub pas bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: grub pas bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The teaching by the established is the consciousness of the yogi.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as before.

original: yod pa dang med pa yang gang rung ba ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa yang gang rung ba ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid do //
translated: Existence and nonexistence are either existence or nonexistence.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag las tha dad pa'i shes bya med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag las tha dad pa'i shes bya med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because there is no object of knowledge that is different from existent and nonexistent,

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang med do //
translated: the consciousness that has that as its object does not exist.

original: de yang med pa nyid kyi phyir des gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: de yang med pa nyid kyi phyir des gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid grub po //
translated: And because that also does not exist, it is established that it is not to be cut.

original: de bzhin du gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de yi sa gzung bar bya bam yin pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de yi sa gzung bar bya bam yin pa nyid grub po //
translated: Similarly, because there is no apprehension of an object that is not to be apprehended, it is established that it is not to be apprehended.

original: de bzhin du gang la brjod par bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni rjod par byed pa ste brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la brjod par bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni rjod par byed pa ste brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, that which does not have an object of expression is the expression, that is, the object of expression.

original: des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid sgrub ste /
analyzed: des brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid sgrub ste /
translated: It establishes the object of expression as not being an object of expression.

original: don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless.

original: rigs mtshungs pa'i rdzas ni chu dang sa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa'i rdzas ni chu dang sa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Substances of the same type are water, earth, and so on,

original: byas pa nyid la sogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in being produced and so on.

original: rigs mi mtshungs pa @244b ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mi mtshungs pa @244b ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
translated: Substances of a different type are space and so on.

original: de dag phan tshun ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de dag gi sa bskyed ba'i sgra dang bo gang yin pa de'i brgyud pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa rna pa'i lam du phyin pa gang yin pa des brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de dag gi sa bskyed ba'i sgra dang bo gang yin pa de'i brgyud pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa rna pa'i lam du phyin pa gang yin pa des brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that it is the object of expression of the ear sense faculty.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi tha snyad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi tha snyad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The convention of these is as follows:

original: sgra'i dang po'i skye gnas ni ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i dang po'i skye gnas ni ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The first sound is conjoined with and disjoined from the second sound.

original: de las pho long rde ba pa'i tshul du sgra gzhan dag skye'o //
analyzed: de las pho long rde ba pa'i tshul du sgra gzhan dag skye'o //
translated: From that, other sounds arise in the manner of a series.

original: de dag las kyang so sor sgra re re las zhan pa dang / ches zhan pa dang / ches cher zhan ba'i rim pas skye ste /
analyzed: de dag las kyang so sor sgra re re las zhan pa dang / ches zhan pa dang / ches cher zhan ba'i rim pas skye ste /
translated: From those, each sound arises in a series of weaker, weaker, and weaker sounds.

original: de la gang zhig rna ba'i sbubs kyi dbus kyi nam mkha'i yul du phyin pa de dmigs kyis /
analyzed: de la gang zhig rna ba'i sbubs kyi dbus kyi nam mkha'i yul du phyin pa de dmigs kyis /
translated: Among those, the sound that reaches the object of space in the middle of the ear canal is apprehended.

original: cig shos ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: The other is not apprehended.

original: des na 'di'i tshad ma'i tshogs ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'di'i tshad ma'i tshogs ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the collection of valid knowledge of this is taught.

original: gzugs nyid la sogs don kun dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nyid la sogs don kun dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll objects, such as form itself,‚Äù etc.

original: gzhan bya nyid dang brjod bya nyid smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan bya nyid dang brjod bya nyid smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The terms ‚Äúagent‚Äù and ‚Äúaction‚Äù are used as examples.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Other reasons should be sought as well.

original: mkha' ste nam mkha'i padma ni nam mkha'i padma ste nam mkha'i padma bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mkha' ste nam mkha'i padma ni nam mkha'i padma ste nam mkha'i padma bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ‚Äúsky-lotus‚Äù is like a sky-lotus, i.e., it is non-existent.

original: gsal byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: gsal byed pas smras pa /
translated: The Grammarian objects:

original: log par rtogs pa'i cig car ba ma yin pa'i dus kyi shes pa rnams ni yul gcig yin te /üîΩde'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa ma gsal ba mtshungs pa'i sgra'i brjod bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi skad cig la skyes bu du ma'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'i cig car ba ma yin pa'i dus kyi shes pa rnams ni yul gcig yin te / de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa ma gsal ba mtshungs pa'i sgra'i brjod bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi skad cig la skyes bu du ma'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The non-simultaneous cognitions of a single object are the same in being cognitions,üîΩbecause they are the objects of a single statement, like the many cognitions of a single present moment.

original: de la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis bsal ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis bsal ba ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the force of a valid cognition.

original: gzhan du bya ba'i dang tshul 'di la yod pas bsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du bya ba'i dang tshul 'di la yod pas bsal ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúrefuted‚Äù is used because the opponent‚Äôs position is to be rejected.

original: bas la ba ma yin pa ni ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: bas la ba ma yin pa ni ma bsal ba'o //
translated: The non-excluded is the non-eliminated.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag gi gzhi mthun pa ni de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag gi gzhi mthun pa ni de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa'o //
translated: The common locus of those cognitions of pot, etc. is the common locus of their cognitions.

original: 'di ni ma bsal ba yang yin la de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa yang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma bsal ba yang yin la de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa yang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is called the non-excluded and the common locus of their cognitions.

original: gzhi ma thun ba la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi ma thun ba la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction in the common locus.

original: khyad par 'di yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pa dag gis 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'di yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pa dag gis 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don du ste /
translated: And this distinction is for the purpose of eliminating error by the cognitions of lamp, etc.

original: mtshungs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni nag pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni nag pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The expression of the word ‚Äúsame‚Äù is ‚Äúthe cognition of black,‚Äù etc.

original: de 'di ston pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ston pa ni /
translated: That is taught here:

original: gang dag rnam pa rtsod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa rtsod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Those who dispute the aspect, etc. The ‚Äúproponents‚Äù are the ones who make the assertion.

original: gcig la bsten pa ste gzhi mthun par gnod pa med na de gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: gcig la bsten pa ste gzhi mthun par gnod pa med na de gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa yang de yin la /
translated: The non-contradiction in the common locus, i.e., the non-contradiction in the single basis, is that.

original: gcig la brten pa yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gcig la brten pa yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúbased on one.‚Äù

original: 'di la len 'debs par byed pa ni @245a * //
analyzed: 'di la len 'debs par byed pa ni @245a * //
translated: Here, the one who asks the question

original: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: says ‚Äúfirst of all‚Äù and so on.

original: gtan tshigs dang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first reason is

original: de shes nyid du brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de shes nyid du brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is said to be the consciousness of that.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la zla ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang po yang de'i dus su gcod pa'i zla ba'i yul can du mi 'gyur te /üîΩrgyur gyur ba nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la zla ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang po yang de'i dus su gcod pa'i zla ba'i yul can du mi 'gyur te / rgyur gyur ba nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first consciousness of the moon and so on would not be the subject of the moon at that time because the cause is the object.

original: dus mtshungs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, simultaneity is untenable as cause and effect.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // phyis kyang nye par mi sbyor phyir //
analyzed: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // phyis kyang nye par mi sbyor phyir //
translated: Because the nonexistent is not a cause earlier, and because it does not connect later,

original: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //üîΩde phyir rang blo bcas don min //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin // de phyir rang blo bcas don min //
translated: all causes exist earlier.

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind and its object are not simultaneous.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa dang 'brel ba nyid du mi dmigs pa zhes khyad par dang bcas pa yin na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa dang 'brel ba nyid du mi dmigs pa zhes khyad par dang bcas pa yin na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase at any time, etc. indicates that even though the word only is qualified by the word non-apprehension, the reason is still indeterminate.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i tshogs la chos can rigs la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis skad cig ma 'jig pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa'i tshogs la chos can rigs la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis skad cig ma 'jig pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase because of the non-existence of the universal, etc. indicates that the second reason is indeterminate because the opponent does not accept the destruction of the momentary by the non-existence of the universal, etc.

original: de la de med pa sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de med pa sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the universal, etc. indicates that if the non-existence of the universal, etc. in the particular is established, then the establishment of what is already established occurs.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni de la brten pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa la sogs pa dang / de'i yul can gyi shes pa rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni de la brten pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa la sogs pa dang / de'i yul can gyi shes pa rnams gzung ste /
translated: The phrase the universal, etc. includes the form that is based on it, etc., and the consciousnesses that have it as their object.

original: ji skad du bshad pas khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can 'di dag kyang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pas khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can 'di dag kyang med pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase these also do not exist indicates that the particulars qualified by the previously mentioned reason also do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de dag la de'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa smras pa gang yin pa de ni log pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la de'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa smras pa gang yin pa de ni log pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is not established that those things are momentary and disintegrate, any proof that is stated to establish that is wrong,

original: de la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa yin no //
translated: because there is no dispute about that.

original: 'di la yang zhib tu dpyad pa ma byas te /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhib tu dpyad pa ma byas te /
translated: Here, we have not analyzed this in detail.

original: gal te de byed na de'i tshe de la skyon gyi tshogs ches mang ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te de byed na de'i tshe de la skyon gyi tshogs ches mang ba 'jug ste /
translated: If one does, then a great many faults would ensue.

original: 'di ltar 'di yod pa dang med pa gang yang rung ba sgrub byed du smras pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can la ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di yod pa dang med pa gang yang rung ba sgrub byed du smras pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can la ma grub ste /
translated: In this regard, the aspect of the proof that is stated to prove either existence or nonexistence is not established with regard to the subject of the proposition or the subject of the example.

original: gang yang rung ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po du ma srid pa yin na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po du ma srid pa yin na 'gyur gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúany‚Äù is the object of conception, and because it is possible that conception has many things as its object,

original: gcig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not possible that it has a single thing as its object.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyis srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyis srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for both existence and nonexistence to occur in a single probandum.

original: de la ni dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa nyid gyis yod pa kho na srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa nyid gyis yod pa kho na srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in that case, it would be possible only for existence to occur, since it would have the nature of an entity.

original: dpe'i chos can la yang gnyis srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can la yang gnyis srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible for both to occur in the example.

original: de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in that case, it would be possible only for nonexistence to occur, since it would be a nonentity.

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par yang don med pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par yang don med pa yin te /
translated: The qualification of the reason is also meaningless.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i @245b de lta bu sbyor ba yang 'dir re zhig mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i @245b de lta bu sbyor ba yang 'dir re zhig mi rigs te /
translated: For example, it is not reasonable to apply the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the object of expression of a word‚Äù here,

original: brjod par bya ba nyid smos pa nyid kyis sgrar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid smos pa nyid kyis sgrar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere mention of the object of expression establishes it as a word.

original: gang yang rigs mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dag gi khyad par de ni shin tu stobs chung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rigs mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dag gi khyad par de ni shin tu stobs chung ba nyid yin no //
translated: And the qualification of the words ‚Äúsimilar type‚Äù and so on is very weak.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gzhan yang don med pa nyid do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gzhan yang don med pa nyid do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the other distinctions of reason are also meaningless.

original: gtan tshigs 'di dag thams cad kyang ma nges pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di dag thams cad kyang ma nges pa dag yin te /
translated: All of these reasons are inconclusive,

original: 'di dag bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you have not shown a valid reason that refutes the opposite of what is to be established.

original: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown later.

original: gang yang gang dag rnam par rtsod pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs ba smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang gang dag rnam par rtsod pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs ba smras pa de la /
translated: Now, in response to the statement, ‚ÄúThe object of dispute is the world,‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa'i sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smo te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smo te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòsame‚Äô is used, etc.‚Äù

original: mar me'i shes pa mar me'i shes pa'o snyam pa mar me la sogs pa'i shes pa yul can tha dad pa yin na yang mtshungs pa'i sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me'i shes pa mar me'i shes pa'o snyam pa mar me la sogs pa'i shes pa yul can tha dad pa yin na yang mtshungs pa'i sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the cognition of a lamp and the cognition of a lamp are different subjects, we see that the word ‚Äúsame‚Äù is used.

original: de'i phyir des na ste sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yul can mtshungs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i phyir zhas bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul ba can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir des na ste sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yul can mtshungs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i phyir zhas bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, this reason ‚Äúbecause of being expressed by the same term‚Äù is mistaken, because the subject of the cognition of the lamp, etc., is not the same as the object of the cognition of the lamp, etc.

original: yang na bzlog pa'i gnod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bzlog pa'i gnod pa ste /
translated: Or, the fault of the contrapositive is committed.

original: de'i phyir de dag la 'jug pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di khyod kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin nam ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la 'jug pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di khyod kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin nam ste /
translated: Therefore, is this reason not mistaken for you?

original: 'on kyang 'gyur ba'i don te //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gyur ba'i don te //
translated: However, the meaning is different.

original: de dag la ni gzhi mthun phyir nyid ces bya ba gzhan gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzhi mthun phyir nyid ces bya ba gzhan gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äútoo‚Äù in the line ‚Äúbecause they have a common basis‚Äù is a response to the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa ma bsal ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul ba bsal ba'i don kho nar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i shes pa gzhi mthun pa ma bsal ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul ba bsal ba'i don kho nar byas pa yin te /
translated: The qualification ‚Äúbecause the common basis of the cognition of that is not eliminated‚Äù in the reason is taken to mean that the mistake of the cognition of the lamp, etc., is eliminated.

original: mar me la sogs pa shes pa de dag ni yul gcig pa can gnod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa shes pa de dag ni yul gcig pa can gnod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The reason is that the cognition of the lamp, etc., is not a common basis because it is undermined.

original: 'di ltar de'i skad cig nyid la mar me rtse mo mtho ba dang rtse mo dud pa dang / gsal ba dang ches gsal ba dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i skad cig nyid la mar me rtse mo mtho ba dang rtse mo dud pa dang / gsal ba dang ches gsal ba dmigs te /
translated: Thus, the tip of the flame is seen to be high, low, clear, and very clear.

original: de'i phyir / rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs 'khrul bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs 'khrul bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how can the basic reason be mistaken? This is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: de'i khyad par 'di ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'di ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this distinction is not established, he says:

original: brjod 'dod la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod 'dod la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even in the case of what is desired to be expressed, etc.

original: de la gang bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa de la yang gnod pa ci'i phyir ma mthong /
analyzed: de la gang bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa de la yang gnod pa ci'i phyir ma mthong /
translated: Why is no harm seen even in the case of what is desired to be expressed as the subject of the probandum?

original: 'di ltar nag pa la sogs pa la yang byis pa dang gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis 'gyur ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nag pa la sogs pa la yang byis pa dang gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis 'gyur ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, in the case of a black man, etc., a cognition arises in the form of change due to the distinction of child, youth, and adult.

original: dril sogs pa @246a * //
analyzed: dril sogs pa @246a * //
translated: In the case of a bell, etc.,

original: la grang ba dang dro ba'i ngo bos de las mar me la sogs pa bzhin du 'di dag gi rnam pa gzhan gsal rab pa nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: la grang ba dang dro ba'i ngo bos de las mar me la sogs pa bzhin du 'di dag gi rnam pa gzhan gsal rab pa nyid du grub ste /
translated: and cold and hot, respectively, then, like a lamp, etc., their other aspect, namely, their clarity, would be established.

original: de lta ma yin na gang kho na grang ba dang 'brel pa de kho na grang ba dang gal te phyis kyi dro ba dang 'brel pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang kho na grang ba dang 'brel pa de kho na grang ba dang gal te phyis kyi dro ba dang 'brel pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were not so, then that which is related to cold would be related to heat later.

original: de'i tshe grang ba dang dro ba'i gnas skabs gnyi ga dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe grang ba dang dro ba'i gnas skabs gnyi ga dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then both the state of cold and the state of heat would be perceived.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin yod na de dag kyang yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin yod na de dag kyang yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And if their nature were related to them, then they would exist.üîΩThis is like the case of a man who is put into an iron pot and is bent when the iron is bent.

original: lcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu bkug na lcags bkug pa bzhin no zhes 'di ni phal cher bshad zin to //
analyzed: lcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu bkug na lcags bkug pa bzhin no zhes 'di ni phal cher bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained for the most part.

original: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the reason with a distinction is also unestablished.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i yang //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i yang //
translated: And it is also contradicted by inference.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi la gnas pa yi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is the basis of the debate.

original: sbyor ba ni gang rim gyis 'byung ba de ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang rim gyis 'byung ba de ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba ma yin te /
translated: The application is that which arises in sequence, and that is not always proximate, because its cause is not complete.

original: glog dang mar me la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: glog dang mar me la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of lightning, a lamp, etc.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i blo rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i blo rnams kyang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs ba'o //
translated: The cognition that is the basis of the dispute also arises in sequence. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gtan tshigs ma des pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma des pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason inconclusive.

original: dngos po gcig gi yul can yin na rgyu ma tshad ba med pa ni rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi yul can yin na rgyu ma tshad ba med pa ni rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it has a single entity as its object, it is not tenable that it arises in sequence, because its cause is not incomplete.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it depend on another cause,

original: rtag pa na des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rtag pa na des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because if it is permanent, it is not something that can be benefited.

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa yang ltos nga'  mi rigs te /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa yang ltos nga'  mi rigs te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that something that cannot be benefited depends on something else,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could depend on anything.

original: phan 'dogs na yang rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lan brgyar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: phan 'dogs na yang rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lan brgyar dpyad zin to //
translated: And if it could be benefited, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would lose its permanence. This has been analyzed a hundred times.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la gtan tshigs dag ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la gtan tshigs dag ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: In all the arguments, the reason is indeterminate.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because there is no valid cognition that refutes the opposite position.

original: gtan tshigs de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúThose reasons . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: rtogs par zad do //
analyzed: rtogs par zad do //
translated: This is all that can be understood.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las brtan pa'i dngos po brtag pa ste bcu gsum pa'o /üîΩ// / da ni las dang de 'brel pa'i //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las brtan pa'i dngos po brtag pa ste bcu gsum pa'o / // / da ni las dang de 'brel pa'i //
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter, the ‚ÄúExamination of Permanent Entities,‚Äù in the root text of the Compendium of Reality.üîΩNow, in order to establish the following:üîΩThe basis of the presentation of action and its relation,

original: rnam par gzhag la sogs pa'i rten //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag la sogs pa'i rten // zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: and so forth,

original: rtsod pa nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba bshad pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba bshad pa /
translated: the objection is stated first:

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll things . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa smos pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa smos pa ni dus gzhan du gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of momentary impermanence is for the purpose of excluding impermanence that endures for another time.

original: skad cig mar yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig @246b ma'i mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig @246b ma'i mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanence that exists moment by moment is momentary impermanence.

original: des khyab pa ni yang dag par bsnan pa'o //
analyzed: des khyab pa ni yang dag par bsnan pa'o //
translated: The correct addition of that is pervasion.

original: gal te khyed cag gis dngos po'i tshogs thams cad mi rtag par dam 'cha' bar byed pa de'i tshe las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la grags pa de dag ji ltar bsgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gis dngos po'i tshogs thams cad mi rtag par dam 'cha' bar byed pa de'i tshe las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la grags pa de dag ji ltar bsgrub par 'gyur /
translated: If you assert that the whole collection of things is impermanent, then how could you establish such things as the connection between karma and its result, which are renowned in the world and treatises?

original: sogs pa smos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i tshad ma dang / nyams su myong ba ni ngo shes pa dang / gzhan du mthong ba'i don gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa dang bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / dran pa dang /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i tshad ma dang / nyams su myong ba ni ngo shes pa dang / gzhan du mthong ba'i don gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa dang bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / dran pa dang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the valid knowledge that comprehends the relationship between cause and effect, recognition of experience, the desire to see an object elsewhere, bondage, liberation, memory, and so on.

original: the tshom sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gtan la phab pa dang / rang gis bcol ba len pa dang / mthong ba'i don la tshor ngas dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de lta bu blo ngan pas kun du brtags pa'i kla na ka'i phung po dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: the tshom sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gtan la phab pa dang / rang gis bcol ba len pa dang / mthong ba'i don la tshor ngas dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de lta bu blo ngan pas kun du brtags pa'i kla na ka'i phung po dag gzung ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúheap of barbarians‚Äù is the collection of bad thoughts that are preceded by doubt, that are the acceptance of what one has proposed, and that are the lack of certainty about the meaning that one has seen.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la grags pa'i don dang 'gal ba'i dam 'cha' bar byed pa na don grub pa grub pa ma yin pas de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i nyes pa la khas blangs pa grags pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la grags pa'i don dang 'gal ba'i dam 'cha' bar byed pa na don grub pa grub pa ma yin pas de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i nyes pa la khas blangs pa grags pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: When one makes a proposition that contradicts the meaning that is known in the world and in the treatises, one‚Äôs purpose is not established, and therefore one‚Äôs proposition is faulty. This is what he thinks.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las gang kho na byas pa de kho nas de'i 'bras bu longs spyod do zhes 'jig rten na grags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las gang kho na byas pa de kho nas de'i 'bras bu longs spyod do zhes 'jig rten na grags te /
translated: Thus, in the world, it is well known that one experiences the effects of whatever actions one has done, whether virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: lha spyin gyis byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa mchod spyin gyis longs spyod do zhes bya bar grags pa ni med la /
analyzed: lha spyin gyis byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa mchod spyin gyis longs spyod do zhes bya bar grags pa ni med la /
translated: It is well known that Yaj√±adatta experiences the results of his virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, both desirable and undesirable.

original: bstan bcos la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case in the treatises.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las gzhan gang zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las gzhan gang zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: By what other action done by this one will it be experienced?

original: de 'di yang skad cig ma'i phyogs la 'gal te /
analyzed: de 'di yang skad cig ma'i phyogs la 'gal te /
translated: This is also contradictory in the context of momentariness,

original: las dang 'bras bu 'dzin pa po'i byed pa gcig med pas byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrang pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'dzin pa po'i byed pa gcig med pas byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrang pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of the destruction of karma done and the fault of experiencing karma not done would follow, since there is no single entity that holds the karma and its result.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúIn the context of virtue, etc.,‚Äù

original: dge sogs skabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dge sogs skabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: rjes su 'jug pa nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa nyid ma yin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not a subsequent state.

original: de ni skyes ma thag kho nar 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes ma thag kho nar 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it ceases immediately upon arising.

original: byed po gcig gis ma bzung phyir //
analyzed: byed po gcig gis ma bzung phyir //
translated: Because it is not apprehended by a single agent,

original: zhes bya ba ni byed pa po gcig gis las dang 'bras bu de dag yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbyed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byed pa po gcig gis las dang 'bras bu de dag yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // byed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the one agent does not hold the action and effect.üîΩBecause the agent is not related to the effect,

original: byas pa chung zos pa dang byed pa po ma yin pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //üîΩshin tu 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur//üîΩ@247a * // zhes bya ba ni de lta bu ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩde ltar re zhig 'jug pa khas blangs nas byas pa chud zos pa dang byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod nas /üîΩda ni gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs bkod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbdag med smra pa'i phyogs la yang //
analyzed: byas pa chung zos pa dang byed pa po ma yin pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //üîΩshin tu 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur//üîΩ@247a * // zhes bya ba ni de lta bu ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩde ltar re zhig 'jug pa khas blangs nas byas pa chud zos pa dang byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod nas /üîΩda ni gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs bkod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbdag med smra pa'i phyogs la yang //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pa na bdag med pa nyid khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pa na bdag med pa nyid khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: When one accepts that all things are momentary, one accepts that they are essenceless.

original: rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis thams cad rang dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta yin na rtog pa dang ldan par bya ba la 'jug pa'i dang po nyid du ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis thams cad rang dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta yin na rtog pa dang ldan par bya ba la 'jug pa'i dang po nyid du ste /
translated: Because all things are not independent due to being dependent on other causes.üîΩThus, one who is endowed with understanding first engages in ascertaining that

original: sngar rtogs te nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sngar rtogs te nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It is the realization of the former, and it is the ascertainment of the latter.

original: de ci zhig ce na kho bo zhig pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na kho bo zhig pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is that? It is stated that

original: kho bo zhig pas phyis bdag gi 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: kho bo zhig pas phyis bdag gi 'bras bu med de /
translated: since I have ceased, later there is no effect of mine.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time the effect arises, I do not exist.

original: ci ste yang 'bras bu yod na de'i tshe kho bo las skad cig gzhan la yod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'bras bu yod na de'i tshe kho bo las skad cig gzhan la yod do snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that if the effect exists, then at that time I exist in another moment,

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: then one who is endowed with understanding would not engage in ascertaining that.

original: 'jug pa sngon du 'gro pa can gyi las kyis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'jug pa sngon du 'gro pa can gyi las kyis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the arising of an effect generated by an action that precedes it?

original: de ni mi srid pa nyid kyi ring ba nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi srid pa nyid kyi ring ba nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is far removed by its impossibility, it does not endure.

original: de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the relation between action and effect is untenable.

original: da ni gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdngos rnams bya ba byed nus pa //
analyzed: da ni gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir / dngos rnams bya ba byed nus pa //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the status of cause and effect is untenable according to the system of the young brahmin,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThings that are able to perform a function . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: de srid kyi zhes bya ba ni skyes nas dus ji srid du 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i dus de srid du mi gnas te /
analyzed: de srid kyi zhes bya ba ni skyes nas dus ji srid du 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i dus de srid du mi gnas te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor as long as it exists‚Äù means that for as long as it exists, having arisen, and for as long as it establishes the effect, for that long it does not endure, because it is momentary.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩma 'ongs pa min zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no // ma 'ongs pa min zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the idea.üîΩIn order to prove the above, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not the future . . . ,‚Äù and so on, in order.üîΩIn order to prove the above, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not the future . . . ,‚Äù and so on, in order.

original: bdag nyid ma thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which has not yet arisen‚Äù and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi de nyid ma thob pa gang yin pa la brjod la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi de nyid ma thob pa gang yin pa la brjod la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe future‚Äù refers to that which has not yet obtained its reality.

original: gang yang bdag gi de nyid ma thob pa de yang med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi de nyid ma thob pa de yang med pa yin la /
translated: And that which has not yet obtained its reality does not exist.

original: med pa gang yin pa de yang nus pa ma lus pas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de yang nus pa ma lus pas stong pa yin no //
translated: And that which does not exist is empty of all capacity.

original: gang nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba de ji ltar gzhan gyi yan lag tu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba de ji ltar gzhan gyi yan lag tu rtogs par byed de /
translated: How can that which is devoid of all capacity be conceived as a part of something else?

original: gzhan la rgyu yi dngos por 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la rgyu yi dngos por 'gyur //
translated: It would be the cause of something else.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nus pa kho na rgyu'i @247b dngos pos nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa kho na rgyu'i @247b dngos pos nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because only capacity is ascertained as the nature of a cause.

original: de bzhin du zhig pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhig pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, since cessation is empty of all capacity,

original: gzhan gyi yan lag tu brtag min //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yan lag tu brtag min //
translated: it should not be conceived as a part of something else.

original: zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: zhes 'brel te /
translated: This is the connection.

original: gang 'bras bu bya ba dang 'bras bu byed par nus par 'gyur ba da ltar yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu bya ba dang 'bras bu byed par nus par 'gyur ba da ltar yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not present now as having the capacity to perform the action that is the effect of that cause is not a cause.

original: gzhan yang gal te skad cig snga ma rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes rtog par byed na de'i tshe rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir phyis kyi skad cig skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te skad cig snga ma rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes rtog par byed na de'i tshe rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir phyis kyi skad cig skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you think that the prior instant ceases without transitioning to the later instant, then the later instant would not arise because there would be no reason for it to arise.

original: 'di snyam du dper na srang mda'i mthon dman dang mtshungs pa yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'jig pa dang skye ba dag kyang 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na srang mda'i mthon dman dang mtshungs pa yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'jig pa dang skye ba dag kyang 'dod de /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúJust as the ascending and descending sides of a scale are simultaneous, so too cause and effect arise and cease simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir da ltar byung ba ma zhig pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar byung ba ma zhig pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because we assert that the effect arises from the present cause that has not ceased,

original: de rgyu mtshan med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de rgyu mtshan med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: the later instant would not arise without a reason.‚Äù

original: skye dang 'jig pa dus mtshungs na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa dus mtshungs na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If arising and ceasing were simultaneous,üîΩthen arising and ceasing would be the same.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dus mtshungs na yang ste 'dra bar rtog na yang 'jig pa dang skye ba dag gam /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dus mtshungs na yang ste 'dra bar rtog na yang 'jig pa dang skye ba dag gam /
translated: If you think that arising and ceasing are simultaneous, then arising and ceasing would be the same.

original: de dang ldan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du yod pa ste srid pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: de dang ldan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du yod pa ste srid pa ma yin te ;
translated: That which possesses it does not exist as cause and effect,

original: de dag ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not mutually dependent.

original: ji ltar ltos pa med ce na //üîΩde yi bya ba ma 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar ltos pa med ce na // de yi bya ba ma 'dzin phyir //
translated: How are they not mutually dependent?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde'i ste 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / de'i ste 'jig pa'am /
translated: Because it does not grasp its activity.üîΩThat is, because the activity of that which is perishing

original: de dang ldan pa'i bya bas 'bras bu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i bya bas 'bras bu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or that which possesses it does not grasp the effect, because it does not grasp it.

original: 'dzin pa ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir te bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir te bya ba med do //
translated: Grasping is not its nature, so it does not have activity.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ni 'bras bu yod pa'i dus su nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ba med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ni 'bras bu yod pa'i dus su nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ba med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that the thing that is asserted as the cause does not exist at the time the effect exists.

original: 'di snyam du bya ba med na yang de ma thag tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bya ba med na yang de ma thag tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even without activity, the state of being cause and effect is merely sequential,

original: bum pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe form of a vase,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gang zhig gang gi de ma thag tu skye ba de de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig gang gi de ma thag tu skye ba de de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If something arises immediately after something else, then the former is the effect of the latter.

original: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i gzugs kyi skad cig gi de ma thag tu rigs 'dra ba'i gzugs kyi skad cig bzhin du tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi dri la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir de yang de'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i gzugs kyi skad cig gi de ma thag tu rigs 'dra ba'i gzugs kyi skad cig bzhin du tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi dri la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir de yang de'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, immediately after the moment of form that is the basis for the conception of a pot, a moment of form of the same type arises, and so on up to smell, taste, and tactility that are included in that same assemblage. Therefore, smell and so on would be the effect of that moment of form.

original: de ma thag yin na yang de'i 'bras bur mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ma thag yin na yang de'i 'bras bur mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not accept that something is an effect merely because it arises immediately after something else.üîΩOthers think that the cause of a particular effect is not the cause of another effect because the effects arise in a specific order. The cause of a particular effect is not the cause of another effect because the causes are different.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: The same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is true of other forms.

original: gzugs gzhan la yang de bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rigs 'dra ba'i gzugs kyi skad cig @248a * //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan la yang de bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rigs 'dra ba'i gzugs kyi skad cig @248a * //
translated: The same is true of other forms.üîΩThe same is

original: gzhan ni gzugs kyi de ma thag pa tsam gyis de'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzugs kyi de ma thag pa tsam gyis de'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The other is not to be grasped as the effect of that mere immediately preceding condition.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de ma thag pa tsam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de ma thag pa tsam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, since it is not reasonable to posit mere immediately preceding condition as the reason for the relation of cause and effect,

original: rang gi phyogs nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the author now teaches this by way of summarizing his own position.

original: mjug thogs 'byung ba tsam ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mjug thogs 'byung ba tsam ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot merely arising in immediate succession‚Äù means

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: that it is not the reason for positing the relation of cause and effect.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the above explanation in brief,

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúThis is the brief explanation‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di la rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two interpretations of this.

original: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung ngam /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung ngam /
translated: Does the effect arise from the disintegration of the cause?

original: ma zhig pa las 'byung /
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'byung /
translated: It arises from what has not yet ceased.

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no entity apart from what has ceased and what has not yet ceased.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the first position is not tenable,

original: zhig pa ni med pa nyid kyis de las skye bar khas len pa na ;
analyzed: zhig pa ni med pa nyid kyis de las skye bar khas len pa na ;
translated: because if it is accepted that what has ceased, which is nonexistent, arises from that,

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that the effect would be without a cause.

original: de lta yin dang rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that it would always exist and so on.

original: gnyis pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The second is also not tenable,

original: skad cig ma du mar gnas pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams skad cig ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma du mar gnas pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams skad cig ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that entities would not be momentary, since they would endure for many moments.

original: ji ltar nyams par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams par 'gyur ba min //
translated: How could it not be damaged?

original: zhes bya ba ni nyams pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyams pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is damaged.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dang por dngos po skye'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dang por dngos po skye'o /
translated: Thus, first of all, an entity arises.

original: de nas bya ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas bya ba la 'jug go //
translated: Then it engages in action.

original: de las 'bras bu bskyed nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu dngos po gcig la skad cig ma du ma yod pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu bskyed nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu dngos po gcig la skad cig ma du ma yod pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because many moments exist for a single thing, momentariness is undermined.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad par bstan nas de'i rtog pa po'i tshad ma mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad par bstan nas de'i rtog pa po'i tshad ma mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus shown that the state of being cause and effect is untenable, to demonstrate that the valid cognition that conceives of that is untenable, he says:

original: skad cig gnas pa'i bum pa sogs //
analyzed: skad cig gnas pa'i bum pa sogs //
translated: A vase, etc. that endures for an instant

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin la /
