translated: Direct perception and non-observation establish the state of being cause and effect.

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na rang gi shes pa'i dus su yang mi gnas pa'i phyir dngos po de mngon sum yin pa kho na ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mtshungs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na rang gi shes pa'i dus su yang mi gnas pa'i phyir dngos po de mngon sum yin pa kho na ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mtshungs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if things are momentary, they do not endure even at the time of their cognition, and so that thing is direct perception itself, because it is untenable that the state of being cause and effect is simultaneous.

original: de lta yin dang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag med pa kho na'o //
translated: If that were the case, then direct perception and non-observation would not exist at all.

original: gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis ngo bo yin pa @248b yang mngon sum gyi bye brag gis bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis ngo bo yin pa @248b yang mngon sum gyi bye brag gis bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the nature of a thing that is observed as a unique particular, it is also a type of direct perception.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dmigs pa med na de yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dmigs pa med na de yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the observation of a thing is untenable,

original: ji ltar mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub byed du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub byed du 'gyur /
translated: how could direct perception and nonobservation serve as proof for the existence of cause and effect?

original: dngos po dmigs pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dag mtshams sbyor ba gcig pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam par 'jig pa'i byed pa sus //
analyzed: dngos po dmigs pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dag mtshams sbyor ba gcig pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rnam par 'jig pa'i byed pa sus //
translated: Even if one grants that a thing is observed, still, since there is no connection between the prior and subsequent moments, the connection is not established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩshes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / shes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:üîΩBy what means does it disintegrate?üîΩCognition refers to observation.

original: 'di ni rim pa dang ldan pa yang yin la shes pa yang yin pas rim ldan shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rim pa dang ldan pa yang yin la shes pa yang yin pas rim ldan shes pa'o //
translated: Since it is a sequence and it is cognition, it is a sequential cognition.

original: de dag sus mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag sus mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Who connects them?

original: sbyor bar byed pa de sus kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa de sus kyang ma yin no //
translated: That which connects them does not exist at all.

original: gal te la la me 'di dmigs pas du ba la sogs pa 'di dmigs la /
analyzed: gal te la la me 'di dmigs pas du ba la sogs pa 'di dmigs la /
translated: If one thinks that because fire is observed, smoke and so on are observed,

original: 'di ma dmigs na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rim pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa la byed po gcig gis mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ma dmigs na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rim pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa la byed po gcig gis mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur na /
translated: and if one thinks that when it is not observed, it is not observed, then the cognition that possesses such a process would be connected by a single agent.

original: de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na khyed kyi lugs kyis mtshams sbyor ba po de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na khyed kyi lugs kyis mtshams sbyor ba po de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If at that time the state of cause and effect were established, then in your system, since that which connects them does not exist, the state of cause and effect would not be established. This is the point.

original: da ni ngo shes pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo shes pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that recognition is untenable, he says:

original: skad cig gis 'jig ces bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig gis 'jig ces bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: If it is said that it is momentary, etc.

original: ngas sngon mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid da lta mthong ba 'di yin no snyam pa de lta bu'i snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba dag yul gcig pa nyid dang / shes pa po gcig pa nyid du go ba de ni ngo shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ngas sngon mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid da lta mthong ba 'di yin no snyam pa de lta bu'i snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba dag yul gcig pa nyid dang / shes pa po gcig pa nyid du go ba de ni ngo shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the recognition of the object that was seen before and is seen now, the understanding that the former seeing and the later seeing have the same object and the same seer.

original: de yang dngos po thams cad skad cig mar 'jig pa nyid yin na mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang dngos po thams cad skad cig mar 'jig pa nyid yin na mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is not tenable if all things are momentary.

original: shes pa po dang shes par bya ba gcig po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa po dang shes par bya ba gcig po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no single thing that is both seer and seen.

original: lha spyin gyis mthong ba'i don khyab 'jug bshes gnyen gyis ngo shes pa ni med do //
analyzed: lha spyin gyis mthong ba'i don khyab 'jug bshes gnyen gyis ngo shes pa ni med do //
translated: It is not the case that Vi·π£·πáu, the friend of Indra, recognizes the object seen by Devadatta.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don du ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby another person‚Äù is used to illustrate.

original: don gzhan ngo shes par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ngo shes par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not the case that one recognizes another object.

original: 'on te skra dang sen mo la sogs bregs pa yang skyes pa rnams bzhin du tha dad pa na yang 'dra ba'i phyir ngo shes par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'on te skra dang sen mo la sogs bregs pa yang skyes pa rnams bzhin du tha dad pa na yang 'dra ba'i phyir ngo shes par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: But if the hair, nails, etc. that have been cut off are like those that have grown, they are the same, so recognition would occur.

original: shes pa gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is only one consciousness,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te shes pa po gcig tu 'gyur na de'i tshe mtshams sbyor ba po'i dbang gis shes bya tha dad na yang 'dra bas byas pa'i ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa po gcig tu 'gyur na de'i tshe mtshams sbyor ba po'i dbang gis shes bya tha dad na yang 'dra bas byas pa'i ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the one who knows were to be one, then at the time of the connection, the object of knowledge would be different, but because of the similarity, recognition would occur.

original: tha dad na ni @249a * //
analyzed: tha dad na ni @249a * //
translated: If they are different,

original: ste shes pa po dang shes bya gnyis tha dad pa ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: ste shes pa po dang shes bya gnyis tha dad pa ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: then the one who knows and the object of knowledge are different.

original: de lta yin na ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If that were so, there would be no reason for recognition.üîΩMoreover, if there is no single person at all who connects,

original: gzhan yang mtshams sbyor pa po'i skyes bu gcig po 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshams sbyor pa po'i skyes bu gcig po 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: gang 'di ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mthong ba na gzugs de med na mi 'byung ba'i dri dang ro la sogs pa la dran pa sngon du song ba'i 'dod pa dang longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa der ji ltar 'gyur te
analyzed: gang 'di ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mthong ba na gzugs de med na mi 'byung ba'i dri dang ro la sogs pa la dran pa sngon du song ba'i 'dod pa dang longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa der ji ltar 'gyur te
translated: When one sees the form of a mango fruit, for example, how could one engage in desire and enjoyment of the smell, taste, etc. that do not occur without that form, since one has not previously experienced them?

original: / gzhan gyis mthong ba la gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan gyis mthong ba la gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For one does not desire, etc. what another has seen.

original: bcings pa dang thar par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsrid pa'i btson dar  zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / srid pa'i btson dar  zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate that one would not be bound or liberated, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that one is bound or liberated in cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas bcings pa'i skad cig kyang gzhan yin la grol ba yang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa ma yin te srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsrid pa'i btson ra zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas bcings pa'i skad cig kyang gzhan yin la grol ba yang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa ma yin te srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // srid pa'i btson ra zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not tenable that the moment bound by attachment, etc. is one and the moment liberated is another.üîΩ‚ÄúThe prison of cyclic existence‚Äù means

original: srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: cyclic existence is a prison.

original: de nyid btson ra ste /
analyzed: de nyid btson ra ste /
translated: That itself is a prison.

original: 'ching ba ni btson dong ngo //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni btson dong ngo //
translated: The prison is the bondage.

original: thar pa don du gnyer ba'i 'bad pa yang don med pa yin te /
analyzed: thar pa don du gnyer ba'i 'bad pa yang don med pa yin te /
translated: The effort to strive for liberation is also pointless,

original: thar pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no liberation.

original: gang phyir bcings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang phyir bcings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no one who is bound,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te ma bcings pa kho na thar bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'on te ma bcings pa kho na thar bar 'gyur mod /
translated: But if one who is not bound is liberated,

original: de lta bas na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: then what is the contradiction here?

original: lcags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIron and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: bcings pa gang yin pa de nyid grol lo zhes 'jig rten na grags pa dang / mthong ba yin te /üîΩma bcings ba grol lo zhes dam bca' ba ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcings pa gang yin pa de nyid grol lo zhes 'jig rten na grags pa dang / mthong ba yin te / ma bcings ba grol lo zhes dam bca' ba ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the world, it is well known and seen that one who is bound is liberated.üîΩThe thesis that one who is not bound is liberated is undermined by what is well known in the world and by perception.

original: dam bca' ba mngon sum dang grags pa dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' ba mngon sum dang grags pa dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus he thinks that the thesis contradicts perception and what is well known in the world.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang bshad pa ni /
translated: He also explains the contradiction with inference.

original: bcings pa dang grol ba de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcings pa dang grol ba de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThose that are bound and liberated‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang bcings pa dang thar pa yin pa de dag ni gzhi gcig yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang bcings pa dang thar pa yin pa de dag ni gzhi gcig yin te /
translated: The application is this: those that are bound and liberated are one basis,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bcings pa dang thar pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bcings pa dang thar pa dag bzhin no //
translated: like worldly bondage and liberation.

original: rtsod ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i bag la nyal dang de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid de dag kyang bcings pa dang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i bag la nyal dang de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid de dag kyang bcings pa dang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The characteristics of the latent afflictions that are the basis of dispute and being free from them are also bondage and liberation. This is a natural inference.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to bondage and liberation.

original: de ltar gnas phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of abiding in that way‚Äù means because of abiding in the nature of bondage and liberation.

original: bcings pa dang thar pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir @249b ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir @249b ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they have the nature of bondage and liberation.

original: de lta bas na gzhi gcig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhi gcig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of being established as having the same basis,

original: thams cad de las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa shin tu mdzes par gnas te /
analyzed: thams cad de las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs pa shin tu mdzes par gnas te /
translated: Everything is very beautiful in this way, such as the relation between action and result.

original: shin tu rigs pa dang ldan par gnas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: shin tu rigs pa dang ldan par gnas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that everything is very reasonable.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no fault as explained above.

original: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
translated: By these very modes,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the meaning is this.

original: byed pa po gcig med pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i dran pa dang / nges pa dang / rang gis bcol ba len pa la sogs pa mi srid par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig med pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i dran pa dang / nges pa dang / rang gis bcol ba len pa la sogs pa mi srid par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because there is no single agent, it should be understood that memory, ascertainment, taking up what was entrusted, and so on, as previously explained, are impossible.

original: de la yang gzhi tha dad pa nyid yin na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhi tha dad pa nyid yin na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if there were a difference in the basis, it would follow that there would be a contradiction with seeing and so on.

original: nag pas nyams su myong ba dang / the tshom za ba dang / bcol ba dang / 'dod pa dag la byams ldan gyis dran pa dang / nges pa dang / len pa dang / tshor ngas dang bral ba la sogs pa srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nag pas nyams su myong ba dang / the tshom za ba dang / bcol ba dang / 'dod pa dag la byams ldan gyis dran pa dang / nges pa dang / len pa dang / tshor ngas dang bral ba la sogs pa srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For Maitreya, who has experienced, doubted, been entrusted, and desired, memory, ascertainment, taking up, and so on are impossible.

original: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He responds to this with ‚ÄúEven though there is no self, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa yin na yang dngos po rnams la las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du rab tu dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa yin na yang dngos po rnams la las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du rab tu dbye ba yin la /
translated: Even though there is no self, the presentation of the relationship between action and effect with regard to things is the classification of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa na yang thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa na yang thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: And even though there is the reality of cause and effect, there is no contradiction with anything at all, so nothing is lost.

original: 'di snyam du bdag med na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa de nyid mi 'thad de snyam du dogs pa la /üîΩmyu gu sogs la sa bon sogs //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag med na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa de nyid mi 'thad de snyam du dogs pa la / myu gu sogs la sa bon sogs //
translated: If you think that even though there is no self, the determination of cause and effect is still untenable,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though there is no self, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byin gyis rlob pa po'i bdag med na yang sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa nus pa nges pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar byin gyis rlob pa po'i bdag med na yang sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa nus pa nges pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as, even though there is no self that is the consecrator, there is a definite capacity of seeds, etc., with regard to sprouts, etc., so it is with internal things.

original: sa bon la sogs pa ni lus bzhin du longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyi bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa ni lus bzhin du longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyi bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The self does not consecrate the body as a basis for the enjoyment of such things as seeds, as it does the body.

original: de lta ma yin na gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /üîΩsrog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te / srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad de /
translated: If it were otherwise, then this living body would not be without self,üîΩbecause it would follow that it would not possess life, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ngo zhes grags pa'i ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ngo zhes grags pa'i ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not tenable, because the syllogism that has the form of a counter-pervasion, ‚ÄúThe living body is not without self, because it possesses life, etc.,‚Äù would not be established, since it is well known that when the self is eliminated in such things as a pot, life, etc., are also seen to be eliminated.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang bdag dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang bdag dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: If such things as a pot were to possess a self,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di ldog pa can du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di ldog pa can du 'gyur /
translated: then how could this syllogism have the form of a counter-pervasion?

original: rjes 'gro'i bdag dang bral ba na 'ang //
analyzed: rjes 'gro'i bdag dang bral ba na 'ang //
translated: Even when it is devoid of the self that is the counter-pervasion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig dang bral na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig dang bral na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that even when it is devoid of some nature that is a counter-pervasion.

original: yang na gnas pa 'di gang yin @250a * //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa 'di gang yin @250a * //
translated: Or, what is this ‚Äúabiding‚Äù?

original: zhe na / dngos sam yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩji ltar phyi rol gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa nges pa de bzhin du nang gi 'du byed kyi phung po la yang rgyu'i nus pa nges pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'ga' zhig las skad cig brgyud pas 'dod pa dang mi 'dod
analyzed: zhe na / dngos sam yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji ltar phyi rol gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa nges pa de bzhin du nang gi 'du byed kyi phung po la yang rgyu'i nus pa nges pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'ga' zhig las skad cig brgyud pas 'dod pa dang mi 'dod
translated: Whether it is direct or indirect, etc.

original: pa'i nges pa'i 'bras bu gsal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i nges pa'i 'bras bu gsal por 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the external presentation of cause and effect is certain, so too the power of the internal causes of the aggregates of compositional activity is certain. From some virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, a definite effect that is either desirable or undesirable will clearly arise through a continuum of moments.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa las dran pa dang the tshom las nges pa dang bcol ba las len pa dang / 'dod pa las don mthong ba dang / de las tshor ngas dang bral ba zhes bya ba thams cad 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa las dran pa dang the tshom las nges pa dang bcol ba las len pa dang / 'dod pa las don mthong ba dang / de las tshor ngas dang bral ba zhes bya ba thams cad 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the following: memory from experiencing form and so on, certainty from doubt, ascertainment from a challenge, seeing the object from desire, and feeling and separation from that.

original: sangs rgyas pa dag la ni dngos po gcig rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis dran pa la sogs pa gang du yang ma grags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag la ni dngos po gcig rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis dran pa la sogs pa gang du yang ma grags so //
translated: For Buddhists, memory and so on are not renowned in any way as the same entity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWell then, what are they?‚Äù

original: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam ste /
translated: They are mere conditionality.

original: ji skad du las yod do //
analyzed: ji skad du las yod do //
translated: Karma exists.

original: 'bras bu yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod do //
translated: Its result exists.

original: chos su brdar btags pa las ma gtogs pa phung po 'di dor nas phung po gzhan len pa gang yin pa'i byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
analyzed: chos su brdar btags pa las ma gtogs pa phung po 'di dor nas phung po gzhan len pa gang yin pa'i byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
translated: Apart from the imputation of phenomena, I do not see any agent that casts aside these aggregates and takes up other aggregates.

original: de la chos su brdar brtags pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la chos su brdar brtags pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The imputation of phenomena is as follows:

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: If this exists, that occurs.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because this arises, that arises.

original: de'i phyir las 'bras la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir las 'bras la sogs pa'i //
translated: Therefore, karma, its result, and so on

original: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras dran pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras dran pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúkarma, its result, and so on‚Äù includes memory and so on.

original: 'brel pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The relation is that of producer and produced.

original: 'o na gal te de lta na ji ltar 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las gang zag de dang de'i dbang du byas nas 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta na ji ltar 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las gang zag de dang de'i dbang du byas nas 'di nyid kyis byas pa'i las su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that in the world and in the treatises, it is said that ‚Äúin dependence on this person, this karma is performed and this person experiences its result‚Äù?

original: byed pa po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byed pa po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe agent and so on are imputed in dependence on the aggregates.‚Äù

original: mi shes pa'i rab rib kyi tshogs shin tu chen pos ye shes kyi snang ba nyams par byas pa'i 'jig rten pa bdag la de nyid dang / gzhan nyid yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa spangs nas khyad par can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i ngo bo nges pa'i rgyun gcig nyid du nges nas de nyid 'di yin pa dang bdag gis byed do zhes tha snyad byed pa dang /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i rab rib kyi tshogs shin tu chen pos ye shes kyi snang ba nyams par byas pa'i 'jig rten pa bdag la de nyid dang / gzhan nyid yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa spangs nas khyad par can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i ngo bo nges pa'i rgyun gcig nyid du nges nas de nyid 'di yin pa dang bdag gis byed do zhes tha snyad byed pa dang /
translated: The Lord, the Transcendent Destroyer and Possessor, the Thusly Gone One, in order to protect the person to be trained from falling into the view of annihilation, taught a single cause from the perspective of the manifest pride of the worldly person whose vision of wisdom is impaired by the great mass of the mists of ignorance, who has abandoned the analysis of existence and nonexistence, and who, having ascertained the nature of the entity of cause and effect as a single continuum, engages in the conventions ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù and ‚ÄúI did this.‚Äù

original: thar pa'i don du yang 'jug pa de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi ngor bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bya'i skye bo chad pa'i lta bar ltung ba las bsrung ba'i don du rgyu gcig tu ston pa na byed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa
analyzed: thar pa'i don du yang 'jug pa de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi ngor bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bya'i skye bo chad pa'i lta bar ltung ba las bsrung ba'i don du rgyu gcig tu ston pa na byed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa
translated: He also taught a single cause for the sake of engaging in the purpose of liberation.

original: mdzad do // rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par bzhag pa nyid las dngos po grub po zhe na /
analyzed: mdzad do // rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par bzhag pa nyid las dngos po grub po zhe na /
translated: If you think that entities are established from just that kind of presentation, then no.

original: de nyid @250b gnas la yan lag min //
analyzed: de nyid @250b gnas la yan lag min //
translated: It is not a part of the reality.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Thus he says.

original: byis pa'i skye bo de kho na nyid brtag pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pas kun rdzob tu ltung ba rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo de kho na nyid brtag pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pas kun rdzob tu ltung ba rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: Since childish beings are averse to investigating reality, they fall into the superficial. Due to the power of their adherence, they are unable to posit reality.

original: de'i mngon par zhen pa la ni bdag med pa'i skad cig 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mngon par zhen pa la ni bdag med pa'i skad cig 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For their adherence is undermined by the validating cognitions which establish the momentariness and selflessness of things.

original: sa bon la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid dang / bral bar ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid dang / bral bar ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the existence of a self which is the same as or different from the seed, etc. is not established,

original: dpe ma grub par grags par sems pa na gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dpe ma grub par grags par sems pa na gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: if one thinks that the example is not established, one should be apprehensive of the criticism of others.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúThe non-pervading, etc.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Pervading is the same as pervading.

original: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome nature‚Äù is the remainder.

original: 'di snyam du sa bon la sogs pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sa bon la sogs pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba yod pa kho na ste /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúEven seeds and so on have parts,

original: byis pas de la yang sa bon la sogs pa'i cha shas gang yin pa de dag kyang bkod pa snga ma yongs su btang nas bkod pa gzhan 'thob ste /
analyzed: byis pas de la yang sa bon la sogs pa'i cha shas gang yin pa de dag kyang bkod pa snga ma yongs su btang nas bkod pa gzhan 'thob ste /
translated: because the parts of those seeds and so on are arranged in a previous way, and then they give up that previous arrangement and obtain another arrangement.

original: bkod pa gzhan thob pa na yang sa'i khams chu'i khams kyis bzung nas nang mes smin pa na ro'i rdzas sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: bkod pa gzhan thob pa na yang sa'i khams chu'i khams kyis bzung nas nang mes smin pa na ro'i rdzas sgrub par byed la /
translated: When they obtain another arrangement, the earth element is held by the water element, and when it is ripened by the inner fire, it produces the substance of the sprout.

original: ro dang bcas pa'i snga ma'i cha shas dag dang lhan cig myu gu la sogs pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed do zhes smras pa /
analyzed: ro dang bcas pa'i snga ma'i cha shas dag dang lhan cig myu gu la sogs pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed do zhes smras pa /
translated: Together with the previous parts that have that taste, it produces the entity of the sprout and so on.‚Äù

original: des na ji ltar de la cha shas phra mo yang med do zhes rjod par byed snyam na /üîΩzhing sogs khyad par med pa na ;
analyzed: des na ji ltar de la cha shas phra mo yang med do zhes rjod par byed snyam na / zhing sogs khyad par med pa na ;
translated: In that case, one might think, ‚ÄúHow can it be said that it has no subtle parts?‚Äù

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text says, ‚ÄúIf the parts are not different from the whole,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa phyis dbyibs 'jug pa na snga ma'i rang gi rang bzhin ma btang ba kho nar 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa phyis dbyibs 'jug pa na snga ma'i rang gi rang bzhin ma btang ba kho nar 'jug na /
translated: If the shape of earth and so on is later engaged in without relinquishing its prior intrinsic nature,

original: de'i tshe de dag gis ngar gyi bkod pa btang ba dang / bkod pa gzhan thob pa po mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gis ngar gyi bkod pa btang ba dang / bkod pa gzhan thob pa po mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is untenable that it would relinquish its prior shape and obtain another shape.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Because it would be of the same nature as before.

original: de lta yin dang sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, seed and sprout and so on would not be mutually different,

original: rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be of the same nature.

original: ci ste myu gu la sogs pa tha dad du khas len par byed na de'i tshe nges par zhing la sogs pa snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa na bkod pa snga ma btang nas bkod pa gzhan thob par yang khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci ste myu gu la sogs pa tha dad du khas len par byed na de'i tshe nges par zhing la sogs pa snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa na bkod pa snga ma btang nas bkod pa gzhan thob par yang khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
translated: But if you accept that seed and sprout and so on are mutually different, then you must accept that they definitely relinquish their prior nature and that they relinquish their prior shape and obtain another shape.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be mutually different.

original: de lta bas na rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nyid gal yod /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nyid gal yod /
translated: Thus, since the nature of things is to arise from other, the principle of causality is tenable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrubs pa na las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs @251a * //üîΩpa thams cad 'thad pa yin la sun 'byin pa yang mi 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrubs pa na las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la sogs @251a * // pa thams cad 'thad pa yin la sun 'byin pa yang mi 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the status of cause and effect is established, the connection between karma and its effects and so on are all tenable.üîΩThe refutation of the essential existence of karma and its effects is untenable.

original: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i yod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i yod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to establish the existence of karma and its effects,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bsgrub pa la gzhan gyis 'bad pa bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bsgrub pa la gzhan gyis 'bad pa bya ste /
translated: others should strive to establish cause and effect.

original: dam pa'i gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni mchog yin pa ste sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam pa'i gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni mchog yin pa ste sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is best to follow the scriptures of the holy ones, which is to say, it is best to be a Buddhist.

original: de dag gi med pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi med pa sgrub pa la gzhan gyis te mu stegs pas 'bad pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi med pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi med pa sgrub pa la gzhan gyis te mu stegs pas 'bad pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to establish their nonexistence, others, that is, the tƒ´rthikas, should strive to establish the nonexistence of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa la zhes bya ba 'di lan gnyis su bzlas la gcig la dgag pa'i tshig dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa la zhes bya ba 'di lan gnyis su bzlas la gcig la dgag pa'i tshig dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto establish cause and effect‚Äù is repeated twice, and the negative particle is to be supplied to the first occurrence of the phrase.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis byas pa'i zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang dag yin pa de bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis byas pa'i zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang dag yin pa de bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The point of this argument is to show that all of the opponent‚Äôs assertions about the existence of postmortem existence and nonexistence, etc., are based on the establishment of cause and effect.

original: de la brjod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la brjod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this argument, the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe object to be expressed, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyu ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma zhig pa kho na las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi phyogs yin no //
translated: The point of this statement is that the opponent‚Äôs position is that the effect arises only from the nonceased cause.

original: cig car bar thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car bar thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the absurd consequence follows that the effect arises all at once.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang por byung ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid thob pa ma zhig pa kho na la brten nas skad cig gnyis pa la 'bras bu skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang por byung ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid thob pa ma zhig pa kho na la brten nas skad cig gnyis pa la 'bras bu skye ste /
translated: This is because the effect arises in the second moment in dependence on the cause that has arisen in the first moment and has not yet ceased.

original: de yang de ltar skye ba na ma zhig pa nyid las skye ste skad cig ma dang po la de ma zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de ltar skye ba na ma zhig pa nyid las skye ste skad cig ma dang po la de ma zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, when it arises in this way, it arises from that which has not yet ceased, because at the first moment it has not yet ceased.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus su rgyu rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin te /üîΩskad cig ma nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i dus su rgyu rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin te / skad cig ma nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does the cause follow after the effect, because it does not endure due to momentariness.

original: rjes su 'jug pa yin na yang de ni de'i dus na rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa yin na yang de ni de'i dus na rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even if it did follow after, it would not be a cause at that time,

original: de'i 'bras bu grub pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu grub pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function with regard to the effect that has already been established.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that it does not perform any function at all is:

original: skyes zin pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: skyes zin pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúEven when it has arisen . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: / gzhan du gnas ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / gzhan du gnas ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not exist elsewhere‚Äù means

original: gzhan du gnas par te nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du gnas par te nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: that it does not exist elsewhere, that is, it does not exist in a different place.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit would follow that . . . there would be no end‚Äù means that it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: gal te skyes pa yang bskyed par bya ba yin na de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir de ni slar yang skyed par byed par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yang bskyed par bya ba yin na de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir de ni slar yang skyed par byed par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which has arisen were also to be generated, then it would follow that it would be generated again, because there would be no difference.

original: de lta bas na skye ba rnams thug pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba rnams thug pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, there would be an infinite regress of arising.

original: rgyu rnams kyang bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin no //
translated: And causes would never be divorced from activity.

original: rgyu rnams kyang bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang bskyed par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that causes would be generated,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: de lta yin par byed ces ji ltar bye brag tu smra bas khas blangs pa bzhin gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin par byed ces ji ltar bye brag tu smra bas khas blangs pa bzhin gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would not be established as the activity of generating, as it is accepted by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @251b pas mjug bsdus nas gnas pa'i phyogs sun phyin par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @251b pas mjug bsdus nas gnas pa'i phyogs sun phyin par ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he concludes with ‚ÄúFor these reasons‚Äù and so on, demonstrating that the position of endurance is refuted.

original: khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir zhig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir zhig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: Because it is not accepted, the conception of cessation is also illogical.

original: 'di ltar gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par byed ces ji ltar bye brag tu smra bas khas blangs pa bzhin du gal te skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes khas blangs pa yin na de'i tshe rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par byed ces ji ltar bye brag tu smra bas khas blangs pa bzhin du gal te skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes khas blangs pa yin na de'i tshe rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu
translated: Thus, if you accept that the effect arises in the third moment and so on, as the Vaibhasikas assert, then the effect would arise from the disintegration of the cause.üîΩ

original: skye bar khas blangs pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar khas blangs pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if you accept that the effect arises in the third moment and so on, just as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas accept that the past causes the effect, then you would accept that the effect arises from the disintegration of the cause.

original: phyogs 'di la yang kho bo cag gi ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la yang kho bo cag gi ma yin te /
translated: This is not our position,

original: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illogical.

original: cig car bar thal bar 'gyur ba yang gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cig car bar thal bar 'gyur ba yang gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the consequence that the effect and cause would be simultaneous would apply,

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba de dag nyid kyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu 'dod pa bzhin du gal te skad cig ma dang po nyid la 'bras bu 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba de dag nyid kyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu 'dod pa bzhin du gal te skad cig ma dang po nyid la 'bras bu 'dod pa na'o //
translated: then the consequence would apply if you accept that the effect arises in the first moment, just as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas accept that coemergent causes exist.

original: de 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is also illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: med pa sngar nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa sngar nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is said that the nonexistent is not able to produce the nonexistent and so on.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba 'bras bu skyed ba na rgyu ma skyes pas sam /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba 'bras bu skyed ba na rgyu ma skyes pas sam /
translated: When coemergent causes produce their effects, they do so either before or after the effect.üîΩ

original: skyes pas skyes pa yin grang /
analyzed: skyes pas skyes pa yin grang /
translated: When coemergent causes give rise to effects, do they give rise to arisen or unarisen effects?

original: re zhig ma skyes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig ma skyes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not give rise to unarisen effects,

original: de ni 'bras bu skye ba'i sngar med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu skye ba'i sngar med pa'i phyir la /
translated: because prior to the arising of the effect, the cause does not exist.

original: med na yang nus pa mtha' dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na gang gi tshe skyes pa de'i tshe nus pa'i phyir /üîΩskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: med na yang nus pa mtha' dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro // 'o na gang gi tshe skyes pa de'i tshe nus pa'i phyir / skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And if it does not exist, it is empty of all capacity.üîΩBut when it arises, it gives rise to the effect because it has the capacity to do so.

original: nus pa'i tshe na 'bras byung phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nus pa'i tshe na 'bras byung phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it has the capacity, the effect would arise then.üîΩIf it has the capacity, the effect would arise then.

original: gal te de skyes pa'i gnas skabs na nus pa yin na de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du 'bras bu yang skyes pa'i phyir 'di nus pa gang du nye bar mkho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de skyes pa'i gnas skabs na nus pa yin na de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du 'bras bu yang skyes pa'i phyir 'di nus pa gang du nye bar mkho bar 'gyur /
translated: If it has the capacity at the time it arises, then like its own nature, the effect would also arise. So what need is there for it to have the capacity?

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car bar khas len pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car bar khas len pa ni /
translated: Thus accepting that cause and effect are simultaneous

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal lo //
translated: contradicts the valid cognition of inference.

original: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni las dang byed pa po ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni las dang byed pa po ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the entity of cause and effect the action and agent?

original: de yang dus tha dad par 'gal te /
analyzed: de yang dus tha dad par 'gal te /
translated: And that is contradictory, since they are different times.

original: bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag cig car ma yin pa na las dang byed pa po'i dngos po ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag cig car ma yin pa na las dang byed pa po'i dngos po ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Since a pot and a potter are not simultaneous, the entity of action and agent is not seen.

original: gang phyir cig car bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te sogs 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang phyir cig car bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te sogs 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba yin pa 'am /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúHow can they be simultaneous?‚ÄùüîΩIf the cause generates the effect by the mode of grasping the effect,

original: 'bras bu yang chung ma la 'khyud pa bzhin du rang gi rgyu las 'byar bas rang skyed pa'i bya ba la sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang chung ma la 'khyud pa bzhin du rang gi rgyu las 'byar bas rang skyed pa'i bya ba la sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: or if the effect, like a man embracing his wife, is established in the action of generating itself from its cause,

original: de'i tshe nges par lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges par lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then they must be simultaneous.

original: ji srid du sna tshogs pa de ni bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du sna tshogs pa de ni bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: As long as they are different, they perform their respective functions.

original: don dam par chos su brdar btags pa las ma gtogs par byed pa po 'am las 'ba' zhig yod pa ni @252a * //
analyzed: don dam par chos su brdar btags pa las ma gtogs par byed pa po 'am las 'ba' zhig yod pa ni @252a * //
translated: Apart from the mere imputation of phenomena in terms of ultimate reality, there is no such thing as an agent or action.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the general reply.

original: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means cause.

original: gal te rgyu 'am 'bras bu bya ba dang bral ba de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'am 'bras bu bya ba dang bral ba de lta yin na /
translated: If the cause and effect are devoid of activity,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar smra ba po dag me ni du ba skyed par byed la du ba ni me la brten nas skye'o zhes shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar smra ba po dag me ni du ba skyed par byed la du ba ni me la brten nas skye'o zhes shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then how is it that speakers know that fire produces smoke and smoke is produced in dependence on fire?

original: rang rgyus bslangs pa'i nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang rgyus bslangs pa'i nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the cause is restricted by its own effect.‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis kun nas bslang ba'i rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis kun nas bslang ba'i rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause is restricted by its own effect, since the power of the cause is restricted by its own effect, which is produced from its own cause and conditions.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skad cig ma dang po la byung ba'i khyad par ci 'dra ba zhe na /üîΩskad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skad cig ma dang po la byung ba'i khyad par ci 'dra ba zhe na / skad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the difference between the effect that occurs in the first moment and the one that occurs in the second moment?üîΩThe one that occurs in the second moment is the one that exists.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'byung ba ste yod pa ga la yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'byung ba ste yod pa ga la yod ces tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The one that exists in the second moment is the one that exists.

original: rgyu de 'bras bu de'i skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu de'i skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o /
translated: That cause is the producer of that effect.

original: skyed byed yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: skyed byed yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis the producer‚Äù is a synecdoche.

original: de ni de la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the phrase ‚Äúarises in dependence on that‚Äù is also included.

original: yang de ltar smra ba de dag gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ltar smra ba de dag gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, who are those who speak in this way?

original: 'dod pa tsam las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmerely by desire‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par brjod par 'dod pa las byung ba'i brda'i rjes su byed pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa po dag de ltar smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par brjod par 'dod pa las byung ba'i brda'i rjes su byed pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa po dag de ltar smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those who posit a convention that is merely a sign that arises from a desire to express, without regard to external objects, speak in this way. This is the meaning.

original: gal te dngos po skyes zin pa bya ba dang mi ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po skyes zin pa bya ba dang mi ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: If an arisen entity does not lack activity,

original: de ji ltar rgyur 'gyur zhen /üîΩskye ba las ni dus gzhan pa'i //
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyur 'gyur zhen / skye ba las ni dus gzhan pa'i //
translated: how can it be a cause?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom arising, at another time‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: rgyu yod pa'i de ma thag nyid du 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i de ma thag nyid du 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect is established immediately after the cause exists,

original: rgyu skye ba las dus phyis byung ba'i bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu skye ba las dus phyis byung ba'i bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The action that occurs later than the cause birth does not cause the effect in the least.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i bya ba zhes gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i bya ba zhes gang la bya zhe na /
translated: What is called the action of the cause?

original: gang gi mjug thogs nyid du 'bras bu skyed pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi mjug thogs nyid du 'bras bu skyed pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is the immediate antecedent of the establishment of the generation of the effect.

original: rgyu yod pa'i mjug thogs nyid du yang 'bras bu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la rag mod skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i mjug thogs nyid du yang 'bras bu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la rag mod skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since the effect occurs immediately after the cause exists, it is sufficient to say that existence is expressed by the word action. What is the use of postulating an action apart from arising?

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi bya ba med pa de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi bya ba med pa de lta yin na /
translated: If things have no action,

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu la ltos la rgyu yang 'bras bu la byed ngo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rjod par byed ce na /üîΩde ma thag par nges pa gang //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu la ltos la rgyu yang 'bras bu la byed ngo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rjod par byed ce na / de ma thag par nges pa gang //
translated: how can it be said that the effect depends on the cause and the cause depends on the effect?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThat which is ascertained as immediate‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu la ltos pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu la ltos pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is the dependence of the effect on the cause.

original: mjug thogs su 'byung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mjug thogs su 'byung ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which arises immediately after.

original: rgyu'i yang 'bras bu la bya ba ni 'di nyid yin te 'bras bu skye ba'i @252b dus su rnam pa thams cad du nye pa nyid gang yin pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang bya ba 'am /
analyzed: rgyu'i yang 'bras bu la bya ba ni 'di nyid yin te 'bras bu skye ba'i @252b dus su rnam pa thams cad du nye pa nyid gang yin pa'o // gzhan yang bya ba 'am /
translated: The cause‚Äôs activity with regard to the effect is just this: it is that which is present in every way at the time of the effect‚Äôs arising.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po 'bras bu la rgyu'i dngos po khyed cag gis de yod pa na yod pa kho na'i phyir 'bras bur gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po 'bras bu la rgyu'i dngos po khyed cag gis de yod pa na yod pa kho na'i phyir 'bras bur gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the cause‚Äôs activity or the entity that possesses the activity is grasped as the effect because it exists only when the effect exists.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag las gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag las gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: Apart from the positive and negative concomitance, there is no other means of knowing the relation of cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yin na dngos po tsam yang ci 'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por 'dzin par mi byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yin na dngos po tsam yang ci 'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por 'dzin par mi byed /
translated: Therefore, if this is the case, why do you not accept that the mere entity is the cause?

original: 'bras bu ni dngos po tsam du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid las ma grags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dngos po tsam du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid las ma grags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The effect is not renowned as merely following the positive and negative concomitance of the mere entity.

original: de'i phyir gang du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'bras bu yin par grub pa nyid de dngos po tsam mchog ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'bras bu yin par grub pa nyid de dngos po tsam mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, it is established that the effect is the mere presence of the thing, which follows the presence or absence of the cause.

original: yod pa la rag mod ces ston pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa la rag mod ces ston pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the effect is only the existence of the thing.

original: de yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù and so on.

original: kun du brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows thatüîΩthe activity of the other, both, or neither is imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.

original: gzhan nam gnyi ga 'am gnyig ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan nam gnyi ga 'am gnyig ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.

original: de ldan zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de ldan zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.

original: de yod pa na 'byung ba tsam las rgyu nyid do zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yod pa na 'byung ba tsam las rgyu nyid do zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po tsam rgyu yin la rag mod ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang gis mchog tu rjod par byed pa de la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po tsam rgyu yin la rag mod ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang gis mchog tu rjod par byed pa de la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only when it exists‚Äù shows that the activity is only the existence of the thing.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is only imagined‚Äù shows that the activity is only imagined by you.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated:

original: yod pa ste dngos po tsam nas bon la sogs pa bya ba gzhan dang ldan pas stong pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa ste dngos po tsam nas bon la sogs pa bya ba gzhan dang ldan pas stong pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The seed, etc., are empty of other, i.e., empty of an activity that is a mere thing, other than the seed, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu rnams dngos po tsam du rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du grub kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu rnams dngos po tsam du rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du grub kyi /
translated: This demonstrates that effects are established as following the concomitance and reversal of mere things,

original: bya bar rtegs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya bar rtegs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: but not as following the concomitance, etc., of activity.

original: 'di snyam du 'bras bu bya bar rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par ma grub mod kyi 'on kyang de'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'bras bu bya bar rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par ma grub mod kyi 'on kyang de'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that although it is not established that effects follow the concomitance, etc., of activity, nevertheless they become the cause of that,

original: nus pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: de lta yin na bya ba yang rgyur brtags nas gzhan yang brtag par bya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta yin na bya ba yang rgyur brtags nas gzhan yang brtag par bya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: If that were the case, then activity would also be imputed as a cause, and something else would have to be imputed.

original: nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the one that is seen and the one that is not seen.

original: de lta yin dang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir gzhan mi brtag pa de'i tshe bya ba yangs rtag par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir gzhan mi brtag pa de'i tshe bya ba yangs rtag par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you do not imagine another cause because there is no reason for it, then the activity would not always be active,

original: de la yang rgyu mtshan med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu mtshan med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no reason for that either.

original: gzhan yang bya ba 'di 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ci bya ba @253a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba 'di 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ci bya ba @253a * //
translated: Moreover, if this activity generates an effect, is it so by possessing another activity?

original: gzhan dang ldan pas sam /
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pas sam /
translated: Or is it so by mere existence?

original: 'on te yod pa tsam gyis yin gal te bya ba gzhan dang ldan pas yin na de'i tshe bya ba gzhan kho na rgyu nyid du 'gyur gyi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yod pa tsam gyis yin gal te bya ba gzhan dang ldan pas yin na de'i tshe bya ba gzhan kho na rgyu nyid du 'gyur gyi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is so by possessing another activity, then another activity alone would be the cause, not the activity.

original: de la yang bya ba gzhan rgyu nyid du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la yang bya ba gzhan rgyu nyid du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: And in that case, the objection and examination of another activity being the cause would be the same.

original: de la yang gal te bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa rgyu'i dngos por rtog par byed na de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gal te bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa rgyu'i dngos por rtog par byed na de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, if you imagine that possessing another activity is the nature of the cause, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin de'i tshe bya ba bzhin du dngos po yang yod pa tsam nyid kyis 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bya ba brtags pa don med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin de'i tshe bya ba bzhin du dngos po yang yod pa tsam nyid kyis 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bya ba brtags pa don med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: But if it is the position that it is merely existent, then, since the entity would generate the effect merely by existing, just like the activity, it is pointless to imagine the activity.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as another, etc.

original: ji ltar bya ba gzhan te bya ba gzhan myu gu yang me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyur 'dod pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan la yang mi mthun pa'i bya bas stong pa nyid rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba gzhan te bya ba gzhan myu gu yang me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyur 'dod pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan la yang mi mthun pa'i bya bas stong pa nyid rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Just as another activity, i.e., another activity, is asserted to be the cause of the effect, such as fire, in the same way, why not assert that an entity, which is empty of incompatible activity, is the cause?

original: ci ste yang dngos su bya ba 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang dngos su bya ba 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But if, in fact, the activity does not function with regard to the effect,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what does?

original: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the entity itself that possesses the activity,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: yang na dngos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na dngos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, if you say that the entity itself, etc.

original: rgyur 'dod do zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyur 'dod do zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: is the cause.üîΩIf it is the entity itself that possesses the activity that is the cause,

original: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang 'di rgyur 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po la yang 'di rgyur 'gyur ba na /
translated: then

original: bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid dper 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid dper 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Because it would possess or be devoid of other actions, it would be an example.

original: yod pa lam gtogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa lam gtogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An entity that is an existent and is an action does not exist,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: because it is not observed to have the character of being observed.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says,

original: snang rung nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: snang rung nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is suitable to appear, etc.

original: khyed cag gis ni bya ba snang rung nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: khyed cag gis ni bya ba snang rung nyid du bstan te /
translated: You have taught that action is suitable to appear.

original: ji skad du gzhon nu ma len gyis /
analyzed: ji skad du gzhon nu ma len gyis /
translated: As the young man Candrakƒ´rti says,

original: de'i phyir 'bras grub snga rol du //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras grub snga rol du //
translated: Therefore, prior to the establishment of the effect,

original: gang gi bya ba mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gi bya ba mthong gyur pa //
translated: The action that is seen

original: zhes bya ba la sogs ba bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩgzhan yang bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po de las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig gam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs ba bshad pa bzhin no // gzhan yang bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de bya ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po de las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig gam /
translated: and so on.üîΩMoreover, is that entity that is an action essentially different from that entity that possesses action?

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa zhig yin grang /
translated: Or is it not essentially different from it?

original: dngos po yod pa la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Because an existent thing has no other aspect, the conceptualization of both and neither is impossible.

original: de la gal te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is a different object, then at that time the thing would not be the cause,

original: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity that is different from it would be the cause.

original: de la yang bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it becomes the cause because it is connected with the activity,

original: ma yin te phan tshun du phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa ni 'brel par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te phan tshun du phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa ni 'brel par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because that which does not mutually benefit is not established as connected.

original: ci ste dngos pos bya ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin @253b no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos pos bya ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin @253b no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the thing benefits the activity,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also not reasonable.

original: gang gis bya ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bya ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because that which benefits the activity does not have another activity.

original: de lta ma yin na thug pa med pas na bya ba rnams nyid phan tshun byed pa'i phyir dngos po dang lhan cig bya ba 'brel pa nam yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thug pa med pas na bya ba rnams nyid phan tshun byed pa'i phyir dngos po dang lhan cig bya ba 'brel pa nam yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then since there would be an infinite regress, the action itself would be mutually dependent with the entity, and the connection between the action and the entity would never be established.

original: ci ste bya ba gzhan med pa kho nar dngos po bya bar phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba yin na de'i tshe bya ba bzhin du 'bras bu yang bya ba dang bral ba'i yod pa nyid tsam gyis ci'i phyir mi byed de /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba gzhan med pa kho nar dngos po bya bar phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba yin na de'i tshe bya ba bzhin du 'bras bu yang bya ba dang bral ba'i yod pa nyid tsam gyis ci'i phyir mi byed de /
translated: But if the entity assists the action without any other action, then at that time, just like the action, the effect would also be produced by the mere existence of the entity, without the action.

original: gang gis na bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa rtogs par byed /
analyzed: gang gis na bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa rtogs par byed /
translated: Why? By what is the action understood to be a different object?

original: 'bras bu la yang de yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa la 'gegs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang de yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa la 'gegs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And there is no obstruction to the entity assisting the effect by the mere existence of the entity.

original: de lta bas na don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical for the action to be a different object.

original: ci ste don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: ci ste don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: But if the position is that it is not a different object,

original: de'i tshe yod pa nyid bya ba yin no zhes 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa nyid bya ba yin no zhes 'grub ste /
translated: then it is established that existence itself is the action.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things is what is expressed by the term ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang skye ba las tha dad pa nyid bya bar ma grub po ;
analyzed: de lta yin dang skye ba las tha dad pa nyid bya bar ma grub po ;
translated: If that were the case, then the existence of an action that is different from arising would not be established.
