original: / gzhan yang ji ltar blo skye ba na bya ba dang bral yang yod pa tsam gyis don yongs su gcod par byed pa de ltar dngos po thams cad la yang rgyu nyid du dus phyis 'byung ba'i bya ba med na yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: / gzhan yang ji ltar blo skye ba na bya ba dang bral yang yod pa tsam gyis don yongs su gcod par byed pa de ltar dngos po thams cad la yang rgyu nyid du dus phyis 'byung ba'i bya ba med na yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di
translated: Moreover, just as when the mind arises, it comprehends its object by its mere existence, even though it is devoid of action, in the same way, even though the later arising of the action does not exist as the cause of all things, they arise.

original: ston pa ni ji ltar blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa ni ji ltar blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúJust as the mind . . . ‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe mind does not have an action that is separate from arising. Thus the S≈´tra on the Power of the Senses says, ‚ÄúThe arising of the mind of a person who is devoid of existence is direct perception.‚Äù

original: blo la skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar yod pa dang 'bral pa la skyes bu'i dbang po'i blo skye ba ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di la skye ba smos pa'i dgos pa rjod par byed pa'i gzhon
analyzed: blo la skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar yod pa dang 'bral pa la skyes bu'i dbang po'i blo skye ba ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di la skye ba smos pa'i dgos pa rjod par byed pa'i gzhon
translated: The young brahman ≈öre·πáika, who was an expounder of the S≈´tra on the Power of the Senses, was asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the purpose of saying ‚Äòarising‚Äô in this s≈´tra?‚Äù

original: nu ma len gyis /
analyzed: nu ma len gyis /
translated: He said,

original: blo ni skye ba zhes brjod la //
analyzed: blo ni skye ba zhes brjod la //
translated: The mind is said to arise.

original: skye bzhin pa na tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na tshad ma nyid //
translated: When it is arising, it is a valid cognition.

original: skye ba las ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: skye ba las ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from arising,

original: rgyu rnams bya ba mthong ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu rnams bya ba mthong ba yin //
translated: the activity of causes is seen.

original: tshad ma'ang de ltar 'gyur 'ong zhes //
analyzed: tshad ma'ang de ltar 'gyur 'ong zhes //
translated: A valid cognition is also like that.

original: de ltar skye bar brjod par 'dod //üîΩces smra'o // de'i rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar skye bar brjod par 'dod // ces smra'o // de'i rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, it is asserted that it is called arising.

original: de'i rgyu ste skye ba'i rgyu gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ste skye ba'i rgyu gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of being its cause‚Äù means that those which have a cause of that, i.e., a cause of arising, are called that.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The state of being that is just that.

original: 'di snyam du blo la bya ba med par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du blo la bya ba med par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to think that the mind does not have activity,

original: de'i dus phyis gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus phyis gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: because it does not endure after that time,

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because it is momentary.

original: ji ltar blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhow is the mind‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa nyid bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving established‚Äù means that because the destruction of all things is pervaded by momentariness, which was previously taught, it has already been established.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni blo nyid bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni blo nyid bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù means ‚Äúlike the mind.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of being momentary.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag @254a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag @254a * //
translated: The application is this:

original: skad cig ma yin pa de dag ni skye ba las tha dad pa'i bya bas stong pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa de dag ni skye ba las tha dad pa'i bya bas stong pa yin te /
translated: Those which are momentary are empty of activity different from arising,

original: blo bzhin no //
analyzed: blo bzhin no //
translated: like cognition.

original: sa bon la sogs pa la yang sdar skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin kyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa la yang sdar skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin kyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the seed, etc., have already been proven to be momentary. This is a natural inference.

original: phyis gnas pa ma yin pas rten med pa'i bya ba mi rigs pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: phyis gnas pa ma yin pas rten med pa'i bya ba mi rigs pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The subsequent non-endurance is a valid refutation, since an activity without a basis is not tenable.

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de ma thag pa tsam nyid yin gyi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de ma thag pa tsam nyid yin gyi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason for positing cause and effect is merely the antecedent, not activity. This is the conclusion.

original: gang yang rol sogs pa skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang rol sogs pa skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And the statement beginning ‚ÄúThe arising of the sprout, etc.,‚Äù is not erroneous.

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they engage in a continuum‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyun la ltos nas gzugs dang rol sogs pa phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyun la ltos nas gzugs dang rol sogs pa phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Form, taste, and so on are asserted to be mutually co-originating causes in dependence on a continuum.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nus pa 'jug pa med par ni //
analyzed: nus pa 'jug pa med par ni //
translated: Without the engagement of potency,

original: ro med de nyid gzhan gyi rgyu //
analyzed: ro med de nyid gzhan gyi rgyu //
translated: the absence of taste is the cause of another.

original: de ltar 'das dus gcig rnams rtogs //
analyzed: de ltar 'das dus gcig rnams rtogs //
translated: Thus, one understands the past.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes //
translated: That arises from the evidence of the effect.

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: That is just as explained.

original: 'on te med bzhin du res 'ga' ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu yang du ba 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te med bzhin du res 'ga' ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu yang du ba 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that sometimes smoke arises from a cow, a horse, and so on, even though it does not exist?

original: de ji ltar de ma thag pa 'khrul pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de ma thag pa 'khrul pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the antecedent condition is not mistaken?

original: gzhan gyi de ma thag byung na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de ma thag byung na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it arises from another‚Äù and so on.

original: kho bo cag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan de ma thag ba tsam yin par ni mi smra'o//
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan de ma thag ba tsam yin par ni mi smra'o//
translated: We do not say that the mere antecedent condition is the reason for understanding the relation of cause and effect.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and that which is certain.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang kho na'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang kho na'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, that which arises immediately after something is accepted as the cause of that.

original: du ba ni ba lang la sogs pa nyid kyi de ma thag tu 'byung pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: du ba ni ba lang la sogs pa nyid kyi de ma thag tu 'byung pa ni ma yin te //
translated: But smoke does not arise immediately after a cow, etc.

original: ba lang la sogs pa med na yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa med na yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because smoke exists even when a cow, etc. does not exist.

original: gzhan yang 'di la brten pa'i dngos po smra ba khyed cag la yang ci'i phyir du ba  ba lang la sogs pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung na yang de rgyu ma yin na zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la brten pa'i dngos po smra ba khyed cag la yang ci'i phyir du ba  ba lang la sogs pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung na yang de rgyu ma yin na zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this objection is applicable to you who maintain that things exist in dependence on something else: ‚ÄúWhy is it that even though smoke arises immediately after a cow, etc. , it is not the cause of that?‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhan gyis /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis /
translated: Moreover, in this regard, the opponent says:üîΩ‚ÄúIf something is the cause of something else,

original: gal te gang zhig 'bras gang la //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig 'bras gang la //
translated: then how can it be that the effect does not exist immediately after the cause?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gang la gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas rang gi phyogs la lan bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gang la gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas rang gi phyogs la lan bshad do //
translated: ‚Äù In response to this, we explain our position with the words ‚ÄúThat which is dependent on something else, etc. ‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, although things are momentary, the existence of cause and effect is established.

original: da ni de'i rtogs pa po'i tshad ma bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de'i rtogs pa po'i tshad ma bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to establish the valid knowledge that realizes that,

original: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said ‚ÄúDirect perception and so on‚Äù and so forth.

original: ji ltar khyed cag gi brtan pa'i dngos po dmigs pa yin par grub pa de ltar kho bo cag gi skad cig ma yang 'grub par @254b 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed cag gi brtan pa'i dngos po dmigs pa yin par grub pa de ltar kho bo cag gi skad cig ma yang 'grub par @254b 'gyur te /
translated: Just as you establish the observation of a stable thing, in the same way, we establish momentariness.

original: 'di ltar dngos po dmigs par 'gyur ba na /üîΩrnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po dmigs par 'gyur ba na / rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas sam /
translated: When a thing is observed,üîΩis it observed by a consciousness that has an aspect

original: rnam pa med pas yin grang /
analyzed: rnam pa med pas yin grang /
translated: or by one that does not have an aspect?

original: de la gal te rnam pa dang bcas pas yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te rnam pa dang bcas pas yin te /
translated: If it is observed by one that has an aspect,

original: de'i tshe rang gi rnam pa nyams su myong ba nyid kyi shes pa don nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir brten pa dang mi brten pa'i phyogs dag la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi rnam pa nyams su myong ba nyid kyi shes pa don nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir brten pa dang mi brten pa'i phyogs dag la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: then because the consciousness that experiences its own aspect experiences the object, there is no difference at all between the positions of the Proponents of True Images and the Proponents of False Images.

original: ci ste rnam pa med pas yin na de'i tshe lang khyad par med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa med pas yin na de'i tshe lang khyad par med pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it is because of the absence of aspects, then in that case there is no difference between the two.

original: 'di ltar gang gi dus mnyam du 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin pa rang gi rgyu snga ma dag kho na las de'i shes pa de lta bu nye bar skye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi dus mnyam du 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin pa rang gi rgyu snga ma dag kho na las de'i shes pa de lta bu nye bar skye ba yin te /
translated: In this way, the consciousness that arises from its own prior causes is the cognition of form and so on that occurs at the same time as it, and not anything else.

original: de ni de rtogs pa bdag nyid kho nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de rtogs pa bdag nyid kho nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that consciousness arises from itself alone, it is the cognition of that.

original: de'i phyir dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa khas len par byed pan brtan pa dang mi brten pa'i don la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa khas len par byed pan brtan pa dang mi brten pa'i don la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, when one accepts that consciousness is by nature the cognition of form and so on that occurs at the same time as it, there is no difference at all between the meanings of ‚Äústable‚Äù and ‚Äúunstable.‚Äù

original: gang gis dus mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs na yang gzugs la sogs pa nyid shes pas gcod kyi dbang pos ni ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba khyed cag gis rgyu snga mas byas pa nyid kyi dus mtshungs par 'byung bar nges pa'i gzugs la
analyzed: gang gis dus mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs na yang gzugs la sogs pa nyid shes pas gcod kyi dbang pos ni ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba khyed cag gis rgyu snga mas byas pa nyid kyi dus mtshungs par 'byung bar nges pa'i gzugs la
translated: If you agree that the essence of the object and consciousness are simultaneous, then it would follow that consciousness would apprehend form and so on, not the sense faculty.

original: sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa khas blang bar bya gor ma chag go //
analyzed: sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa khas blang bar bya gor ma chag go //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that the consciousness that apprehends form and so on is of the same time as the form and so forth that are definitely produced by the previous cause.

original: de yang dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na yang mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Even if things are momentary, they are the same, so this is nothing.

original: gal te rnam shes rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po gnyi ga la klan ka byed de /
analyzed: gal te rnam shes rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po gnyi ga la klan ka byed de /
translated: The opponent is criticized with the lines, ‚ÄúIf consciousness has aspects . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin na /
translated: If consciousness has aspects,

original: de'i tshe za 'og gi gding ba la sogs pa la shes pa sna tshogs du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe za 'og gi gding ba la sogs pa la shes pa sna tshogs du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, on a multicolored cloth and so on, consciousness would be multiple.

original: gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical for a single thing to be multiple.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a consequence that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste rnam pa med pa yin na de'i tshe /üîΩ'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa med pa yin na de'i tshe / 'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is devoid of aspects,

original: ser po rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ser po rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not tenable to posit that this consciousness is a cognition of blue,

original: thams cad du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khyad par med pas nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khyad par med pas nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not a cognition of yellow, because there is no specific cause for the cognition of blue and not the cognition of yellow, since the nature of cognition is undifferentiated.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to this, DignƒÅga‚Äôs Compendium of Valid Cognition Autocommentary says:

original: klan ka 'di ni gnyis ka la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: klan ka 'di ni gnyis ka la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This fault is the same for both of us.

original: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis kyang gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba'i phyogs zhig khas blang bar bya dgos te /üîΩgzhan du na don 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'grub par @255a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis kyang gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba'i phyogs zhig khas blang bar bya dgos te / gzhan du na don 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'grub par @255a * //
translated: Because you must definitely accept one of the two positions‚Äîthat consciousness has aspects or that it is devoid of aspects.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, a consciousness that apprehends an object would not be established.

original: gang gis na shes pas don 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs 'di gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na shes pas don 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs 'di gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no other alternative to these two positions, one of which maintains that consciousness apprehends objects and the other that it does not.

original: gnyi ga'i skyon gang yin pa de yang gcig la klan kar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i skyon gang yin pa de yang gcig la klan kar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And the fault that you find in both of these positions cannot be used as a criticism against one of them.

original: des na 'di la khyed cag gi lan gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di la khyed cag gi lan gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, whatever answer you give to this will also be our answer.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la /
translated: In the case of the position that consciousness has aspects,

original: khyed kyis gdon mi za bar rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid dam lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin na yang shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa nyid yin no zhes lan gdab par bya dgos la /
analyzed: khyed kyis gdon mi za bar rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid dam lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin na yang shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa nyid yin no zhes lan gdab par bya dgos la /
translated: you must answer the question: ‚ÄúIf the aspects are false, or if they are different from consciousness because they are ascertained to be simultaneously perceived, then how can they be non-different from a single consciousness?‚Äù

original: de nyid kho bo cag gi lan yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kho bo cag gi lan yang yin no //
translated: This is also our answer.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang shes ba rgyu snga mas byas pa nyid kyi nges pa'i don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang shes ba rgyu snga mas byas pa nyid kyi nges pa'i don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par bya dgos la /
translated: In the case of the position that consciousness has no aspects, you must answer the question: ‚ÄúSince consciousness is produced by a previous cause, how can it have the nature of realizing a definite object?‚Äù

original: de nyid kho bo cag shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang lan du 'gyur bas 'di ni klan ka ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kho bo cag shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang lan du 'gyur bas 'di ni klan ka ma yin no //
translated: Since that is also a response for us Buddhists who advocate that consciousness is without aspects, this is not a critique.

original: lan zhes bya ba ni lan gdab pa'o//
analyzed: lan zhes bya ba ni lan gdab pa'o//
translated: ‚Äú Response‚Äù means a reply.

original: de lta bas na de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i tshad ma bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i tshad ma bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the valid knowledge that comprehends the state of cause and effect,

original: byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon spang bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgal te 'bras bur 'dod pa rgyus //
analyzed: byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon spang bar bya ba'i phyir / gal te 'bras bur 'dod pa rgyus //
translated: in order to abandon the errors of the destruction of that which is done and the encounter with that which is not done,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you assert that the effect is the cause,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te don dam par byed pa po'am za ba po 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de'i tshe skad cig 'jig pa nyid du kha sa len pa byed na byas pa chung zos pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don dam par byed pa po'am za ba po 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de'i tshe skad cig 'jig pa nyid du kha sa len pa byed na byas pa chung zos pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that ultimately there is an agent or experiencer, then at that time, since you accept that things are momentary and disintegrate, it follows that that which is done would be destroyed and that which is not done would be encountered.

original: gang gi phyir sna tshogs pa ni rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sna tshogs pa ni rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam ste /
translated: Because this diversity is merely the conditionality of this and that,

original: byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis cung zad byas pa ma yin la longs spyad pa yang ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar byas pa chud zos pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis cung zad byas pa ma yin la longs spyad pa yang ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar byas pa chud zos pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Some agent does not do anything at all, nor does he enjoy anything at all. Therefore how could the error of the exhaustion of karma and so on arise?

original: ci ste sngon gyi dge ba la sogs pa'i sems pas bsgos pa'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhig pa dang sngon gyi las kyis ma bsgos pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste sngon gyi dge ba la sogs pa'i sems pas bsgos pa'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhig pa dang sngon gyi las kyis ma bsgos pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the result arises from the disintegration of the potency that generates the desired and undesired result, which is imbued by the intention of former virtue and so on, and that the result arises from a cause that is a specific potency not imbued by former karma,

original: go rims bzhin du byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba brjod na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba brjod na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: then the errors of the exhaustion of karma and the encountering of that which was not done would arise, respectively.

original: sngon gyi las kyis bsgos pa'i nus pa'i rgyun la bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis bsgos pa'i nus pa'i rgyun la bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is illogical, because the continuum of the potency imbued by former karma is not in any way incompatible with selflessness.

original: 'di ltar rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i khu bas bcus pa'i sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du sngon gyi las kyis bsgos pa'i nus pa'i khyad par yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i khu bas bcus pa'i sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du sngon gyi las kyis bsgos pa'i nus pa'i khyad par yang yin te /
translated: Just as the continuum of seeds and so on is infused by the juice of lac and so on, so too the continuum of formations is infused by the power of previous karma.

original: gang gi phyir @255b dus phyis yongs su smin pa thob pa las 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir @255b dus phyis yongs su smin pa thob pa las 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Because later, when it ripens, the result is either desirable or undesirable.üîΩBut it is not asserted that a result arises from a continuum of formations not infused by previous karma.

original: sngon gyi las kyis ma bsgos pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir gang las ma byas pa dang / phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis ma bsgos pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir gang las ma byas pa dang / phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the error of contact with what is not done arise?

original: gsal byed pa na re brtan pa'i phyir sems ba las dag gis dgos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gsal byed pa na re brtan pa'i phyir sems ba las dag gis dgos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The Proponents of Manifestation say: It is not necessary to posit intention because the continuum is stable.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba'i brtan pa la bag chags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba'i brtan pa la bag chags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Stability is not called a latent imprint when the former nature is not relinquished.

original: brtan pa ma yin pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par gzhan skyed pa nyid bag chags yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa ma yin pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par gzhan skyed pa nyid bag chags yin no //
translated: But in the case of the unstable, the production of another specific nature is the residual impression.

original: gang yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gang yang bstan bcos las /
translated: And also, in the treatise,

original: brtan lung ma brtan bsgo bya ba //
analyzed: brtan lung ma brtan bsgo bya ba //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe stable and the unstable are to be taught.‚Äù

original: zhes bshad pa de ni rgyun gyis brtan pa las dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de ni rgyun gyis brtan pa las dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is intended from the point of view of the stability of the continuum.

original: gang rgyun chad pa de'i dus ches ring bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su nye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rgyun chad pa de'i dus ches ring bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su nye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of the interrupted, since the effect arises at a time far removed from the time of the cause, the cause does not exist at the time the effect arises.

original: des na de'i rnam pa de lta bur 'bras bu skye ba la bag chags kyi rten mi rigs so zhes bya bar dgos pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i rnam pa de lta bur 'bras bu skye ba la bag chags kyi rten mi rigs so zhes bya bar dgos pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the residual impression is the basis for the arising of the effect in that way.

original: de lta bas na 'dis gang cung zad brjod pa de ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms su bya bar 'os so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis gang cung zad brjod pa de ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms su bya bar 'os so //
translated: Thus, whatever is said by this is not reasonable. Therefore, it is suitable to ignore it, because it is due to not understanding the tenets of others.

original: gzhon nu ma len na re kho bo cag ni byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis byas pa'i las 'jig pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos shing ma byas pa dang phrad par ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len na re kho bo cag ni byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis byas pa'i las 'jig pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos shing ma byas pa dang phrad par ni mi smra'o //
translated: The young man says, ‚ÄúWe do not say that the result of an action done by some agent is destroyed, so that what was done would perish, nor do we say that one would encounter what was not done.

original: khyed cag gi gzhung gis byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag gi gzhung gis byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But according to your scriptures, some agent does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: las dang de'i 'bras bu dag skye ba dang 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa khas blang ba'i phyir /üîΩbyas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur bar smra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: las dang de'i 'bras bu dag skye ba dang 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa khas blang ba'i phyir / byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur bar smra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: We say that the result of an action would be without cause, because you accept that the arising and destruction of the action and its result are not related.üîΩTherefore, we say that what was done would perish and one would encounter what was not done.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'di la rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang mi 'dod pa thob par mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩskad cig gis 'jig rnam rtog gis //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang mi 'dod pa thob par mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir / skad cig gis 'jig rnam rtog gis //
translated: To show that it is unreasonable to have such a view of the perishing of what was done and the obtaining of what was not done, he says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúDestroyed by momentariness, imagined by thought.‚Äù

original: las kyi skad cig snga ma rjes su 'gro ba med par zhig pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang / 'bras bu'i skad cig snga ma med pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa zhes bya ba de lta bu skad cig tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pas byas pa chud zos pa la sogs pa'i rtsod pa de ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: las kyi skad cig snga ma rjes su 'gro ba med par zhig pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang / 'bras bu'i skad cig snga ma med pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad pa zhes bya ba de lta bu skad cig tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pas byas pa chud zos pa la sogs pa'i rtsod pa de ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Such disputes, which are based on the assumption of momentariness, are accepted by us.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po'i cha nyung du 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po'i cha nyung du 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: We will show that there is not even a small part of a thing that endures.üîΩAnd also,

original: gang yang / de phyir rtog pa dang ldan rnams //
analyzed: gang yang / de phyir rtog pa dang ldan rnams //
translated: Therefore, those who are rational

original: 'bras bu 'dod pas rjes 'jug min //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pas rjes 'jug min //
translated: Do not follow it out of desire for results.

original: zhes smos pa de la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa de la /
translated: In response to that,

original: @256a * // sems can yod lta ma nyams pas //
analyzed: @256a * // sems can yod lta ma nyams pas //
translated: Those who do not lose sight of the existence of sentient beings

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And so on.

original: re zhig gang dag lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ma spangs pa de dag la skad cig ma tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di med pa nyid de /
analyzed: re zhig gang dag lhan cig skyes pa las gzhan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ma spangs pa de dag la skad cig ma tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di med pa nyid de /
translated: For those who have not abandoned the afflicted view of the self and so on that are different from those that are coemergent, this momentary conceptualization does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rgyun la gcig pa nyid du zhen nas bdag cag bde par 'gyur ro zhes yongs su dga' bar byas nas las la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun la gcig pa nyid du zhen nas bdag cag bde par 'gyur ro zhes yongs su dga' bar byas nas las la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, clinging to the continuum as a single thing, they think, ‚ÄúI will be happy,‚Äù and they delight in this and engage in karma.

original: gang dag so so'i skye bo dge ba de dag ni de ltar rigs pa dang lung dag gis ji lta ba bzhin du skad cig ma dang bdag med pa dag rtogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gang dag so so'i skye bo dge ba de dag ni de ltar rigs pa dang lung dag gis ji lta ba bzhin du skad cig ma dang bdag med pa dag rtogs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa de dag kyang /
translated: Those ordinary beings who are virtuous realize the reality of momentariness and selflessness through reasoning and scripture.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: They realize the reality of dependent origination.

original: snying rje la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i spyin pa la sogs pa dag las bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'byung bar byed pa'i 'du byed skad cig ma nyid gzhan du brgyud pa skye'i /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i spyin pa la sogs pa dag las bdag dang gzhan la phan par 'byung bar byed pa'i 'du byed skad cig ma nyid gzhan du brgyud pa skye'i /
translated: Generosity and so forth, preceded by compassion and so forth, give rise to a continuum of other moments of formative forces that bring about benefit to self and other.

original: 'tshe ba la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin bas des na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i so sor nges pa bzung nas dge ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'tshe ba la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin bas des na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i so sor nges pa bzung nas dge ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not the case with violence and so forth. Therefore, having ascertained the individual determination of cause and effect, one engages in virtuous actions and so forth.

original: ji skad du /üîΩji srid de ni bdag la ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / ji srid de ni bdag la ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩAs long as thisüîΩAs long as this

original: ji srid de ni bdag la ni //üîΩsrid pa yongs su bcom par //
analyzed: ji srid de ni bdag la ni // srid pa yongs su bcom par //
translated: is not destroyed,

original: de srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
analyzed: de srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
translated: suffering is imputed.

original: rang bzhin du ni gnas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni gnas mi 'gyur //
translated: It will not remain in its natural state.

original: grol ba bo ni med na yang //
analyzed: grol ba bo ni med na yang //
translated: Even though there is no liberator,

original: log par sgro 'dogs gzhom phyir rtsom //üîΩzhes bshad ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: log par sgro 'dogs gzhom phyir rtsom // zhes bshad ba lta bu'o //
translated: one begins in order to destroy false imputation.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de rtogs pa po tshad ma ji ltar grub pa de ltar bstan zin pa kho na 'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de rtogs pa po tshad ma ji ltar grub pa de ltar bstan zin pa kho na 'o //
translated: The valid cognition that realizes the nature of cause and effect has already been explained in the same way that it is established.

original: gang yang / skad cig 'jig pa'i dngos rnams la //
analyzed: gang yang / skad cig 'jig pa'i dngos rnams la //
translated: Moreover, it is difficult to establish

original: ngo shes pa yang 'thad par dka' //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yang 'thad par dka' //
translated: that things that disintegrate moment by moment are recognized.

original: zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la /
translated: To that, we say:üîΩThe mind that experiences an object

original: sems rnams 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems rnams 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is the one that remembers it.

original: 'bras bu 'bras bu can nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la 'bras bu yod pas 'bras bu can te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bras bu can nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la 'bras bu yod pas 'bras bu can te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe effect is the cause‚Äù is that because this has an effect, it is the effect.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'bras bu dang 'bras bu can gyi dngos po ni 'bras bu dang 'bras bu can nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to // 'bras bu dang 'bras bu can gyi dngos po ni 'bras bu dang 'bras bu can nyid de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe cause‚Äù is that it is the cause.üîΩThe state of being the effect and the cause is the effect and the cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe state of being the cause and the effect‚Äù is that it is the cause and the effect.üîΩIn this way, the one who remembers is the one who experiences, and the one who experiences is the one who remembers.

original: 'di ltar gang gis nyams su myong ba gang kho na de nyid kyis dran pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dran pa po don dam par yod pa nyams su myong pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis nyams su myong ba gang kho na de nyid kyis dran pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dran pa po don dam par yod pa nyams su myong pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, the experiencer does not exist at all.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: rgyun gang la nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal pos gong nas gong du shin tu ches khyad par can gyi skad cig skye bas dran pa la sogs pa'i sa bon bsgos pa de nyid la dran pa la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan @256b du niüîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rgyun gang la nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal pos gong nas gong du shin tu ches khyad par can gyi skad cig skye bas dran pa la sogs pa'i sa bon bsgos pa de nyid la dran pa la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan @256b du ni ma yin te /
translated: The seeds of memory and so on are infused in that very continuum in which the experience is extremely clear, and memory and so on arise from that, not elsewhere.üîΩBecause the relationship between cause and effect is restricted.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba spyi'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan gyis dran dang longs spyong sogs //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dran dang longs spyong sogs //
translated: Memory, enjoyment, and so on

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'ang gnod byed min //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'ang gnod byed min //
translated: are not harmed by the consequence of nonexistence.

original: de yis 'ga' yang ma dran phyir //
analyzed: de yis 'ga' yang ma dran phyir //
translated: Because nothing is remembered by that,

original: 'di ltar myong las dran pa 'byung //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar myong las dran pa 'byung // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: memory arises from experience.

original: do shes pa la sogs pa skye ba yang dran pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: do shes pa la sogs pa skye ba yang dran pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: The arising of consciousness and so on is not contradictory because it is preceded by memory and so on.

original: gang gis blo tha dad na yang rgyu mtshan med ces brjod /
analyzed: gang gis blo tha dad na yang rgyu mtshan med ces brjod /
translated: If you say that even if the mind is different, there is no reason,

original: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan shes pa po gcig pu 'ga' zhig grub pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan shes pa po gcig pu 'ga' zhig grub pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, there is no single knower established as the reason for the recognition of all objects of knowledge.

original: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam gyis de khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang srid pa'i btson rar 'dod chags la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcings pa dang / thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smras pa de la /
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam gyis de khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // gang yang srid pa'i btson rar 'dod chags la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcings pa dang / thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smras pa de la /
translated: Because in all cases, we accept mere things that are causes and effects.üîΩSomeone says that the presentation of bondage and liberation is untenable,

original: ma rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: as in ‚ÄúBondage and liberation are not tenable if one is bound by attachment and so on in the prison of existence.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag la ni skyes bu gcig la brten pa'i bcings pa dang thar pa dag gang du yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni skyes bu gcig la brten pa'i bcings pa dang thar pa dag gang du yang ma grub ste /
translated: We do not at all accept that bondage and liberation are based on a single person.

original: bcings bar bya ba dang grol bar bya ba 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcings bar bya ba dang grol bar bya ba 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because neither the one who is bound nor the one who is liberated is established.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'du byed rnams nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bcings pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'du byed rnams nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bcings pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúbound‚Äù is used in the conventional sense of the cause of the arising of suffering, from the volitions of ignorance up to old age and death.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this way, this great mass of suffering arises.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag kyang de kho na nyid shes pa las bral ba ni dri ma dang bral ba'i blo gang yin pa de ni grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag kyang de kho na nyid shes pa las bral ba ni dri ma dang bral ba'i blo gang yin pa de ni grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are devoid of the knowledge of reality, such as ignorance, are said to be ‚Äúliberated‚Äù by the mind that is free from defilements.

original: ji skad du /üîΩgang phyir chags sogs nyon mongs bas //
analyzed: ji skad du / gang phyir chags sogs nyon mongs bas //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe mind that is stained by afflictions such as attachment

original: bsgos pa'i sems nyid 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: bsgos pa'i sems nyid 'khor ba ste //
translated: is cyclic existence.

original: de nyid de dag las grol ba //üîΩsrid mthar phyin ces brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid de dag las grol ba // srid mthar phyin ces brjod pa yin //
translated: When it is free from those,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said to have gone to the end of existence.

original: gang yang bcings dang grol ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang yang bcings dang grol ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who are bound and liberated

original: gzhi gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin ne zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin ne zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to the statement, The basis is one, and so on, in order to demonstrate that the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum, he says:

original: bcings pa dang thar ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for these bonds and liberations, and so on.

original: gang gis tshe dngos po thams cad skyes ma thag kho nar 'jig pa yin no zhes bsgrubs pa de'i tshe bcings pa dang thar pa de dag gzhi gcig pa nyid gang du yang grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo //üîΩde'i pa'i de ltar rang gi phyogs rnam par bzhag @257a * //
analyzed: gang gis tshe dngos po thams cad skyes ma thag kho nar 'jig pa yin no zhes bsgrubs pa de'i tshe bcings pa dang thar pa de dag gzhi gcig pa nyid gang du yang grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo // de'i pa'i de ltar rang gi phyogs rnam par bzhag @257a * //
translated: When it is established that all things disintegrate as soon as they are born, then at that time, since these bonds and liberations are not established as being the same basis, the example is not established.

original: nas ; bdag la kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs bar byed do //
analyzed: nas ; bdag la kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs 'gegs bar byed do //
translated: Having thus presented his own position, he refutes the opponent's position with the words, If you say that the self is the basis of desire and so on, and so on.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / de kho na nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa dag gis bdag la khyad par 'ga' zhig byed na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / de kho na nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa dag gis bdag la khyad par 'ga' zhig byed na /
translated: If desire and so on, the afflictions, and the cultivation of reality and so on make some difference to the self, then the self would be conditioned.

original: de'i tshe de'i bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag par 'gyur na /üîΩgang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i mtshams kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di 'dra ba 'di byed par 'gyur ba gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid kyis de la khyad par sgrub par byed pa yod pa
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag par 'gyur na / gang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i mtshams kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di 'dra ba 'di byed par 'gyur ba gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid kyis de la khyad par sgrub par byed pa yod pa
translated: At that time, the presentations of bondage, liberation, and so on would be tenable.üîΩBut because permanence does not allow for the establishment of any distinction in it,

original: ma yin pa de'i phyir nges par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid bcings pa dang thar ba rnam par gzhag pa byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa de'i phyir nges par rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid bcings pa dang thar ba rnam par gzhag pa byed pa ma yin te /
translated: it does not perform the function of establishing bondage and liberation, which are characterized by the boundary between cause and effect.

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is just like space.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la khyad par skyed pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la khyad par skyed pa yin na de'i tshe khyad par bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: If the self were to generate a distinction, then at that time it would become a distinction itself.

original: bdag kyang de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir khyad par bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir khyad par bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and since the self is not different from that, it would be impermanent like the difference.

original: khyad par gzhan du gyur pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan du gyur pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for there to be a difference in transformation,

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya pa 'di mi lan brgyar brtags zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya pa 'di mi lan brgyar brtags zin to //
translated: because the connection is not established. This has been examined a hundred times.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las /
translated: In the Commentary on the Compendium of Reality,

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag pa ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag pa ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: this is the fourteenth chapter, the investigation of the connection between actions and results.

original: // / da ni /üîΩyon tan rdzas dang las rigs pa //
analyzed: // / da ni / yon tan rdzas dang las rigs pa //
translated: Now, in order to establish the following:

original: 'du sogs khyad par gyis stong pa //
analyzed: 'du sogs khyad par gyis stong pa //
translated: The substance, quality, action, and class are empty by the difference of collection and so on.

original: zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshig gi don drug brtag pa nye par 'god par byed pa ni /üîΩrkang mig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshig gi don drug brtag pa nye par 'god par byed pa ni / rkang mig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to establish that, the six topics are presented in the following:üîΩThe followers of PƒÅ·πáini and so on say,

original: rkang mig pa la sogs pa rnams na re /
analyzed: rkang mig pa la sogs pa rnams na re /
translated: the followers of PƒÅ·πáini and so on say,

original: sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par /
translated: in the previous chapter on the investigation of things,

original: rigs la sogs pa dngos med phyir //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa dngos med phyir //
translated: because class and so on are not things,

original: skad cig 'jig par 'dod pa min //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig par 'dod pa min //
translated: they are not asserted to be momentary and disintegrating.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar rig pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar rig pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This verse shows that it is illogical that the previously mentioned entities such as cognition are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye drag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba tshig gi don drug dam pa'i don du rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye drag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba tshig gi don drug dam pa'i don du rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they say that the six categories of substance, quality, action, universal, particular, and inherence exist substantially in the ultimate.

original: rkang mig gi slob ma yin pa'i phyir rkang mig pa ste /
analyzed: rkang mig gi slob ma yin pa'i phyir rkang mig pa ste /
translated: They are called Ka·πáƒÅda‚Äôs followers because they are students of Ka·πáƒÅda.

original: rigs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams so //
translated: They are logicians.

original: bye brag pa rnams ni gzegs zan gyi slob ma ste gzegs zan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams ni gzegs zan gyi slob ma ste gzegs zan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Vai≈õe·π£ikas are students of Ka·πáƒÅda and are called Ka·πáƒÅdas.

original: lung tsam dag ces bya ba ni 'di dag la rigs pa dang bral ba lung tsam yod pa yin pas lung tsam bdag go //
analyzed: lung tsam dag ces bya ba ni 'di dag la rigs pa dang bral ba lung tsam yod pa yin pas lung tsam bdag go //
translated: They are called those who merely have scripture because they merely have scripture devoid of logic.

original: de la re zhig sa la sogs //
analyzed: de la re zhig sa la sogs //
translated: Among them, first, earth and so on

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: and so forth.

original: re zhig @257b rdzas kyi tshig gi don dgag par bya ba'i don du de'i rnam pa dbye ba 'chad de /
analyzed: re zhig @257b rdzas kyi tshig gi don dgag par bya ba'i don du de'i rnam pa dbye ba 'chad de /
translated: First, in order to refute the category of substance, its types are explained.

original: tha dad du rnam par phye na bde blag tu sun dbyung ba brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad du rnam par phye na bde blag tu sun dbyung ba brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because when they are distinguished individually, they can be easily refuted.

original: rnam pa dgu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nine substances

original: mdo las sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang phyogs dang / bdag dang yid ces bya ba ni rdzas dag yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang phyogs dang / bdag dang yid ces bya ba ni rdzas dag yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúEarth, water, fire, wind, space, time, direction, self, and mind are substances.‚Äù

original: de la yang //
analyzed: de la yang //
translated: And there

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind

original: zhes bya ba'i rdzas kyi grangs bzhi po 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rdzas kyi grangs bzhi po 'di ni /
translated: These four substances are enumerated

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: as two types, permanent and impermanent,

original: 'dir rnam pa gnyis po 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa gnyis po 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because these two types are taught here.

original: re zhig gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate these two types, he says, ‚ÄúFirst, those that are permanent, etc.‚Äù

original: sa la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid rnams ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid rnams ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: Earth, etc., which have the nature of atoms, are permanent,

original: rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because atoms are permanent.

original: de la sogs pas brtsams ba ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pas brtsams ba ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Those that are initiated by that, etc., are impermanent.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar rigs pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar rigs pas so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that what is caused is impermanent.

original: de sogs kyis zhes bya ba rdul phra rab dag la sogs pa de dag gang la yod pa'i rdul phra rab gnyis 'byar ba gnyis pa la sogs pa de dag ni de sogs so //
analyzed: de sogs kyis zhes bya ba rdul phra rab dag la sogs pa de dag gang la yod pa'i rdul phra rab gnyis 'byar ba gnyis pa la sogs pa de dag ni de sogs so //
translated: ‚Äú And so on‚Äù refers to the aggregates of atoms and so on. The atoms that exist in those aggregates are the atoms that are joined together in pairs and so on.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni brtag pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni brtag pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Space and so on are only imagined.

original: re zhig rdzas kyi grangs bzhi po de 'dir dgag par 'dod nas /
analyzed: re zhig rdzas kyi grangs bzhi po de 'dir dgag par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, wishing to refute the four substances here, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la sogs pa 'di dag / rdul phra rab rtag pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa gang yin pa de dag la ni dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i ngo bo med par bsgrubs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa 'di dag / rdul phra rab rtag pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa gang yin pa de dag la ni dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i ngo bo med par bsgrubs pa nyid yin no //
translated: In that and so on, the atoms that are said to be permanent by nature, all things are established as momentary and perishable, and so it is established that they do not have a permanent nature.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: Whatever exists is all momentary.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is contradictory for that which is not momentary to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes khyab pa bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes khyab pa bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Therefore, the existence that is characterized by that is undermined.üîΩThe proof of the pervasion has already been completed.

original: 'di la yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the valid cognition that contradicts that is:

original: rtag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If permanent, etc.

original: gal te ri la sogs pa rags pa rnams la rgyur gyur pa'i rdul phra rab dag rtag par yod pa ni yin no zhes khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te ri la sogs pa rags pa rnams la rgyur gyur pa'i rdul phra rab dag rtag par yod pa ni yin no zhes khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that subtle particles that are causes of coarse things such as mountains exist permanently,

original: de'i 'bras bu rags pa rnams rgyu ma tshad pa med pa'i phyir cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rags pa rnams rgyu ma tshad pa med pa'i phyir cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the result, coarse things, would arise only instantaneously because their causes would not be incomplete.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag rgyu'i tshogs pa thogs pa med pa can de dag ni cig car 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag rgyu'i tshogs pa thogs pa med pa can de dag ni cig car 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is an unobstructed collection of causes arises instantaneously,

original: mtshungs par skyes pa'i myu gu mang po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par skyes pa'i myu gu mang po dag bzhin no //
translated: like many sprouts that arise simultaneously.

original: rdul phra rab rtag pa'i 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod par gas pa'i @258a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rtag pa'i 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod par gas pa'i @258a * //
translated: and the atom is the effect of permanence.üîΩAnd things are the effect of an unobstructed assemblage of causes.

original: dngos po rnams kyang rgyu'i tshogs pa thogs pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang rgyu'i tshogs pa thogs pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: rgyu tshogs kyang mi skye na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs kyang mi skye na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: And if the assemblage of causes does not produce, then it follows that it never produces, because there is no difference.üîΩThis is a refutation.

original: 'di snyam du rgyu rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgyu rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
translated: The three kinds of causes are asserted:

original: 'du ba'i rgyu dang / 'du ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu 'o //
analyzed: 'du ba'i rgyu dang / 'du ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu 'o //
translated: the assemblage cause, the non-assemblage cause, and the sign cause.

original: de la gang la 'bras bu gang 'du ba de ni de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la gang la 'bras bu gang 'du ba de ni de'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of that which is assembled is that which is assembled in the effect.

original: dper na rdul phra rab gnyis pa la rdul phran gnyis lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rdul phra rab gnyis pa la rdul phran gnyis lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the two atoms are the cause of the dyad.

original: gang zhig gang la mi 'du ba'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam du gyur pa de ni 'du ba ma yin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la mi 'du ba'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam du gyur pa de ni 'du ba ma yin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That which is not assembled is the cause of that which is not assembled.

original: dper na yan lag can gyi rdzas tsam bo las yan lag gi ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yan lag can gyi rdzas tsam bo las yan lag gi ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the possession of parts is due to the mere substance that possesses parts.

original: rgyu lhag ma'i rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: rgyu lhag ma'i rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu ste /
translated: The remaining causes are the causal-sign cause.üîΩFor example, the dharmas, etc.

original: dper na chos la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na chos la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of them.

original: de la ldan pa la sogs pa la ltos par 'gyur ba ni mi nya ba'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la ldan pa la sogs pa la ltos par 'gyur ba ni mi nya ba'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: In that regard, since the non-existence of the cause is not established because it is not possible to rely on possession, etc.,üîΩtherefore, the reason is not established.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub bo zhes dogs pa la //üîΩde dag ldan pa la sogs la //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub bo zhes dogs pa la // de dag ldan pa la sogs la //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not dependent on possession, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams la ldan pa la sogs pas khyad par 'ga' zhig byed na de'i tshe de dag la ltos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams la ldan pa la sogs pas khyad par 'ga' zhig byed na de'i tshe de dag la ltos par 'gyur na /
translated: If the atoms were to be differentiated by possession, etc., then they would rely on that.

original: ji srid du rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: But as long as the atoms are permanent,

original: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa nyid yin na de ji ltar na de dag ldan pa la sogs pa ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis khyad par du byar med pa nyid yin na de ji ltar na de dag ldan pa la sogs pa ltos par 'gyur /
translated: since they cannot be differentiated by others, how could they rely on possession, etc.?

original: lus dang sa la sogs pa rags pa rnams cig car skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dang sa la sogs pa rags pa rnams cig car skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that gross things such as the body and earth, etc., are produced simultaneously.

original: lus la sogs pa rim gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rim gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For we see that the body, etc., are produced gradually.

original: de lta bas na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the reverse pervasion is:

original: gang dag 'bras bu rim pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bu rim pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is a cause that has a sequence of effects is impermanent,

original: rim pa dang ldan pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a seed, etc., which produces a sequence of effects such as the sprout, etc.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And so it is with the atoms. This is a natural inference.

original: rnam phug bas rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma smras pa /
analyzed: rnam phug bas rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma smras pa /
translated: In order to prove that atoms are permanent, the Vaise~ika states the following as a means of valid knowledge:

original: rdul phra rab rnams skyed par byed par mngon par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams skyed par byed par mngon par 'dod pa ni /
translated: That which is accepted as the producer of atoms

original: yod pa'i chos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i chos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: does not possess the quality of existence,

original: yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not the object of a means of valid knowledge that proves existence.

original: bod bu'i rva bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: bod bu'i rva bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: like the horns of a rabbit.üîΩAn existent thing is a thing that exists, i.e., that is.

original: yod pa ste bdog pa'i chos ni yod pa'i chos te yod pa nyid do //üîΩde dang ldan pa ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ste bdog pa'i chos ni yod pa'i chos te yod pa nyid do // de dang ldan pa ni thob pa ste /
translated: To possess that is to possess existence.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba'i @258b tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba'i @258b tha tshig go //
translated: That is what ‚Äúto exist‚Äù means.

original: de bkag pa 'di ni rdul phran skyed byed de /
analyzed: de bkag pa 'di ni rdul phran skyed byed de /
translated: The negation of that is the non-existence of the cause of the production of the atom.

original: rdul phra rab rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no cause of the production of the atoms.

original: tshad ma de dag 'di dogs pa bsu ba sngon du 'gro ba can bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma de dag 'di dogs pa bsu ba sngon du 'gro ba can bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the refutation of the existence of the atom is preceded by the refutation of the means of knowing it, he says:

original: gal te rdul phran skyed byed 'dod //
analyzed: gal te rdul phran skyed byed 'dod //
translated: If you maintain that there is a cause of the production of the atom,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: rdul phra rab skyed par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dod ces sbrel lo //
analyzed: rdul phra rab skyed par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dod ces sbrel lo //
translated: The meaning is that if you maintain that there is a cause of the production of the atom, i.e., that there is a thing that possesses the cause of the production of the atom.

original: yod pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The existence of the object is the perception of the object.

original: rtogs pa de'i don te dgos pa tshad ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa de'i don te dgos pa tshad ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of that is the purpose of that. The means of knowing that is the means of knowing the existence of the object. That which possesses that is so-called.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par bla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par bla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams mi rtag pa nyid du dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams mi rtag pa nyid du dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows that the thesis that the atoms are impermanent is contradicted by inference.

original: yod pa rgyu dang mi ldan rtag / ces bshad pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid kyis rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa rgyu dang mi ldan rtag / ces bshad pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid kyis rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that ‚Äúthe permanent exists without cause,‚Äù the atoms are established as permanent because they are without cause.

original: min te ma grub phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: min te ma grub phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because it is not established‚Äù and so on explains that the reason is not established.

original: 'on te thag pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa kho na'i rgyu nyid du grags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te thag pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa kho na'i rgyu nyid du grags pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt such things as ropes known to be the cause of such things as cloth?

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni ma yin na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi ni ma yin na /
translated: They are not the cause of atoms.

original: de ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi rgyu thag pa la sogs pa mthong zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi rgyu thag pa la sogs pa mthong zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that the cause of atoms, such as ropes, are seen?

original: gang phyir snam bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir snam bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause such things as cloth,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that this will be explained later.

original: gzhan yang yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don rnams dmigs par byed pa'i tshad ma log na yang yong par mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don rnams dmigs par byed pa'i tshad ma log na yang yong par mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, even when a valid cognition that observes the objects, times, and natures that are separated is overturned, it is not contradictory for them to exist.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the reason is indefinite.

original: yod 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe apprehension of existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: don med pa la nges pa med //
analyzed: don med pa la nges pa med //
translated: There is no certainty about what is meaningless.

original: ces bya ba ni sha za la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sha za la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is like the case of a flesh-eating demon, and so on.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rdzas bkag nas /üîΩ'bras bu'i rdzas dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rdzas bkag nas / 'bras bu'i rdzas dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this way, first the substance of the cause is refuted.

original: des brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute the substance of the effect, he says, ‚ÄúThe effect that is produced,‚Äù and so on.

original: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Qualities are form and so on.

original: yan lag ni snal ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni snal ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Parts are threads and so on.

original: de 'di yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di yod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because it exists, it is called that.

original: de lta bur gyur pa yon tan dang yan lag las tha dad pa yan lag can de ma dmigs te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa yon tan dang yan lag las tha dad pa yan lag can de ma dmigs te /
translated: Such a whole that is different from qualities and parts is not observed.

original: snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag can gyi rdzas dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang snal ma la sogs pa yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa gang du yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mi snang
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag can gyi rdzas dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang snal ma la sogs pa yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa gang du yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mi snang
translated: The substance that is the part possessor, such as a cloth, is not seen by the eye consciousness, etc. as a different object from all the qualities such as white, etc. and from the parts such as the threads, etc.

original: ngo // de'i phyir 'dir yon tan dag las don gzhan du gyur pa'i rdzas mi dmigs pas @259a * //
analyzed: ngo // de'i phyir 'dir yon tan dag las don gzhan du gyur pa'i rdzas mi dmigs pas @259a * //
translated: Therefore, here, substance that is a different object from the qualities is not perceived.

original: yon tan dang yon tan can du smra ba dang // yan lag las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can mi dmigs pas yan lag can du smra ba bsal to //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang na ma dmigs pa de ni de na med pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can du smra ba dang // yan lag las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can mi dmigs pas yan lag can du smra ba bsal to // sbyor ba ni gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang na ma dmigs pa de ni de na med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the assertion of the quality and the possessor of the quality is refuted, and the assertion of the part and the possessor of the part is refuted because the possessor of the part is not perceived apart from the part.

original: dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not perceived in the nature of being perceived does not exist there, like a pot, etc. that is not perceived in some particular place.

original: yul de nyid du yon tan dang yan lag las don gzhan du gyur ba'i snang ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i yon tan can dang yan lag can yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul de nyid du yon tan dang yan lag las don gzhan du gyur ba'i snang ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i yon tan can dang yan lag can yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
