translated: And in that very object, the possessor of qualities and the whole, which are different from the qualities and parts, are not perceived. This is the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: chen po dang rdzas du ma dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzugs ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir snang rung nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po dang rdzas du ma dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzugs ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir snang rung nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of many substances and the fact that form is an object are explained, and because visibility is accepted.

original: nye bar bsgyur dang phrad pa na //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur dang phrad pa na //
translated: In the case of the prefix, contact, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed pa dang snang bral la sogs pa rnams gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed pa dang snang bral la sogs pa rnams gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: he shows that the reasons are unestablished by the words ‚Äúvisibility, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag gis smras pa /üîΩyon tan las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan can yang dag par dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa / yon tan las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan can yang dag par dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: They say:üîΩThe possessor of qualities is perceived as something other than the qualities.

original: de'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan ma bzung na yang de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan ma bzung na yang de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended even when its qualities such as form are not apprehended.

original: 'di ltar nye bar sgyur ba nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi shel rdo'i ri la yod pa'i dkar po'i yon tan ma dmigs na yang mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar sgyur ba nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi shel rdo'i ri la yod pa'i dkar po'i yon tan ma dmigs na yang mthong ba nyid do //
translated: In the same way, when the quality of whiteness in a crystal mountain is not perceived because of its proximity to something else, it is still seen.

original: chu skyar la sogs pa yang mtshan mo nyung zad nyung zad snang ba na yang der gtogs pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i gzugs ma mthong yang bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: chu skyar la sogs pa yang mtshan mo nyung zad nyung zad snang ba na yang der gtogs pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i gzugs ma mthong yang bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: And even when a heron, etc., is seen only slightly at night, the form of the person who is with it, etc., is not seen, but it is still apprehended.

original: de bzhin du lus rkang pa'i bar du ral gas g-yogs pa'i skyes bu la /üîΩde'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i gzugs ma bzung bar yang skyes pa skyes pa zhes rtogs pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus rkang pa'i bar du ral gas g-yogs pa'i skyes bu la / de'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i gzugs ma bzung bar yang skyes pa skyes pa zhes rtogs pa skye ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, when a man‚Äôs body is covered with a split bamboo robe,üîΩeven though the form of his pallor, etc., is not apprehended, the cognition ‚Äúman‚Äù arises.

original: dur smrig dang gur gum la sogs pas gos dmar po la de'i ngo bo 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zil gyis mnan pa ma dmigs na yang gos kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dur smrig dang gur gum la sogs pas gos dmar po la de'i ngo bo 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zil gyis mnan pa ma dmigs na yang gos kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And even when the color red of a cloth is not perceived because it is overwhelmed by the color of something else, such as saffron or the color of a China rose, the cognition of the cloth arises.

original: de'i phyir re zhig de ltar mngon sum nyid kyis yon tan dang yon tan can tha dad par grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de ltar mngon sum nyid kyis yon tan dang yon tan can tha dad par grub par bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, first, having thus demonstrated that the quality and the possessor of the quality are established as different by direct perception,

original: da ni rjes su dpag pas kyang grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pas kyang grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that they are also established by inference,

original: padma sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: padma sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe lotus, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: padma la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa yon tan yin te /
analyzed: padma la sogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa yon tan yin te /
translated: The qualities of form, etc., are of the lotus, etc.

original: padma'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: padma'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: It is like this: the form, etc., of the lotus.

original: padma la sogs pa de yis gzugs la sogs pa de ni rnam par gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: padma la sogs pa de yis gzugs la sogs pa de ni rnam par gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: That form, etc., of that lotus, etc., is excluded.

original: dper na nag pa'i rta zhes nag pas @259b bdag po gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pa na rta de las tha dad pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nag pa'i rta zhes nag pas @259b bdag po gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pa na rta de las tha dad pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúNaga‚Äôs horse,‚Äù the horse is excluded from other owners, and it is different from Naga.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rdzas rnams ni so sor gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang reg pa'i yon tan dag las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rdzas rnams ni so sor gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang reg pa'i yon tan dag las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the other syllogism: The substances of earth, water, fire, and wind are different from the qualities of form, taste, smell, and touch, respectively.

original: gcig gi tshig dang mang po'i tshig gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig gi tshig dang mang po'i tshig gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the referent of words for one and many.

original: zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Like the moon and the stars.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar zla ba zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar zla ba zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig yin la /
translated: Because the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù is a word for one,

original: rgyu skar rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rgyu skar rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig ste /
translated: and the word ‚Äústars‚Äù is a word for many,üîΩthe moon and the stars are perceived as having different reasons for being different.

original: zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du dmigs pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du dmigs pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sa zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúearth‚Äù is a word for one,

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang ; reg pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang ; reg pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //
translated: and the words ‚Äúform, taste, smell, and tactility‚Äù are words for many.

original: de bzhin du chu la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to water and so on.

original: rgyu skar tha dad pa ni rgyal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar tha dad pa ni rgyal la sogs pa'o //
translated: The different stars are the Pleiades and so on.

original: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan can tha dad par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan can tha dad par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established that the qualities and the possessor of qualities are different,

original: yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to establish that the parts and the whole are different,üîΩthe root text says:

original: de bzhin snam snal tha dad de ;
analyzed: de bzhin snam snal tha dad de ;
translated: Likewise, cloth and thread are different.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsbyor ba rnams ni /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sbyor ba rnams ni /
translated: The arguments are as follows:

original: snam bu ni spyad pa'i yul du gyur pa'i snal ma dag las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: snam bu ni spyad pa'i yul du gyur pa'i snal ma dag las gzhan yin te /
translated: The cloth is different from the threads that are the material cause of it,

original: byed pa po tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because the agents are different.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pot and so on.

original: snal ma dang snam bu dag ni gzhan yin te /
analyzed: snal ma dang snam bu dag ni gzhan yin te /
translated: The threads and the cloth are different,

original: nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because the capacities are different.

original: dug dang gnyen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dug dang gnyen po bzhin no //
translated: It is like poison and its antidote.

original: dus dang snga dang phyis 'byung ba'i phyir yang ste /
analyzed: dus dang snga dang phyis 'byung ba'i phyir yang ste /
translated: They are also different because they occur at different times,

original: pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: like father and son.

original: tshad ma tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are different because they are measured differently.

original: autpala dang skyu ru ra dang bil ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: autpala dang skyu ru ra dang bil ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like the utpala flower, the myrobalan fruit, and the bilva fruit.

original: 'di dag gi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag gi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the pervasion of these arguments,

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause they possess contradictory properties.

original: dngos po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa tsam yin te /
translated: The reason that things are different from each other is simply that they possess contradictory properties.

original: ka ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pillar and so on.

original: de yang yan lag can dag la yang yod de /
analyzed: de yang yan lag can dag la yang yod de /
translated: Moreover, wholes also exist in the parts.

original: 'di ltar snal ma dag gi byed pa po ni bud med yin la snam bu'i ni tha ga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snal ma dag gi byed pa po ni bud med yin la snam bu'i ni tha ga pa'o //
translated: Thus, the agent of the threads is the weaver, but the agent of the cloth is the female weaver.

original: snam bu ni grang bsel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nus kyi snal ma rnams ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: snam bu ni grang bsel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nus kyi snal ma rnams ni ma yin no ;
translated: The cloth is able to produce effects such as warmth, but the threads are not.

original: / snal ma rnams ni dang por dmigs te /
analyzed: / snal ma rnams ni dang por dmigs te /
translated: The threads are observed first,

original: dus sngar byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus sngar byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise earlier.

original: snam bu ni phyis thag pa la sogs pas byed pa'i dus phyis dmigs pa'i phyir dus phyis byung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: snam bu ni phyis thag pa la sogs pas byed pa'i dus phyis dmigs pa'i phyir dus phyis byung ba nyid yin no //
translated: The cloth arises later, because it is observed later, at the time of weaving, etc.

original: snam bu'i zheng dang srid du tshad ji tsam yod pa de tsam snal ma re re la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad tha dad pa yin no//
analyzed: snam bu'i zheng dang srid du tshad ji tsam yod pa de tsam snal ma re re la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad tha dad pa yin no//
translated: The cloth is of a different size, because the size of the cloth, however large it may be in length and width, does not exist in each thread.

original: @260a * // de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: @260a * // de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reasons are not indeterminate.

original: de ltar re zhig rdzas su dpag pas yan lag dang yan lag can dag tha dad par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rdzas su dpag pas yan lag dang yan lag can dag tha dad par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, first, having established that the parts and the whole are different by inference based on substance,

original: mngon sum gyis kyang tha dad bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang tha dad bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: because direct perception also proves their difference.

original: rags pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rags pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To prove that, he says, ‚ÄúThe gross object,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te yan lag can med par gyur na thams cad mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can med par gyur na thams cad mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the possessor of parts did not exist, it would follow that everything would not be apprehended,

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subtle atoms are beyond the senses.

original: rags pa med pa na rdul phra rab ces bya ba'i tha snyad nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rags pa med pa na rdul phra rab ces bya ba'i tha snyad nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the gross did not exist, the convention ‚Äúsubtle atom‚Äù would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: regs pa'i dngos po la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: regs pa'i dngos po la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on the gross thing,‚Äù etc.

original: rtogs par bla bar zad do //üîΩ'on te shel la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: rtogs par bla bar zad do // 'on te shel la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: It is merely for the sake of easy understanding.üîΩBut if you say, ‚ÄúIn the case of crystal,‚Äù etc., he replies with ‚ÄúIn the case of crystal, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: shel la sogs pa rang la yod pa'i yon tan la dmigs nas yang 'ba' zhig la dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: shel la sogs pa rang la yod pa'i yon tan la dmigs nas yang 'ba' zhig la dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúOne observes only the quality that exists in the crystal, etc.,‚Äù is not established.

original: de'i shes pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis 'khrul pas yul med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis 'khrul pas yul med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of that is mistaken, since it is not in accordance with the object, the object does not exist.

original: 'di ltar / thad skyes kyi me tog la sogs pas nye bar sgyur bas shel rdo med pa nyid kyi dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / thad skyes kyi me tog la sogs pas nye bar sgyur bas shel rdo med pa nyid kyi dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo dmigs la /
translated: Thus, when a crystal is modified by something else, such as a red flower, the nature of red and so on is observed, even though the crystal itself is not red.

original: chu skyar dang lha khang la sogs pa dkar po yin na yang sre bo'i ngo bor mthong ste /
analyzed: chu skyar dang lha khang la sogs pa dkar po yin na yang sre bo'i ngo bor mthong ste /
translated: When a crane and a temple are white, they are seen to have the nature of yellow.

original: de dag de'i dngos te dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho na nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag de'i dngos te dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho na nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not in reality the nature of red and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi phyogs 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would destroy your own position.

original: gal te de dag de'i dngos nyid de kho na nyid du gyur na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo ma bzung na yang de dag 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes khyed kyis de ma thag tu brjod pa gang yin pa'i phyogs de 'jig par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gal te de dag de'i dngos nyid de kho na nyid du gyur na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo ma bzung na yang de dag 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes khyed kyis de ma thag tu brjod pa gang yin pa'i phyogs de 'jig par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If they were in reality the nature of that, then at that time, even if you did not apprehend their nature, you would apprehend them. This is what you have just said. That position would be destroyed.

original: /'di snyam du dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa'i shel la sogs pa yang dmigs pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: /'di snyam du dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa'i shel la sogs pa yang dmigs pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is only crystal and so on that are perceived, apart from the nature of red and so on,

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las tha dad ba shel la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bdag gi rang bzhin ma mthong ste /
analyzed: dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las tha dad ba shel la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bdag gi rang bzhin ma mthong ste /
translated: The nature of crystal and so on, which is different from the nature of red and so on, is not seen as the nature of itself,

original: dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho nar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho nar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is only perceived as the nature of red and so on.

original: gal te shel la sogs pa de'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shel la sogs pa de'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang dmar po la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that crystal and so on, which is not the nature of that, is perceived as the nature of red and so on,

original: gzhan rnam rig blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan rnam rig blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of another . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa'i dbang gi shes pa don so sor nges pa'i yul can du 'jog @260b ste ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa'i dbang gi shes pa don so sor nges pa'i yul can du 'jog @260b ste ;
translated: Because cognition is posited as having an object that is determined by the aspect.

original: gal te gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang gzhan gyi yul can du 'gyur ba de lta yin na gzugs kyi shes pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i yul du 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang gzhan gyi yul can du 'gyur ba de lta yin na gzugs kyi shes pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i yul du 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the consciousness that possesses the aspect of another were the subject of another object, then a consciousness of form would be the subject of sound and so on, because there would be no difference between them.

original: gzhan yang shes pa gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang gzhan gyi yul can yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang gzhan gyi yul can yin du chug mod /
translated: Moreover, even if the consciousness that possesses the aspect of another were the subject of another object,

original: de lta na yang 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: still, the assertion would not be established.üîΩTo explain this, he says:

original: de bzhin dkar sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin dkar sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Similarly, white and so on.

original: 'di ltar dkar po la sogs pa kho de las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan can gyi dngos po dang bral ba de ltar dmar po la sogs pa'i rig go zhes bya ba de lta bu yang srid bar 'gyur na de lta na yang yan lag can mi 'grub
analyzed: 'di ltar dkar po la sogs pa kho de las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan can gyi dngos po dang bral ba de ltar dmar po la sogs pa'i rig go zhes bya ba de lta bu yang srid bar 'gyur na de lta na yang yan lag can mi 'grub
translated: Thus, it would be possible to say that white and so on are cognized as devoid of a substance that possesses qualities other than those, but even so, the whole would not be established.

original: po // 'ang zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba dang nges par bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: po // 'ang zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba dang nges par bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be applied in order and is for emphasis.

original: dkar sogs zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkar sogs zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase white, etc. should be supplied immediately after this.üîΩThe phrase this is mistaken is supplied by the word because, which is omitted in the verse.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is not directly perceived,üîΩbut is inferred from the fact that it is the basis of the aggregates.

original: 'di 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The reply to this is The person is not the basis of the aggregates.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is the basis of the aggregates, because it is the appropriator of the aggregates, just as the wall is the basis of the picture.üîΩThe reply to this is The person is not the appropriator of the aggregates.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is the appropriator of the aggregates, because it is the experiencer of the results of the aggregates, just as the person who has hired a worker is the one who experiences the results of the work.

original: gang yang / ral ga'i nang gnas skyes bu la //
analyzed: gang yang / ral ga'i nang gnas skyes bu la //
translated: The reply to this is The person is not the experiencer of the results of the aggregates.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is the experiencer of the results of the aggregates, because it is the one who enjoys the results of the aggregates, just as the king is the one who enjoys the results of the work of his subjects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang mngon sum ma yin te /üîΩrtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang mngon sum ma yin te / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reply to this is The person is not the one who enjoys the results of the aggregates.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The opponent may say, The person is the one who enjoys the results of the aggregates, because it is the one who is bound by the fetters of the aggregates, just as the person who has borrowed money is bound by the debt.

original: shes pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //üîΩgzugs la sogs ba 'dus pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu yul can yin pas de'i phyir yan lag can ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no // gzugs la sogs ba 'dus pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu yul can yin pas de'i phyir yan lag can ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The reply to this is The person is not the one who is bound by the fetters of the aggregates.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is the one who is bound by the fetters of the aggregates, because it is the one who is liberated from the fetters of the aggregates, just as the person who has paid his debts is said to be liberated from the debts.

original: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply to this is The person is not the one who is liberated from the fetters of the aggregates.üîΩThe opponent may say, The person is the one who is liberated from the fetters of the aggregates, because it is the one who attains nirvana

original: skyes bu gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam gyis bdag nyid de gnas lugs gang la rgyur yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba la de'i rgyu can gyi gnas lugs te /
analyzed: skyes bu gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam gyis bdag nyid de gnas lugs gang la rgyur yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba la de'i rgyu can gyi gnas lugs te /
translated: The self is the mere collection of the aggregates of form and so on.üîΩ

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par ral ga gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par ral ga gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The person is the mere collection of form and so on.  The state of affairs that exists as the cause of that is called that.  The state of affairs that is the cause of that is the shape.  The cloth that has the special shape is called that.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bur brjod pa'i rtags kyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bur brjod pa'i rtags kyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This indicates that the cognition that infers the special reason that is expressed as the effect is the cognition that infers the special reason that is expressed as the effect.

original: gang yang gos dmar la ni go zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang gos dmar la ni go zhes smras pa de la /
translated: With regard to what was said, ‚ÄúThe cloth is red,‚Äù

original: dur smrig gur gum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dur smrig gur gum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe saffron is turmeric,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la gos skad cig ma yin ba'i phyir dkar po la sogs pa sngar rang bzhin zhig pa ni /
analyzed: de la gos skad cig ma yin ba'i phyir dkar po la sogs pa sngar rang bzhin zhig pa ni /
translated: In that regard, because the cloth is momentary, the previous nature, such as white, is destroyed.

original: tshogs pa gzhan gyi stobs kyis snga ma med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan gyi stobs kyis snga ma med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yin te /
translated: By the power of another collection, the previous form and so on is produced.

original: de mngon sum gyis bzung ba na /
analyzed: de mngon sum gyis bzung ba na /
translated: When that is apprehended by direct perception,

original: phyis brda ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i khyad par gyi spyi'i yul can gos so gos so zhes bya ba'i mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i kun rdzobs don @261a * //
analyzed: phyis brda ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i khyad par gyi spyi'i yul can gos so gos so zhes bya ba'i mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i kun rdzobs don @261a * //
translated: Later, the cognition of the object of the general characteristic, which is the result of the repeated practice of the sign in accordance with the object, arises in the form of direct perception, ‚Äúcloth, cloth.‚ÄùüîΩAfter that, the cognition of the object of the ultimate truth, which is the absence of the object, arises in the form of a conventional cognition.

original: dam par yul med pa nyid kyi sred pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir 'di la mngon sum nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: dam par yul med pa nyid kyi sred pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir 'di la mngon sum nyid ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, direct perception is not established in this case.

original: 'di rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is this an inference,

original: mngon sum snga mas bzung zin pa yul yin pa'i phyir dang / rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum snga mas bzung zin pa yul yin pa'i phyir dang / rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object has already been apprehended by the previous direct perception and because there is no logical mark.

original: de lta bas na 'di la zil gyis gnon pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la zil gyis gnon pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest basis for the existence of a supernormal cognition in this case.

original: 'di snyam du gal te gos kyi dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs ma nyams pa med pa nyid yin na de ltar bkrus pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang dmigs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te gos kyi dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs ma nyams pa med pa nyid yin na de ltar bkrus pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang dmigs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If the form of the white cloth, etc., is not damaged, it should be perceived even in the state of washing, etc.

original: slar yang chu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slar yang chu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, he says, ‚ÄúAgain, water, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar lcags la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa las 'bar ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye la /
analyzed: ji ltar lcags la sogs pa me dang 'brel pa las 'bar ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye la /
translated: Just as iron and so on, when in contact with fire, arise in the nature of burning and so on,

original: yang sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye ba de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan nyid skye ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //üîΩ'di snyam du gzugs gzhan kho na skye'i snga ma'i rang bzhin zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir snga ma mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: yang sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye ba de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan nyid skye ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do // 'di snyam du gzugs gzhan kho na skye'i snga ma'i rang bzhin zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir snga ma mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: and then arise in the nature of blue and so on, so too, since another form such as white arises, there is no contradiction.

original: phyis zil gyis gnon pa med pa'i phyir dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya snyam du sems na /üîΩgzugs ni gnas skabs de nyid na //
analyzed: phyis zil gyis gnon pa med pa'i phyir dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya snyam du sems na / gzugs ni gnas skabs de nyid na //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe previous nature is not observed because another form arises, and it is not observed later because it is not overcome,‚Äù how do you understand this?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúForm does not exist in that state,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: That which has not abandoned its nature of being unovercome

original: gzhan gyi zil gyis gnon pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zil gyis gnon pa ni ma yin te /
translated: is not overcome by another,

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is just as it was before.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs kyi gzugs kyang zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs kyi gzugs kyang zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the form of the state of being overwhelmed does not abandon the nature of not being overwhelmed. This is the observation of an inconsistency with the pervader.

original: zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yang yongs su 'dor ba khas len par byed na 'di gzhan nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: zil gyis ma mnan pa'i rang bzhin yang yongs su 'dor ba khas len par byed na 'di gzhan nyid du grub bo //
translated: If you accept that the nature of not being overwhelmed is abandoned, then this is established as being different.

original: padma sogs la gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: padma sogs la gzugs la sogs //
translated: The form, etc. of a lotus, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: tha dad tshig dang drug la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad tshig dang drug la sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the different words, etc.üîΩHere,

original: gal te drug pa la sogs pa rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par gyur na de'i tshe las dngos po grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te drug pa la sogs pa rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par gyur na de'i tshe las dngos po grub par 'gyur na /
translated: if the sixth case, etc. were to occur just as the thing is, then at that time the thing would be established.

original: ji srid du rang dbang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba 'di dag phyi rol gyi dngos por gtogs pa'i tha dad pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin na de ji ltar 'di dag las don 'grub pa yin /
analyzed: ji srid du rang dbang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba 'di dag phyi rol gyi dngos por gtogs pa'i tha dad pa la sogs pa la ltos pa ma yin na de ji ltar 'di dag las don 'grub pa yin /
translated: But as long as these elements do not depend on the external things such as difference, etc. that occur merely by the desire of the independent self, how can they establish the meaning of these?

original: de la tshig tha dad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshig tha dad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The different words are ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on.

original: drug pa ni snam bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni snam bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sixth is ‚Äúin the cloth.‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos @261b pas snam bu 'di la gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba bdun pa dang / snam bu'i dngos po ni snam bu nyid do zhes bya ba de la phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos @261b pas snam bu 'di la gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba bdun pa dang / snam bu'i dngos po ni snam bu nyid do zhes bya ba de la phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the seventh, ‚Äúin this cloth, form and so on,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe entity of the cloth is cloth itself.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid sgrub par byed de /
translated: He proves the uncertainty by ‚ÄúThus, the six . . .

original: 'di ltar tshig gi don drug po rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang drug po de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gi don drug po rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang drug po de /
translated: Thus, the existence of the six words is the existence of the six.

original: dag gi sde tshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po'i tha dad pa med na yang drug ba la sogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dag gi sde tshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po'i tha dad pa med na yang drug ba la sogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: In the case of the group of six, and so on, even though there is no difference in the entities, there are six and so on.

original: khyed cag gis ni tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i yod pa nyid mi 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed cag gis ni tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i yod pa nyid mi 'dod do //
translated: You do not assert an existence that is separate from the six words.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: btsun mo rnams bye ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po'i tshig yod na yang don tha dad pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: btsun mo rnams bye ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po'i tshig yod na yang don tha dad pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: The queens are called the sands, and so on, but we do not see any difference in meaning.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin nam mkha' nyid //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin nam mkha' nyid //
translated: The nature of space is space itself.

original: ces bya ba la yang rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la yang rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'dod do //
translated: Here, we do not accept a nature that is different.

original: yod par shes byed ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: yod par shes byed ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The opponent's objection is anticipated in the line If you say that valid cognition establishes existence, and so on.

original: yod par shes par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: yod par shes par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: The object of valid cognition that establishes existence is the reality of things.

original: yod pa la dmigs pa'i byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid ces bya ba ni drug po rnams la chos gzhan yod pa nyid 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa la dmigs pa'i byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid ces bya ba ni drug po rnams la chos gzhan yod pa nyid 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the object of valid cognition that observes existence means that the opponent accepts that the seven categories have the property of existence.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, we think that there is no error.

original: 'dir lan bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan bshad pa /
translated: Here is the reply.

original: khyed la drug las gzhan tshig gi don khyed la thal zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
analyzed: khyed la drug las gzhan tshig gi don khyed la thal zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
translated: The opponent says, You have seven terms, not six, because you have the term 'other.'

original: tshig gi don bdun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don bdun par 'gyur ro //
translated: This makes seven terms.

original: de lta yin dang tshig gi don drug tu khas blangs pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshig gi don drug tu khas blangs pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the assertion that there are six topics would be undermined.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you think that there is no fault because of the assertion,

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar tshig gi don drug go zhes brjod ce na /üîΩde drug chos can du brjod de //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar tshig gi don drug go zhes brjod ce na / de drug chos can du brjod de //
translated: then how could it be said that there are six topics?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdngos po gang dag chos can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag tshig gi don drug go zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / dngos po gang dag chos can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag tshig gi don drug go zhes brjod de /
translated: He says:üîΩThose six are called the basis.üîΩThose entities that are the nature of the basis are called the six topics.

original: chos kyi ngo bo ni tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo ni tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The nature of phenomena is asserted to be only the six topics.

original: ji skad du tshig gi don la 'jug pa'i gzhung las /
analyzed: ji skad du tshig gi don la 'jug pa'i gzhung las /
translated: As the text Entering the Meaning of the Words says:

original: de ltar chos las ma gtogs pa'i chos can dag bstan par byas so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos las ma gtogs pa'i chos can dag bstan par byas so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus phenomena are taught to be only phenomena.

original: de dang de 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do //
analyzed: de dang de 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do //
translated: He explains the response to that with ‚ÄúThat which is related to those‚Äù and so on.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don drug po dag dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don drug po dag dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the six topics.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the qualities of existence, etc.

original: gang gis chos 'di de dag gi yin par 'gyur ba 'brel pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gang gis chos 'di de dag gi yin par 'gyur ba 'brel pa gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the relation that would make these qualities belong to them?

original: 'brel pa med par ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Without a relation, it is not reasonable for something to be the quality of another,

original: ha cang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta @262a * //
analyzed: de lta @262a * //
translated: If that were the case,

original: yin na ni thams cad thams cad kyi chos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin na ni thams cad thams cad kyi chos su 'gyur ro //
translated: then everything would be the quality of everything.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med de 'di ltar 'brel ba ni gnyis kho na ste //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med de 'di ltar 'brel ba ni gnyis kho na ste //
translated: There is no relation at all with them, because there are only two kinds of relations:

original: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the relation of inherence and the relation of conjunction.

original: de la re zhig ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the relation of inherence,

original: de ni yon tan yin pa nyid kyis rdzas kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yon tan yin pa nyid kyis rdzas kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is ascertained only for substances, since it is a quality.

original: 'du ba'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du ba'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the relation of conjunction,

original: de ni dngos po bzhin du gcig nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po bzhin du gcig nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is asserted to be a unity, like an entity.

original: 'du ba'i bdag nyid la yang 'du bas 'brel ba yin na 'du ba gnyis pa khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du ba'i bdag nyid la yang 'du bas 'brel ba yin na 'du ba gnyis pa khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the composite is related to the composite by the relation of inherence, then a second inherence would have to be accepted.

original: 'brel pa med par yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And if the relation of inherence does not exist, then the property and the possessor of the property would not exist.

original: 'brel pa mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines: ‚ÄúThe relation of inherence is not tenable, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that this would lead to an absurd overextension.

original: ci ste tshig gi don drug po de dag gis chos skyed pa'i phyir de dag gi chos 'di 'brel par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste tshig gi don drug po de dag gis chos skyed pa'i phyir de dag gi chos 'di 'brel par brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the property is related to the six categories because it is produced from them,

original: 'o na gal te de lta na de las byung ba'i 'brel pa tsam nyid las chu la sogs pa gzhan la yang 'khar gzhong rnam pa de lta bu la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta na de las byung ba'i 'brel pa tsam nyid las chu la sogs pa gzhan la yang 'khar gzhong rnam pa de lta bu la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, the relation of the water, etc., to the pot would be the relation of origination, and the water, etc., would be related to the pot in that way.

original: de lta yin dad de dag la ldan pa dan 'du ba zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gzhan brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dad de dag la ldan pa dan 'du ba zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gzhan brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the relation of possession and the relation of inherence that you imagine to exist between them would be pointless.

original: gzhan yang / drug po dag la yod pa nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang / drug po dag la yod pa nyid //
translated: Moreover, the property of existence would exist in the six categories.

original: ces bya ba'i chos gzhan yod du chug mod //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i chos gzhan yod du chug mod //
translated: Even if you admit that there is another phenomenon called existence,

original: de lta na yang 'khrul pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'khrul pa kho na ste /
translated: still, it is only a mistake.

original: 'di ltar de la yang ste yod pa nyid la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang ste yod pa nyid la yod pa yin te /
translated: In that case, existence would exist in that, i.e., in the existent,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a thing.

original: de lta yin dang de la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, how could there be a different reason for its classification?

original: ci ste de la yang yod pa nyid gzhan khas len par byed na de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste de la yang yod pa nyid gzhan khas len par byed na de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that existence is different in that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir thug pa med pa mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir thug pa med pa mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, there is no fault of infinite regress.

original: chos gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf you accept another phenomenon called existence,‚Äù etc.

original: thams cad phyi ma phyi ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir chos can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad phyi ma phyi ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir chos can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all things possess later and later phenomena, they would be the property possessor.

original: de lta na yang drug po 'di de dag ni chos can kho nar brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta na yang drug po 'di de dag ni chos can kho nar brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad de /
translated: Even if that were so, it is not tenable to say that these six are only the property possessor.

original: tshig gi don drug las tha dad pa'i chos can gzhan dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don drug las tha dad pa'i chos can gzhan dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because there are other dharmas that are different from the six categories.

original: yang ci ste chos can gyi ngo bo gang dag yin pa de dag kho na drug nyid du nges par bzung ngo snyam pa 'di yang snying po med do //
analyzed: yang ci ste chos can gyi ngo bo gang dag yin pa de dag kho na drug nyid du nges par bzung ngo snyam pa 'di yang snying po med do //
translated: But if you think that the nature of the dharmin is just those six, that is also pointless.

original: de lta na ni yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams mi ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams mi ston par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, qualities, actions, universals, particularities, and inherence would not be taught,

original: 'di dag ni chos can gyi ngo bo kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos can gyi ngo bo kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: because they are not just the nature of the dharmin.

original: 'o na ci @262b zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na ci @262b zhe na ;
translated: Well then, what are they?

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
translated: They are also the nature of dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni rdzas la brten ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rdzas la brten ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on substance.

original: 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan dang ldan pa las so //
analyzed: 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan dang ldan pa las so //
translated: From this very [substance], that is, from possessing other dharmas.

original: yang gzhan gyi drug po rnams yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi drug po rnams yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Again, the other six do exist,

original: yod pa dmigs par byed pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dmigs par byed pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be realized by valid cognition that perceives existence.

original: rtogs par bya ba yang tshig gi don drug gi yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba yang tshig gi don drug gi yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The object to be understood is the consciousness that is the object of the six topics.

original: de yod pa'i tha dad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa'i tha dad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the differentiation of existence.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: shes byas bskyed pa'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: shes byas bskyed pa'i shes pa ni //
translated: the consciousness that is generated by the object of cognition

original: zhes bya ba nyid yin la rjod par byed pas bskyed pa ni brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid yin la rjod par byed pas bskyed pa ni brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: is the object of expression because it is generated by the expression.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi drug par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi drug par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is the sixth basis of differentiation.üîΩBut it is not infinite, nor does it follow that there is another topic of expression apart from the six topics.

original: thug pa med pa yang ma yin zhing tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i tshig gi don gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes zer ba de la yang 'di ni rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa yang ma yin zhing tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i tshig gi don gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes zer ba de la yang 'di ni rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin te /
translated: But this is mere speculation,

original: gal te tshig gi don drug po dag la don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi bdag gi de kho na nyid med par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dag nam mkha'i padma lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tshig gi don drug po dag la don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi bdag gi de kho na nyid med par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dag nam mkha'i padma lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: because if the six topics do not have the nature of things that are able to perform functions, then at that time they would be like a sky flower.

original: don byed pa dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not capable of performing a function.

original: de lta yin dang yod pa dmigs par byed pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang yod pa dmigs par byed pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the valid cognition that perceives existence would not be able to comprehend it.

original: ci ste 'di dag la rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid yod pa yin pa de'i tshe don byed par nus pa de dag dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam shes par 'dod pa la de dag gi yod pa
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag la rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid yod pa yin pa de'i tshe don byed par nus pa de dag dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam shes par 'dod pa la de dag gi yod pa
translated: But if the intrinsic reality of those things exists in that way, then when one wishes to understand the mere exclusion of other attributes of those things that are capable of performing a function,

original: nyid ces bya ba de lta bu gal te tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bas ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba de lta bu gal te tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bas ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: if one teaches that existence by means of a different type of division, then what contradiction is there?

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa de yang blos de la brten nas tha dad pa lta bur / brjod pa 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa de yang blos de la brten nas tha dad pa lta bur / brjod pa 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the nondifference of their intrinsic natures is not contradictory to the statement by the mind that is based on them that they are different.

original: tshig ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig ni 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because words engage by mere wish.

original: bcos ma'i gtam nye bar sbyar ba rnams la byis pa dang dpa' bo la sogs pa'i chos yongs su brtags pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di ni cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcos ma'i gtam nye bar sbyar ba rnams la byis pa dang dpa' bo la sogs pa'i chos yongs su brtags pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di ni cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the application of fabricated terms is like the imputation of the qualities of a child, a hero, and so on, this is not anything at all.

original: byed par nus sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: byed par nus sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference of the capacity, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: with respect to what is said,

original: gal te dang po'i snal ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gal te dang po'i snal ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: If you say that the cloth is established from the first thread, etc.,

original: gal te snam bu'i ming yang dag par thos pa'i gnas skabs dang por byung ba'i snal ma dag las snam bu tha dad par sgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: gal te snam bu'i ming yang dag par thos pa'i gnas skabs dang por byung ba'i snal ma dag las snam bu tha dad par sgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: if you establish that the cloth is different from the first thread that arises at the time of hearing the name ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù then at that time you would be establishing what is already established.

original: dngos po thams cad skad cig ma nyid kyis rdzas snal ma dag las snam bu'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i snal ma rnams de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po med @263a * //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skad cig ma nyid kyis rdzas snal ma dag las snam bu'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i snal ma rnams de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po med @263a * //
translated: Because of the momentariness of all things, the threads that are the referents of the word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù are different from the threads that are the substantial cause of the cloth.

original: na yang skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na yang skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since we accept that they arise,

original: ci ste gang dag snam bu dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i snal ma de dag las snam bu gzhan nyid du sgrub na /
analyzed: ci ste gang dag snam bu dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i snal ma de dag las snam bu gzhan nyid du sgrub na /
translated: But if you prove that the cloth is different from the threads that arise simultaneously with it,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs rnams ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs rnams ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time the reasons are not established.

original: bya ba nyid gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bya ba nyid gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe action itself is one,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te de'i dus su snal ma las ma gtogs pa de dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i snam bu grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de'i dus su snal ma las ma gtogs pa de dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i snam bu grub par gyur na /
translated: If at that time the cloth that arises simultaneously with the threads were established as different from the threads,

original: de'i tshe de snal ma la ltos nas byed pa po tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de snal ma la ltos nas byed pa po tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time, in dependence on the threads, the properties of the different agent and so on would be established.

original: gang gi phyir snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu de nyid 'dir ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu de nyid 'dir ma grub ste /
translated: But because the cloth that is different from the threads is not established here,

original: de dag las tha dad pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that very difference from them is to be proven.

original: snam bu dang snal ma rnams zhes bya ba'i ming tsam las dngos po rnams tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snam bu dang snal ma rnams zhes bya ba'i ming tsam las dngos po rnams tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And things are not different from mere names such as ‚Äúcloth‚Äù and ‚Äúthreads.‚Äù

original: dgos pa gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang ming gzhan sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang ming gzhan sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also applied to other things by the power of other needs.

original: 'di ltar snal ma kha cig khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa ni grang ba la sogs pa don gcig byed par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar snal ma kha cig khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa ni grang ba la sogs pa don gcig byed par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, some threads obtain the state of being special, and are able to perform the single purpose of keeping out the cold, etc.

original: gang dag byed ba po cung zad yin pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag byed ba po cung zad yin pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not any other agent.

original: de la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis tha snyad ma 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis tha snyad ma 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent confusion in the usage of those who designate conventions,

original: don gzhan med na yang don gcig byed pa la nye bar mkho ba'i snal ma khyad par can rnams bstan par 'dod nas snam bu zhes sgra gcig nye bar sbyor ro ;
analyzed: don gzhan med na yang don gcig byed pa la nye bar mkho ba'i snal ma khyad par can rnams bstan par 'dod nas snam bu zhes sgra gcig nye bar sbyor ro ;
translated: even though there is no other object, desiring to indicate the special threads that are necessary for performing the single purpose, they apply the single term ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: / yang ci'i phyir sgra gcig nye bar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: / yang ci'i phyir sgra gcig nye bar sbyor zhe na /
translated: Why is the single term applied?

original: sgra re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúeach‚Äù is stated, etc.

original: so sor sgra re rer brjod na dka' ba'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: so sor sgra re rer brjod na dka' ba'i skyon yod de /
translated: If each is stated separately, there is the fault of difficulty.

original: 'di ltar de la brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed par rung ba'i dngos po ji snyed pa la sgra de snyed sbyar bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dka' ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed par rung ba'i dngos po ji snyed pa la sgra de snyed sbyar bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dka' ba'i skyon no //
translated: Thus, there is the fault of difficulty, because the word is applied to as many things as are suitable to establish a single thing that is desired to be expressed.

original: 'di dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir yang mi nus pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir yang mi nus pa'i skyon no //
translated: There is also the fault of impossibility, because it is impossible to teach the uncommon nature of these.

original: rloms te spyi'i rnam pas ston pa na /
analyzed: rloms te spyi'i rnam pas ston pa na /
translated: When one teaches with a general aspect,

original: sgra gcig nyid bstan pa mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra gcig nyid bstan pa mchog yin gyi /
translated: it is best to teach with a single word.

original: so so so sor ston pa'i sbyor ba 'di la 'bras bu 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i skyon no ;
analyzed: so so so sor ston pa'i sbyor ba 'di la 'bras bu 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i skyon no ;
translated: There is the fault of being fruitless, because no result is observed in this application of teaching each individually.

original: / dngos po mtha' dag brjod par 'dong pa na don ma lus pa brjod par byas na tha snyad sla ba yon tan yin te /
analyzed: / dngos po mtha' dag brjod par 'dong pa na don ma lus pa brjod par byas na tha snyad sla ba yon tan yin te /
translated: When one desires to express all things, if one expresses all meanings, it is a good quality to make the expression easy,

original: 'gro ba dang / srid pa gsum dang / sna tshogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / srid pa gsum dang / sna tshogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the words ‚Äúworld,‚Äù ‚Äúthree existences,‚Äù and ‚Äúvariety.‚Äù

original: brjod pa gcig ces bya ba ni snam bu zhes bya ba tshig gcig ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: brjod pa gcig ces bya ba ni snam bu zhes bya ba tshig gcig ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The term ‚Äúone expression‚Äù means one word, such as ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: byed pa po dang nus pa dang / @263b yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa'i chos kyang yin pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang nus pa dang / @263b yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa'i chos kyang yin pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is a quality of the agent, the object, the instrument, the action, the power, the transformation, and so on, it is called that.

original: de nas tha dad pa'i sgra dang khyad par gyi bsdu ba byas nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tha dad pa'i sgra dang khyad par gyi bsdu ba byas nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a compound with the word ‚Äúdifferent,‚Äù it should be taught.

original: gang yang rags pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang rags pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la /
translated: Now, in regard to the statement, ‚ÄúThe gross object does not exist,‚Äù and so on, he says,

original: gang dag rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe atoms, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: The atoms, etc., are not established as being beyond the senses,

original: khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa rnams kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa rnams kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are apprehended by the senses when they attain the state of the special whole.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la rdul phra rab rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad du dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur gyi kho bo cag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la rdul phra rab rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad du dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur gyi kho bo cag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because in the system that maintains that the subtle atoms are permanent, all subtle atoms would be imperceptible, since they are undifferentiated. But this is not the case for us.

original: phan tshun du lhan cig ces bya ba ni gcig la gcig grogs byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun du lhan cig ces bya ba ni gcig la gcig grogs byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúMutually, simultaneously‚Äù means ‚Äúhelping each other.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbang po spyod yul de nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbang po spyod yul de nyid ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúBlue, etc.‚Äù indicates the objects of the senses.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab rnams shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas gnas par 'dod kyi de dag de'i ngo bos mtshon pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab rnams shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi dbye bas gnas par 'dod kyi de dag de'i ngo bos mtshon pa ni ma yin na /
translated: But if the subtle atoms are maintained to exist in the divisions of east, west, etc., and are not characterized by those,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag mngon sum nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag mngon sum nyid yin zhe na /
translated: then how are they perceptible?

original: gal te'ang 'di dag shar nub tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te'ang 'di dag shar nub tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are east, west, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: mngon sum gyi gnod pa med pa ni mngon sum gnod pa med pa'i zhes bsdu ba'am /üîΩ'di bsdu ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gnod pa med pa ni mngon sum gnod pa med pa'i zhes bsdu ba'am / 'di bsdu ba med pa yin te /
translated: Or, it is not a compound word.

original: gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: Because there is no error, it is non-erroneous.

original: sbyar ba'i btung ba la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyar ba'i btung ba la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is just perception, like a drink that is ready to drink.

original: 'di ltar sbyar ba'i btung ba dang / rdo tshan dang chu dang gser la sogs pa la 'dres pa'i rdul phra rab rnams de ltar dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyar ba'i btung ba dang / rdo tshan dang chu dang gser la sogs pa la 'dres pa'i rdul phra rab rnams de ltar dmigs te /
translated: In this way, the subtle particles that are mixed in a drink, in hot sand, in water, in gold, and so on are perceived.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams rdzas mi rtsom ba'i phyir de la yan lag can gyi rdzas yod pa ma yin la rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'i ldan pa mthong ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams rdzas mi rtsom ba'i phyir de la yan lag can gyi rdzas yod pa ma yin la rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'i ldan pa mthong ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Since things of different types do not form substances, the substance of a whole does not exist there. It is also not tenable that possession is seen to be different from the subtle particles,

original: rten ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the basis is not seen.

original: gang du ldan pa can gcig kyang ma mthong ba de la ldan pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du ldan pa can gcig kyang ma mthong ba de la ldan pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Where even one possessor is not seen, possession is not seen.

original: dper na sha za dang bum pa'i ldan pa dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang ; nam mkha'i phyogs dang yul gyi ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sha za dang bum pa'i ldan pa dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang ; nam mkha'i phyogs dang yul gyi ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the possession of a flesh-eater and a pot, or the possession of the orb of the moon and the direction of space and the place.

original: yang gang du rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyi thams cad kyi ldan bcad ma mthong ba der ji ltar de la brten pa'i ldan pa mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gang du rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyi thams cad kyi ldan bcad ma mthong ba der ji ltar de la brten pa'i ldan pa mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, where the possession of all that has the nature of a subtle particle is not seen, how could the possession that is based on that be seen?

original: gal te de lta na rnam pa thams cad kyis ma nges na /üîΩji ltar 'di dag mngon sum nyid du rigs pa @264a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na rnam pa thams cad kyis ma nges na / ji ltar 'di dag mngon sum nyid du rigs pa @264a * //
translated: If it is so that it is not ascertained in every way,

original: dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is it reasonable that these are direct perception?

original: kun las log pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun las log pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is the opposite of all.‚Äù

original: tshul rol mthong ba rnams kyi dngos po mngon sum gyis bzung na yang rnam pa thams cad du nges pa ni gang na yang med de /
analyzed: tshul rol mthong ba rnams kyi dngos po mngon sum gyis bzung na yang rnam pa thams cad du nges pa ni gang na yang med de /
translated: Even when things are apprehended by direct perception of those who see the mode, there is no certainty in every way.

original: ji tsam du dngos po don gzhan las ldog pas byas pa'i ngo bos de nges pa de tsam du mngon sum mo zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi rnam pa thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po don gzhan las ldog pas byas pa'i ngo bos de nges pa de tsam du mngon sum mo zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi rnam pa thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: To the extent that a thing is ascertained by the nature of its exclusion from other things, to that extent it is direct perception. But it is not in every respect.

original: rnam pa gzhan bzung du zin kyang nges pa mi 'thad pas tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid kyis ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan bzung du zin kyang nges pa mi 'thad pas tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid kyis ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if another aspect is apprehended, it is not tenable that there is ascertainment, because it is not suitable as a convention, as if it were not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù means just as the thing is experienced.

original: 'on te dngos po ni cha med pa nyid kyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ci'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyis nges mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po ni cha med pa nyid kyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ci'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyis nges mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the thing, because it is partless, is experienced by direct perception with its entire nature, why is there no ascertainment with its entire nature?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid cha med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid cha med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe own characteristic is partless,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po la yod pa ni dbang po can te /
analyzed: dbang po la yod pa ni dbang po can te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a sense faculty‚Äù means having a sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúa consciousness of a sense faculty.‚Äù

original: rtog pa yod pa ma yin pa ste rtog pa med pa de yin la dbang po can yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog pa yod pa ma yin pa ste rtog pa med pa de yin la dbang po can yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It is non-conceptual, i.e., it is without conceptualization, and it is a sense-perception.

original: des rtogs bya ni rtog pa med pa'i dbang po'i shes pas rtog par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des rtogs bya ni rtog pa med pa'i dbang po'i shes pas rtog par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object of that is the object of a non-conceptual sense-perception.

original: gang las tha dad nges pa zhes bya ba ni gang las tha dad pa ste ldog pa ni gang las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gang las tha dad nges pa zhes bya ba ni gang las tha dad pa ste ldog pa ni gang las tha dad pa'o //
translated: From which there is ascertainment means from which there is a determination, i.e., a differentiation.

original: der nges pa ni gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: der nges pa ni gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment is a determination.

original: de'i rgyu ni goms pa dang ; nye ba dang ches cher nye ba dang blo gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni goms pa dang ; nye ba dang ches cher nye ba dang blo gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its cause is familiarity, proximity, greater proximity, and the clarity of the mind, etc.

original: nyams su myong ba tsam kho na nges pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam kho na nges pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Mere experience is not the cause of ascertainment.

original: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: However, familiarity, etc., are also.

original: nges na gang na de dag yod pa der nges pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges na gang na de dag yod pa der nges pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When there is ascertainment, it arises in regard to that in which those are present. This is the meaning.

original: 'di thams cad kyang rdul phra rab rnams grub cing phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas brjod de /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang rdul phra rab rnams grub cing phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas brjod de /
translated: All of these are stated by accepting that the subtle particles are established and that external objects are established by direct perception.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba gang gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor mngon sum gyis ma grub ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba gang gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor mngon sum gyis ma grub ste /
translated: According to the Proponents of Consciousness, the entity of external objects such as blue are not established by direct perception.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med par yang rnam pa de lta bu'i sngon po la sogs pa snang bar dmigs pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med par yang rnam pa de lta bu'i sngon po la sogs pa snang bar dmigs pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is doubt that the entity of external objects such as blue appear in dreams and so on even though external objects do not exist.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i shes pa snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i shes pa snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The entity of blue and so on is also the nature of an erroneous consciousness that is empty of being either one or many.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The subtle particles are also not established.

original: de dag shar dang gzhan du gnas pa nyid kyis phyogs cha tha dad pas @264b gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shar dang gzhan du gnas pa nyid kyis phyogs cha tha dad pas @264b gcig tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not established as one because they have different directional parts, existing in the east and so on.

original: de la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bos rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum nyid yin /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bos rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum nyid yin /
translated: How can subtle particles that have the nature of blue and so on be directly perceptible?

original: shar dang gzhan du yang shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: shar dang gzhan du yang shes par mi nus te /
translated: They cannot be known to be in the east or in other directions.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis don gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis don gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: One can say that they are imputed to be other objects due to the causes of error.

original: 'di snyam du gal te yan lag can med par 'gyur na /
