analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yan lag can med par 'gyur na /
translated: If you think that if the possessor of parts does not exist,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar rdul phra rab mang po dag la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar rdul phra rab mang po dag la /
translated: then how could many subtle particles

original: mig byed pa dag dang ldan pa ro gcig ces nges par 'gyur snyam du sems na /üîΩji ltar 'bar mtshungs 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig byed pa dag dang ldan pa ro gcig ces nges par 'gyur snyam du sems na / ji ltar 'bar mtshungs 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that possess the activity of the eye be ascertained as a single taste?üîΩThe root text says, ‚ÄúJust as a flame is similar to its arising,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar mar me la sogs pa tha dad pa yin na yang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bar med pa 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me la sogs pa tha dad pa yin na yang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bar med pa 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as a flame and so on are different, but because similar things arise in an unbroken continuum, they are said to be one.

original: gcig nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ches phra ba'i dngos po du ma bar med par rigs pas gcig nyid du 'khrul pa de'i phyir skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gcig nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ches phra ba'i dngos po du ma bar med par rigs pas gcig nyid du 'khrul pa de'i phyir skyon 'di med do //
translated: Just as a multiplicity of subtle particles is mistaken as a single thing, in the same way, a multiplicity of subtle things without interstice is mistaken as a single thing by reasoning. Therefore, this error does not arise.

original: gal te de lta na tha dad du mi dmigs pa na ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de lta na tha dad du mi dmigs pa na ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur pa yin zhe na ;
translated: If that is so, when a multiplicity is not observed, how can subtle particles be established by direct perception?

original: rnam dbye mi ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam dbye mi ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúIf the distinction is not negated . . .‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par phye nas nges par ma bzung na mngon sum du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par phye nas nges par ma bzung na mngon sum du mi 'dod na /
translated: If, having distinguished them, one does not apprehend them, then they are not asserted to be direct perception.

original: de'i tshe mar me la sogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par dbye ba ma shes pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mar me la sogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par dbye ba ma shes pa na /
translated: In that case, if one does not understand the distinction of the prior and subsequent states of a lamp,

original: de ji ltar mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yin /
translated: how can one see it as direct perception?

original: yan lag can yang yan lag rnam par dbye bas ma bzung ba gang yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag can yang yan lag rnam par dbye bas ma bzung ba gang yang yod /
translated: Is there any possessor of parts that is not apprehended by the apprehension of the distinction of its parts?

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir mngon sum nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir mngon sum nyid du 'dod /
translated: In the same way, why is it asserted to be direct perception?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ma nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ma nges so //
translated: Therefore this is indeterminate.

original: 'di tsam zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgol bar 'dod pa gzhan dag la slob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgol bar 'dod pa gzhan dag la slob par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase this much refers to the fact that the opponent is being taught that the object of knowledge is not beyond the scope of the two truths.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams so //
translated: The phrase these refers to the atoms.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams rnam par phye nas mi shes pa gang yin pa de yang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu ma yin te gzhan las kyang nges pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams rnam par phye nas mi shes pa gang yin pa de yang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu ma yin te gzhan las kyang nges pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te
translated: The phrase that too refers to the fact that the object of knowledge that is not cognized by the analysis of atoms is not a cause for the nonapprehension of blue, etc., that is included in the atoms, because certainty arises from another.

original: / 'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod par smra pas shes pa 'di yul med par 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: / 'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod par smra pas shes pa 'di yul med par 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, the opponent who asserts the existence of external objects should not assert that this consciousness is without an object, because

original: gzhan du na rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, it would be just the view of consciousness only.

original: rags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'di yang gcig yin nam du ma yin grang /
analyzed: rags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'di yang gcig yin nam du ma yin grang /
translated: Is this object, such as form, that appears as a coarse entity one or many?

original: gcig yin na yang yan lag rnams kyis brtsams pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: gcig yin na yang yan lag rnams kyis brtsams pa zhig yin nam /
translated: If it is one, is it a composition of parts or not?

original: ma brtsams pa zhig yin de la re zhig 'di ni gzugs sogs gnyi ga'i bdag gcig tu @265a * //
analyzed: ma brtsams pa zhig yin de la re zhig 'di ni gzugs sogs gnyi ga'i bdag gcig tu @265a * //
translated: If it is not begun, then it is not the self of both form and so on.

original: regs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: regs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that form and so on are the self of both.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts direct perception and so on.

original: 'gal ba 'di gang zhe na /üîΩrags pa gcig gi rang bzhin na //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di gang zhe na / rags pa gcig gi rang bzhin na //
translated: What is this contradiction?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te rags pa gcig yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te rags pa gcig yin na /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf the nature of one coarse thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs pa dang / phyogs gcig kha bsgyur ba na thams cad kha bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs pa dang / phyogs gcig kha bsgyur ba na thams cad kha bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is one coarse thing, then when one part is obstructed, all are obstructed, and when one part is dyed, all are dyed.

original: bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / kha bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dag la khyed cag gi 'dod pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / kha bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dag la khyed cag gi 'dod pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because according to your assertion, the obstructed and unobstructed, the dyed and the undyed, are not different.

original: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is also not reasonable for one thing to possess qualities that are mutually contradictory.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: sna tshogs rdzas gcig tu 'gyur la //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdzas gcig tu 'gyur la //
translated: it would be a variety that is one substance.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that they are co-originated, etc.

original: phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs par mthong ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs par mthong ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
translated: And it is contrary to direct perception, because when one part is covered, the whole is not seen to be covered.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is contrary to inference,

original: 'di ltar gang zhig phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
translated: because whatever is endowed with mutually contradictory properties is not one,

original: dper na ba lang dang ma he bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang ma he bzhin no //
translated: like a cow and a buffalo.

original: rags pa yang dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa'i ngo bos 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa yang dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa'i ngo bos 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the gross is endowed with contradictory properties, in that it is the nature of being perceived and not being perceived, and the nature of being covered and not being covered. This is the observation of a contradictory property that is a differentiator.

original: thams cad gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The consequence that everything is one is an invalidating means of valid knowledge.

original: gsal byed pa na re gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgra sbyor ba mi 'thad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gsal byed pa na re gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgra sbyor ba mi 'thad do zhes zer te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says: It is not tenable to apply the term all to one because there is no difference.

original: de 'di 'on te gcig gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ste /
analyzed: de 'di 'on te gcig gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ste /
translated: The SautrƒÅntika responds to this qualm with, ‚ÄúBut if it is the nature of one, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar thams cad kyi sgra don du ma'i yul can yin zhing yan lag can ni du ma'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad kyi sgra don du ma'i yul can yin zhing yan lag can ni du ma'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus the term all is the object of many meanings and the possessor of parts is not the nature of many.üîΩTherefore, how could it be said that all are obscured by that?

original: de la ji ltar gang gis thams cad bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa thams cad kyi sgra sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gang gis thams cad bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa thams cad kyi sgra sbyor bar byed /
translated: The term all is applied.

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The SautrƒÅntika responds to this with, ‚ÄúWhatever is established, etc.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na gos dang lus la sogs pa grub pa gang yin pa de kho na khyed cag gis yan lag can nyid du brtags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gos dang lus la sogs pa grub pa gang yin pa de kho na khyed cag gis yan lag can nyid du brtags te /
translated: Whatever is established in the world, such as clothing and the body, is only imputed by you to be the possessor of parts.

original: de la yang 'jig rten na thams cad dang phyogs gcig gi sgra dag 'jug par grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'jig rten na thams cad dang phyogs gcig gi sgra dag 'jug par grub pa kho na'o //
translated: The terms all and one part are applied to that in the world.

original: de skad du yang gos thams cad dmar por zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba por 'gyur @265b ba yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang gos thams cad dmar por zhes bya ba la sogs par smra ba por 'gyur @265b ba yin no //
translated: In that case, you would be the one who says, ‚ÄúAll the cloth is red.‚Äù

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i brjod par 'dod pa'i 'jig rten gang yin pa 'di /üîΩyul shin tu ches yangs pa non par gnas pa'i ras yug la sogs pa'i dngos por rtogs pa'i dmar po la sogs par bstan par 'dod pa de la yang kho bo cag gis kyang grags pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khyed cag la 'gal ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i brjod par 'dod pa'i 'jig rten gang yin pa 'di / yul shin tu ches yangs pa non par gnas pa'i ras yug la sogs pa'i dngos por rtogs pa'i dmar po la sogs par bstan par 'dod pa de la yang kho bo cag gis kyang grags pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khyed cag la 'gal ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The world that you want to express in this wayüîΩis the one that understands the cloth and so on, which are very extensive objects, as red and so on. We also follow what is renowned in the world and apply the terms ‚Äúall‚Äù and so on to that.

original: thams cad la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: We do so in order to demonstrate the contradiction to you.

original: khyed cag rags pa gcig nyid du khas len pa la skyon 'di 'ong gi / kho bo cag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag rags pa gcig nyid du khas len pa la skyon 'di 'ong gi / kho bo cag la ni ma yin no //
translated: This fault arises for those who assert that the coarse is a single unit, but it does not arise for us.

original: kho bo cag gis ni rags pa gcig nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni rags pa gcig nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that the coarse is a single unit.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la yang skyon med pa kho na ste ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la yang skyon med pa kho na ste ;
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúWe are also without fault.

original: 'di ltar btags nas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar btags nas te /
translated: This is because we impute

original: 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: This is a mere imputation.

original: snal ma la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la de'i rgyu nyid kyi snam bu la sogs par brjod de /üîΩdes na thams cad la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: snal ma la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la de'i rgyu nyid kyi snam bu la sogs par brjod de / des na thams cad la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Cloth and so on are said to be the cause of such parts as thread and so on.üîΩThus, the terms all and so on are applied.

original: gal te de lta na tshig tha dad de /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tshig tha dad de /
translated: If that is so, then the terms all and so on would be different words.

original: thams cad rnams /
analyzed: thams cad rnams /
translated: All

original: gos rnams dmar po rnams zhes thams cad du mang po'i tshig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gos rnams dmar po rnams zhes thams cad du mang po'i tshig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: would be a plural term for all red cloths and so on.

original: khyed cag ni mang po rnams la tshig gcig 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag ni mang po rnams la tshig gcig 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: You do not assert that a single term is used for a plurality.

original: ci ste yang yan lag can du gtogs pa'i grangs gcig blangs nas yan lag rnams la rang gi brjod par bya ba la gnas pa'i rtags kyi grangs gos la sogs pa'i sgra mdor ba kho nar 'jug pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang yan lag can du gtogs pa'i grangs gcig blangs nas yan lag rnams la rang gi brjod par bya ba la gnas pa'i rtags kyi grangs gos la sogs pa'i sgra mdor ba kho nar 'jug pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the number one that is included in the possessor of parts is taken up by the parts and the terms cloth and so on are used only in the sense of the number of their objects,

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then that is illogical.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says:

original: dngos dang btags par 'dod pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos dang btags par 'dod pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Those that are asserted to be real or imputed

original: gal te bstan pa 'di brtags pa yin na de'i tshe dngos dang btags pa'i yul la blo tha dad pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: gal te bstan pa 'di brtags pa yin na de'i tshe dngos dang btags pa'i yul la blo tha dad pa'i blo ste /
translated: If this teaching is investigated, then at that time, the mind that is different from the mind that is the object of the real and the object of the nominal,

original: mi 'dra ba 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa dang / ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur na tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa dang / ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur na tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is, the mind that is the conception of error and the mind that is the conception of non-error, would be different. But they are not different.

original: 'di ltar gos thams cad dmar po zhes bya ba 'di la gos dmar ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gos thams cad dmar po zhes bya ba 'di la gos dmar ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, in the statement ‚Äúall cloth is red,‚Äù the cloth is not red.

original: 'on kyang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i snal ma rnams la dmar po'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i snal ma rnams la dmar po'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Rather, the threads that are the cause of the cloth are red. Such a mind does not engage.

original: yang gi sgra las khyed cag gis gos la thams cad kyi sgras brjod par bya bar 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra las khyed cag gis gos la thams cad kyi sgras brjod par bya bar 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the root verse indicates that you do not assert that the word all refers to the cloth.

original: de gcig yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de'i grangs blangs nas thams cad kyi sgra gos la sogs pa dang lhan cig yan lag rnams la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de gcig yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de'i grangs blangs nas thams cad kyi sgra gos la sogs pa dang lhan cig yan lag rnams la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is one, how could it be counted as one of them? How could the word all be applied to the parts together with the cloth and so on?

original: yang na dngos dang btags par 'dod pa dag gi blo tha dad pa ni sna tshogs pa @266a * //üîΩnyid de / de ni 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos dang btags par 'dod pa dag gi blo tha dad pa ni sna tshogs pa @266a * // nyid de / de ni 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the various cognitions of those who assert that the cloth is real or nominal do not exist here.

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin du snal ma dang snam bu dag ngo bo tha dad par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin du snal ma dang snam bu dag ngo bo tha dad par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, like form, taste, etc., the cloth and the threads are not perceived to be different entities.

original: ngo bo tha dad dag tu mi dmigs pa dag la ni dngos dang btags pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad dag tu mi dmigs pa dag la ni dngos dang btags pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And those that are not perceived to be different entities cannot be real or nominal.

original: 'on te ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag pos lan 'debs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag pos lan 'debs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: Now, in order to anticipate the reply of the opponent, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the cloth is the possessor of the threads, etc.‚Äù

original: des smras pa dur smrig dang gur gum la sogs pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa'i gos ni dmar por brjod la /üîΩldan pa yang ma khyab par 'jug ste /
analyzed: des smras pa dur smrig dang gur gum la sogs pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa'i gos ni dmar por brjod la / ldan pa yang ma khyab par 'jug ste /
translated: He says that a cloth is described as red when it possesses the substance of red dye, such as lac or saffron.üîΩBut possession does not pervade, because the cloth is not red when it possesses the substance of a white dye.

original: des na gcig dmar ba na thams cad dmar bar ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na gcig dmar ba na thams cad dmar bar ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when one part is red, the whole is not red.

original: gos la sogs pas kyang lus kyi phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gos la sogs pas kyang lus kyi phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na thams cad bsgribs pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: And when the body is covered by a cloth, etc., the whole is not covered.

original: de 'di ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: ci ste cha shas med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste cha shas med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is said that it is partless, etc.

original: gal te snam bu la sogs pa rdzas gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe gang gis ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug par 'gyur ba cha shas med pa'i rdzas de la dur smrig la sogs pas ma khyab pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te snam bu la sogs pa rdzas gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe gang gis ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug par 'gyur ba cha shas med pa'i rdzas de la dur smrig la sogs pas ma khyab pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If cloth, etc. were a single substance, then what partless substance would not be pervaded by saffron, etc., since it would pervade it?

original: ci ste ma khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs rnams khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste ma khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs rnams khas len par byed na /
translated: But if you accept that there are states that are not pervaded,

original: de'i tshe de'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i gnas skabs na /
translated: then at that time,

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad par grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad par grub ste /
translated: because of that, it is established that they are different,

original: khyab pa dang ma khyab pa dag 'gal bas rang bzhin gcig nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: khyab pa dang ma khyab pa dag 'gal bas rang bzhin gcig nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because pervasion and nonpervasion are contradictory and it is not possible for them to be the same nature.

original: / gcig yul shin tu ches yangs par gnas pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gcig yul shin tu ches yangs par gnas pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that a single thing exists in a very extensive place,

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is partless.

original: gzhan du chu'i skye bo dang glang po che la sogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du chu'i skye bo dang glang po che la sogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, all beings in the water, elephants, etc., would be the same, because they are not different.

original: rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro //üîΩyan lag nyung du dang ches mang bas brtsams pa la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na /üîΩ'o na yan lag rnams nyid nyung du dang ches mang ba dag de lta de ltar skye ba na rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la rag mong /
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro // yan lag nyung du dang ches mang bas brtsams pa la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na / 'o na yan lag rnams nyid nyung du dang ches mang ba dag de lta de ltar skye ba na rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la rag mong /
translated: Therefore, they would not be differentiated as gross or subtle, etc.üîΩIf you say that there is a difference due to the difference in the number of parts, such as fewer or more,

original: de brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then the cause for the presentation of gross and subtle is just the arising of the parts themselves, fewer or more. What is the use of a whole that is composed of parts?

original: de'i nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its power is not seen.

original: yan lag rnams la nyung ba nyid dang mang ba nyid yod na yang gang gis rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba yan lag can rnams cha shas med pa nyid kyis phan tshun du khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin
analyzed: yan lag rnams la nyung ba nyid dang mang ba nyid yod na yang gang gis rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba yan lag can rnams cha shas med pa nyid kyis phan tshun du khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin
translated: If the parts have fewer or more parts, then by what are the distinctions of gross and subtle, etc. made? The wholes do not have any difference from each other because they are partless.

original: no // de dag la yan lag mang ba dang nyung ba nyid @266b bzung bas byas pa'i khyad par yod na yang yan lag can nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: no // de dag la yan lag mang ba dang nyung ba nyid @266b bzung bas byas pa'i khyad par yod na yang yan lag can nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the difference is made by the difference in the number of parts, then the wholes are admitted.

original: de nyid la rags pa la sogs par tha snyad byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la rags pa la sogs par tha snyad byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventions of gross, etc. are made in regard to them.

original: de lta yin dang rdul phra rab tsam nyid mthong ba nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rdul phra rab tsam nyid mthong ba nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the mere subtle atom is admitted to be seen,

original: rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because nothing other than gross and subtle, etc. is seen.

original: gzhan yang ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba don ci yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba don ci yin /
translated: Moreover, what is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúPossession operates without pervading‚Äù?

original: gal te rdzas thams cad la ma khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas thams cad la ma khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin na /
translated: If the meaning is that it does not pervade all substances,

original: de mi rigs te rdzas la thams cad kyi sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste don gyi phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: de mi rigs te rdzas la thams cad kyi sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // ci ste don gyi phyogs gcig la /
translated: that is not correct, because you have accepted that substance is not the referent of the word all.

original: 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba yin na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba yin na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If the meaning is that it engages one part of the object, that is not correct either,

original: de la phyogs gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no parts.

original: de rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it engages the parts that compose it,

original: gal te de lta na yan lag rnams nyid dmar po yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yan lag rnams nyid dmar po yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: then since the parts are red,

original: yan lag can gyi ngo bo dmar po ma yin pa'i phyir dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa mtshungs par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ngo bo dmar po ma yin pa'i phyir dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa mtshungs par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be as if the red and the nonred were seen equally, because the nature of the possessor of the parts is not red.

original: gzhan yang gang yang de'i rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag 'di gal te yan lag can gyi ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang yang de'i rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag 'di gal te yan lag can gyi ngo bo yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the parts that compose it are the nature of the possessor of the parts,

original: de'i tshe de la yang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid do zhes brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la yang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid do zhes brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs so //
translated: At that time, it is also the same to argue and investigate that it is just engaged in one part of the possession.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo yin na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo yin na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is the entity of a subtle particle, then at that time, because subtle particles are beyond the sense faculties,

original: de la brten pa'i ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir dmar por dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i ldan pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir dmar por dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the possession that is based on them is also beyond the sense faculties, it would not be observed as red.

original: 'di snyam du dper na sor mo'i gzugs khyab pa rten dmigs pa kho na na dmigs par 'dod pa de bzhin du ldan pa ni rten dmigs pa kho na na dmigs pa ma yin pas des na 'di ma khyab par 'jug par brjod pa yin no snyam du
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na sor mo'i gzugs khyab pa rten dmigs pa kho na na dmigs par 'dod pa de bzhin du ldan pa ni rten dmigs pa kho na na dmigs pa ma yin pas des na 'di ma khyab par 'jug par brjod pa yin no snyam du
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúJust as the form of a finger is observed only when the basis, the pervader, is observed, in the same way, possession is not observed only when the basis, the pervader, is observed. Therefore it is said to be engaged without pervading,‚Äù

original: sems na / de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems na / de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: dper na bum pa dang sha za ba'i ldan pa bzhin du rten dmigs pa'i ldan pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang sha za ba'i ldan pa bzhin du rten dmigs pa'i ldan pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the possession of a vase and a ghost does not exist, the possession of the basis and the observed object does not exist.

original: de lta yin dang dmar po yang rten ma dmigs par mi mthong la rten dmigs pa nyid na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dmar po yang rten ma dmigs par mi mthong la rten dmigs pa nyid na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then since the support of the red color is not seen when the support is not seen, and when the support is seen, the supported is seen,

original: de ltar de yang khyab par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de yang khyab par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the pervasion would be established.

original: 'di snyam du dmar po ma yin pa'i yan lag gzhan la 'du ba'i rdzas dmigs na yang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi dmar po dmigs pa ma yin no //üîΩdes na 'di rten dmigs @267a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du dmar po ma yin pa'i yan lag gzhan la 'du ba'i rdzas dmigs na yang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi dmar po dmigs pa ma yin no // des na 'di rten dmigs @267a * //
translated: If you think that even though the substance that is the support of the other parts that are not red is seen, the red that is the supported is not seen,

original: pa na dmigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: pa na dmigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: then when the support is seen, the supported is not seen.

original: de yang mi rigs te /üîΩde ltar na dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa la 'du ba'i yan lag can ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dmar po'i yan lag la yang de'i sgo nas dmar po mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te / de ltar na dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa la 'du ba'i yan lag can ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dmar po'i yan lag la yang de'i sgo nas dmar po mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: rten dmigs na yang de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dmigs na yang de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then because the possessor of the parts that are red and not red is one, it follows that the part that is red would not be seen in the part that is red, because when the support is seen, the supported is not seen.

original: rten dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i ldan pa 'dzin pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i ldan pa 'dzin pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no way to apprehend the possessor other than by apprehending the support.

original: de lta bas na ngo bo gcig pa yul yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo bo gcig pa yul yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not logical that a single entity is the object.

original: du ma'i ngo bo yin na yang shugs kyis rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kho nar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo yin na yang shugs kyis rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kho nar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Even if it is a multiple entity, it is still the nature of an aggregation of atoms.

original: yan lag gi yod pa ni gcig nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid du grub la /
analyzed: yan lag gi yod pa ni gcig nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid du grub la /
translated: Because it is not logical that the existence of a part is a single entity.üîΩTherefore, pots and so on are established as having the nature of atoms.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa yin par grub ste /
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa yin par grub ste /
translated: Thus, blue and so on are established as the aspect of atoms.

original: gzhan yul gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yul gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other single object.üîΩAlso, it is said:

original: gang yang / rdul phran brjod pa la'ang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang yang / rdul phran brjod pa la'ang med par 'gyur //
translated: Even the expression ‚Äúatom‚Äù would not exist.

original: zhes smos pa de la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa de la /
translated: With regard to that, it is said:

original: de nyid don ni mi shes pa'i ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbrtags pa de la ltos pa can //
analyzed: de nyid don ni mi shes pa'i ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / brtags pa de la ltos pa can //
translated: The meaning of that is not understood.üîΩThat which is dependent on that imputation

original: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i rags pa de la ltos pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i rags pa de la ltos pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: is the one that has the dependence on that imputed coarse object.

original: lan gzhan bshad pa ni yang na rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan gzhan bshad pa ni yang na rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other explanation of the response is ‚Äúbecause of the reason‚Äù and so on.

original: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba ni cha med pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa la ste /
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba ni cha med pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa la ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù refers to the partless and the impeded.üîΩFor example, it is like the term ‚Äúrich man‚Äù being applied to a poor man without any reason for the term ‚Äúrich man‚Äù to be used.

original: dper na dbul po la yang phyug po'i ming sgra brda'i dbang gis phyug por brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par yang 'jug pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi sgra 'di yang zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
analyzed: dper na dbul po la yang phyug po'i ming sgra brda'i dbang gis phyug por brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan med par yang 'jug pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi sgra 'di yang zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
translated: In that way, there is no error in the term ‚Äúsubtle particle‚Äù being used in this way.

original: re zhig de ltar spyir yan lag rnams kyis brtsams pa'am ma brtsams pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar spyir yan lag rnams kyis brtsams pa'am ma brtsams pa yang rung ste /
translated: In that case, in general, whether the parts are created or not created,

original: rags pa'i rdzas gcig mi mthang do zhes bsgrubs nas da ni gang gis yan lag dag gis brtsam par 'dod pa de'i khyad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rags pa'i rdzas gcig mi mthang do zhes bsgrubs nas da ni gang gis yan lag dag gis brtsam par 'dod pa de'i khyad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: having established that a single coarse substance is not seen, now, in order to repudiate the specific assertions of those who assert that the parts are created,

original: snal ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snal ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthe cloth‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang du ma yin pa de ni rdzas gcig gis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang du ma yin pa de ni rdzas gcig gis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is this: That which is not a composite is not pervaded by a single substance.

original: dper na rtsig pa la sogs pa mang po rnams rdzas gcig gis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa la sogs pa mang po rnams rdzas gcig gis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, many things such as walls are not pervaded by a single substance.üîΩAnd this cloth, hand, etc. is also multiple.

original: snal ma dang lag pa la sogs pa 'di yang du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snal ma dang lag pa la sogs pa 'di yang du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: yang na gang gcig yin pa de ni rdzas du ma la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang gcig yin pa de ni rdzas du ma la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, that which is one is not based on many substances,

original: rdul phra rab gcig bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig bzhin no //
translated: like a single atom.üîΩAnd the substance that is the basis of the name is also one.

original: yan lag can gyi ming can gyi rdzas @267b kyang gcig yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ming can gyi rdzas @267b kyang gcig yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the proof of the reductio.

original: sbyor ba gnyis ka la yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis ka la yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the valid cognition that contradicts the reversed proposition in both syllogisms is:

original: 'jug par ni mi rigs gnod pa'i tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug par ni mi rigs gnod pa'i tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable to engage in contradiction.

original: yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug pa gang yin pa de mi rung bar tshad ma dag gis bsgrubs pa de ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug pa gang yin pa de mi rung bar tshad ma dag gis bsgrubs pa de ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The argument that the presence of a whole in its parts is untenable is established by the valid cognitions. That is the valid cognition that refutes the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: yang ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is it untenable?

original: de gcig la 'jug rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrdzas gcig po de yan lag gcig gis bzung ba de'i gang yin de nyid kyi yan lag las yan lag gzhan dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de gcig la 'jug rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rdzas gcig po de yan lag gcig gis bzung ba de'i gang yin de nyid kyi yan lag las yan lag gzhan dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúIf it is the same, it would not enter the other parts.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: There are two possibilities: The one substance that is apprehended by one part is the very same that enters the other parts, or it is different.

original: dngos po la ni de nyid dang gzhan dag las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ni de nyid dang gzhan dag las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But apart from being the same or different, there is no other way that a thing can exist.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, the first possibility is not tenable.

original: rdzas de ni yan lag gcig gis bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas de ni yan lag gcig gis bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because that substance is apprehended by one part,

original: rdzas 'di nyid kyi tshe yan lag gzhan la 'jug pa'i go skabs yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzas 'di nyid kyi tshe yan lag gzhan la 'jug pa'i go skabs yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: how could it be possible for that very substance to enter the other parts?

original: gzhan du na gal te gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dir mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas nyid du bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dir mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas nyid du bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if it engaged with something else, then at that time it would not engage with the substance that is desired here with its entire nature.

original: gang gis gzhan la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba de la rang bzhin gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba de la rang bzhin gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it has a different nature from that with which it engages with something else.

original: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would lose its oneness.

original: tshad ma dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to set forth a valid cognition,

original: dper na bu chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na bu chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, for example, a young child, and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dngos po gcig gis bzung ba'i dngos po de ni de nyid kyi tshe gzhan du 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dngos po gcig gis bzung ba'i dngos po de ni de nyid kyi tshe gzhan du 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: That thing that is apprehended by one thing is not engaged with something else at that time.

original: dper na ma ma gcig gis bang du blongs pa'i bu chung ma ma gzhan gyis pang du blangs pa mi bsten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma ma gcig gis bang du blongs pa'i bu chung ma ma gzhan gyis pang du blangs pa mi bsten pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a young child held in the lap of one nursemaid is not held in the lap of another nursemaid.

original: rdzas kyang yan lag gcig gis yongs su bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyang yan lag gcig gis yongs su bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is: Substance is also apprehended by one part.

original: rdzas ni gzhan la rten ma yin //
analyzed: rdzas ni gzhan la rten ma yin //
translated: Substance does not depend on another.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston pa'o //
translated: This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di bshad pa de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di bshad pa de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the probandum is explained.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdzas de min yul du ste yan lag can la gal te 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdzas de min yul du ste yan lag can la gal te 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If that substance which is the nature related to the desired part were to enter the object, that is, the whole,

original: de'i tshe yan lag de dag yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur @268a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag de dag yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur @268a * //
translated: then at that time those parts would have the same object.

original: ro ; / de lta yin dang gcig bdag nyid de yan lag rnams rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro ; / de lta yin dang gcig bdag nyid de yan lag rnams rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, they would have the same nature, that is, the parts would have the same nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbyer med phyir te /
analyzed: dbyer med phyir te /
translated: Because they are inseparable.

original: rnam par ma phye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abide with an undifferentiated nature.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par phye ba'i do bor gnas pa na yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par phye ba'i do bor gnas pa na yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, abiding with a differentiated nature, they would not have the same object.

original: ci ste rang bzhin gzhan gyis zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin gzhan gyis zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis pa yin na /
translated: But if the second alternative is maintained, that it is by way of a different intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe gcig du ma la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig du ma la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not established that it abides in the one and the many,

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be engaged in a different intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because different things have the nature of different intrinsic realities.

original: gsal byed pa na re yan lag rnams yan lag can 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni rten dang brten pa'i chos bstan pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: gsal byed pa na re yan lag rnams yan lag can 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni rten dang brten pa'i chos bstan pa tsam yin te /
translated: The Illuminator school says that the parts are engaged in the whole, and this is merely an indication of the relation of support and supported.

original: khyab par 'jug pa ni brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'du ba'i ngo bo la brjod do zhes zer bde la /
analyzed: khyab par 'jug pa ni brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'du ba'i ngo bo la brjod do zhes zer bde la /
translated: They say that the characteristic of the supported thing is the essence of the collection, which is the engagement of the whole.üîΩTo this it is said:üîΩIf the whole is different from the parts,

original: de de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the whole would not be in the parts.

original: de la yang ste rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jug pa la ci yan lag gcig la 'du ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis yan lag gzhan dag la 'jug gam 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba de ma thag tu bstan pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'di blo
analyzed: de la yang ste rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jug pa la ci yan lag gcig la 'du ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis yan lag gzhan dag la 'jug gam 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes bya ba de ma thag tu bstan pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'di blo
translated: In that regard, does the very same nature of the assembly of the parts in one part also engage the other parts, or does it do so by means of another?

original: gros ngan pas bkod pa'i skyon gyi dra ba 'di mi bzod pa na khros pa bzhin du snyeg go //
analyzed: gros ngan pas bkod pa'i skyon gyi dra ba 'di mi bzod pa na khros pa bzhin du snyeg go //
translated: This analysis that was just presented is the very thing that the one with poor intelligence cannot bear, like one who is angry.

original: de ltar re zhig ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi rnam par rtog pa byas nas 'jug pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi rnam par rtog pa byas nas 'jug pa bsal nas /
translated: Thus, first, having analyzed the conceptions of the whole and the part, engagement is refuted.

original: da ni nye bar btags pa sgrub pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar btags pa sgrub pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute engagement by way of the proof of the designation,

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúOr, sometimes the whole . . .‚Äù and so on.üîΩSometimes the whole would be in each part by means of its whole nature,

original: res 'ga' rdzas de yan lag re re la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sam /
analyzed: res 'ga' rdzas de yan lag re re la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sam /
translated: Sometimes the substance is in each part with its whole nature.üîΩ

original: phyogs gcig gis 'jug par 'gyur grang gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis na de'i tshe yan lag rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi de'i bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis 'jug par 'gyur grang gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis na de'i tshe yan lag rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi de'i bdag nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is by its whole self, then it would be as many as there are parts.

original: yan lag re re la de'i rang bzhin tha dad pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag re re la de'i rang bzhin tha dad pa na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is by a part of itself, then it would not be by its whole self.

original: yod ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is impossible for it to engage by a nonexistent self.

original: de lta bas na bdag nyid thams cad kyis cig car 'jug pa'i phyir 'khar gzhong la sogs pa du ma na gnas pa'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du yan lag can rnams du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag nyid thams cad kyis cig car 'jug pa'i phyir 'khar gzhong la sogs pa du ma na gnas pa'i autpala la sogs pa bzhin du yan lag can rnams du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it engages all at once by its whole self, the wholes would be as many as there are parts, like the many lotuses and so on that are placed in a basin.

original: yang phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe phyogs gcig pa rnams thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe phyogs gcig pa rnams thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is by a part of itself, then the parts would be endless.

original: 'di ltar rdzas de phyogs gcig @268b po gang dag gis yan lag rnams la 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas de phyogs gcig @268b po gang dag gis yan lag rnams la 'jug la /
translated: In that case, by what parts of itself does the substance engage the parts?

original: de dag kyang de'i phyogs gcig la zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i phyogs gcig la zhes bya la /
translated: And they are one part of it.

original: de dag la yang 'dis 'jug par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de dag la yang 'dis 'jug par bya dgos la /
translated: And it is necessary to engage in them.

original: de kho na bzhin du gzhan dag la yang yin pa'i phyir mtha' med do //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gzhan dag la yang yin pa'i phyir mtha' med do //
translated: And it is the same for the others, so there is no end.

original: yang ci ste 'di phyogs gcig po gang dag gis yan lag rnams la 'jug pa de dag de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin /üîΩdon gzhan du gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yang ci ste 'di phyogs gcig po gang dag gis yan lag rnams la 'jug pa de dag de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin / don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúBy what parts does it engage in the parts, and are they just its own nature, not a different object?

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i phyogs gcig po gzhan med pas des na mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i phyogs gcig po gzhan med pas des na mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: And since there is no other part apart from that, it does not end up in an infinite regress?‚Äù

original: de gcig min pa'am zhes smos te /
analyzed: de gcig min pa'am zhes smos te /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúIt is not one.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na yan lag can gcig ces bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yan lag can gcig ces bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would not be called ‚Äúone whole,‚Äù

original: de'i yan lag 'dus pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag 'dus pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mere collection of its parts.

original: de lta yin dang 'di ma mthong ba'i lag pa la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dus ba tsam gyi bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di ma mthong ba'i lag pa la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dus ba tsam gyi bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
translated: If that were the case, it would be the mere collection of the unseen parts, such as the hands, and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i yan lag can gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i yan lag can gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What use is there in postulating another part-possessor that is of the same nature as the parts?

original: skyon gzhan yang bshad pa /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang bshad pa /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: gang du'ang min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is not in any of the parts.

original: 'jug par gyur pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'jug par gyur pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is ‚ÄúIt does not enter into the parts.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: gal te yan lag can re re phyogs gcig tu gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can re re phyogs gcig tu gyur na /
translated: If each part-possessor were one part,

original: de'i tshe yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the part-possessor would enter into the parts.

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can re re phyogs gcig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can re re phyogs gcig pa ma yin na /
translated: But because each part-possessor is not one part,

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it follows that the one part-possessor would be destroyed.

original: yan lag can gzhan gyi ngo bos kyang yod pa ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di yan lag rnams la 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag can gzhan gyi ngo bos kyang yod pa ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di yan lag rnams la 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Since it does not exist by the nature of another part-possessor, how could it enter into the parts?

original: 'on te rang rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag po'i dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te rang rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag po'i dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: Or else, in order to anticipate the qualm of the opponent, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is a continuum,‚Äù and so on.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: rang rgyud dam thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de rang nyid dmigs pa yin na 'thad par 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin na ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rgyud dam thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de rang nyid dmigs pa yin na 'thad par 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin na ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reason is established by itself or by reductio, then it is tenable if it is observed, but if it is not, then the fault of nonestablishment arises.

original: khyed cag gis ni gcig du ma la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig dag gis 'jug pa gang du yang mi dmigs te ;üîΩgang gi 'jug ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas med par 'gyur ba'am yod pa yin na gzhan du'ang ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gis ni gcig du ma la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig dag gis 'jug pa gang du yang mi dmigs te ; gang gi 'jug ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas med par 'gyur ba'am yod pa yin na gzhan du'ang ste /
translated: But you do not observe the whole in either way, that is, as either identical with or different from the parts.

original: yan lag gam yan lag can du yang 'gyur ro //üîΩkha cig tu gang gi yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: yan lag gam yan lag can du yang 'gyur ro // kha cig tu gang gi yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: If the whole does not exist, then the substance that is the possessor of parts would not exist. But if it does exist, then it would be different, that is, it would be the part or the possessor of parts.üîΩIn some editions, the line reads, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist in any way.‚Äù

original: ci rigs par gang gi @269a * //üîΩ'jug pa yod pa dang gang gi 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pa na rdzas med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ci rigs par gang gi @269a * // 'jug pa yod pa dang gang gi 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pa na rdzas med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In that case, the passage should be construed as follows:üîΩIf the whole does not exist, then the substance that is the possessor of parts would not exist.

original: de gzhan du'ang ste yan lag gam yan lag can du 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: de gzhan du'ang ste yan lag gam yan lag can du 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: But if it does exist, then it would be different, that is, it would be the part or the possessor of parts.

original: ci ste la lar rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jug ba dmigs par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste la lar rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jug ba dmigs par gyur na /
translated: If you do perceive the engagement of the parts in that way,

original: de'i tshe de bzhin du de'i rdzas la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dgag tu med do //üîΩ'on te yang 'jug pa ma mthong na de'i tshe ci phyogs gcig gis sam /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin du de'i rdzas la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dgag tu med do // 'on te yang 'jug pa ma mthong na de'i tshe ci phyogs gcig gis sam /
translated: then at that time, it is the same for the substance, etc. of the whole, and so it cannot be refuted.

original: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba de lta bu phye ste dri bar mi rigs so //üîΩchos can grub na khyad par 'gag par rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba de lta bu phye ste dri bar mi rigs so // chos can grub na khyad par 'gag par rigs kyi /
translated: But if you do not see the engagement of the parts, then it is not right to ask, ‚ÄúIs it by one part or by the whole?‚ÄùüîΩIt is right to refute the distinction only when the existence of the whole is established.

original: gang gi tshe chos can nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe de nyid dgag pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe de nyid dgag pa bzang ngo //
translated: But when the existence of the whole is not established, it is better to refute the whole itself.

original: des na 'jug pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: des na 'jug pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, you should say only that ‚Äúthe engagement does not exist,‚Äù

original: khyad par dgag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dgag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that ‚Äúthe distinction is refuted.‚Äù

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not right,

original: mngon sum kho nas yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas yan lag rnams la yan lag can 'jug par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the engagement of the whole in the parts is established by perception itself.

original: mngon sum ci 'dra ba las zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ci 'dra ba las zhe na /
translated: What is perception like?

original: 'di la 'di zhes pa'i mngon sum blo yis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la 'di zhes pa'i mngon sum blo yis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, he says, by the cognition that this is that.

original: snal ma 'di la sogs pa 'di zhes bya ba'i de lta bur gyur pa'i mngon sum las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snal ma 'di la sogs pa 'di zhes bya ba'i de lta bur gyur pa'i mngon sum las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the direct perception of that which is like this, that is, 'this is cotton,' and so on.

original: yang ci ste blo 'di mngon sum nyid du ma grub bo snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste blo 'di mngon sum nyid du ma grub bo snyam na /
translated: But if you think, This cognition is not established as direct perception,

original: gal te de lta na gang las mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur pa 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zhig brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na gang las mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur pa 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zhig brjod dgos so //
translated: then you must state some valid cognition that contradicts the idea that it is not direct perception.

original: ci ste gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par yang mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par yang mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if it is not direct perception even though there is no valid cognition that contradicts it,

original: 'o na de lta na khyed cag gi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na khyed cag gi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, in the same way, your cognition of form and so on would not be direct perception, because there is no difference.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies to this with If you think that... and so on.

original: de gcig la 'jug rten zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir gcig du ma la 'jug pa sngar bsal zin te //
analyzed: de gcig la 'jug rten zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir gcig du ma la 'jug pa sngar bsal zin te //
translated: He has already refuted the general idea that one applies to the many with If one is the basis of many... and so on.

original: gang yang 'di la 'di'o snyam pa'i blo'i mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa grub bo zhes 'di brjod pa de yang 'jig rten dang mi mthun te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di la 'di'o snyam pa'i blo'i mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa grub bo zhes 'di brjod pa de yang 'jig rten dang mi mthun te /
translated: But this is not the case, for the world does not agree with you.

original: 'jig rten na rva can 'di la ba lang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo yang ji ltar 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rva can 'di la ba lang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo yang ji ltar 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The world does not think in terms of the conceptual thought, ‚ÄúThis is the horn of this animal,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is the thread of this cloth.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na //
translated: What then?

original: ba lang 'di la rva snam bu 'di la snal ma rnams snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang 'di la rva snam bu 'di la snal ma rnams snyam pa yin no //
translated: The world thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the horn of this animal,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is the thread of this cloth.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi blo la snal ma la sogs pa 'du ba de las tha dad pa'i gos la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba yang ma yin la /üîΩrnam par @269b phye nas mi snang ba ni 'di 'di las 'jug go zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo la snal ma la sogs pa 'du ba de las tha dad pa'i gos la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba yang ma yin la / rnam par @269b phye nas mi snang ba ni 'di 'di las 'jug go zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The nature of cloth, etc., which is different from the collection of threads, etc., does not appear to the cognition that perceives the threads, etc.üîΩNor is there a cognition that perceives the cloth, etc., without perceiving the threads, etc.

original: khar gzhong la sogs pa la chu phye nas mi snang ba na 'di na chu 'o zhes shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khar gzhong la sogs pa la chu phye nas mi snang ba na 'di na chu 'o zhes shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: When water is poured into a basin, etc., and the water is not visible because it is mixed with the basin, etc., one does not know that ‚ÄúThis is water.‚Äù

original: gang yang ma lus pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang ma lus pa'am /
translated: Or is it that it is engaged in some part of it?

original: phyogs gcig gis 'jug pa gang du'ang ma dmigs nyid ces smras pa de la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis 'jug pa gang du'ang ma dmigs nyid ces smras pa de la /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: ma lus phyogs gcig sgra dag gis //
analyzed: ma lus phyogs gcig sgra dag gis //
translated: By the words ‚Äúall‚Äù and ‚Äúpart,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said that

original: ma lus pa'i sgras dper na snod 'ga' zhig tu bzhag pa'i dpal gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i sgras dper na snod 'ga' zhig tu bzhag pa'i dpal gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin du /
translated: By the word ‚Äúall,‚Äù it is said that, for example, just as the parts of a harvest of barley and so on that are placed in some container are observed,

original: ci rang gi ngo bo cha shas med pa ci 'dra ba de lta bu kho na'i cha shas med pa'i yan lag thams cad nyid kyis de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rang gi ngo bo cha shas med pa ci 'dra ba de lta bu kho na'i cha shas med pa'i yan lag thams cad nyid kyis de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin nam /
translated: in the same way, is it the case that it is taught that the meaning of ‚Äúengaged‚Äù is that it engages all parts that are partless in just the way that it is, that is, in the way that it is without parts?üîΩOr is it the case that by the word ‚Äúpart,‚Äù it is taught that, for example, just as the parts of a cow lying down on a bed are observed, it is engaged in some part?

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gi sgras dper na gnas mal du man nyal ba'i nag pa la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin zhes bya ba yin pas 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gi sgras dper na gnas mal du man nyal ba'i nag pa la sogs pa dmigs pa bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin zhes bya ba yin pas 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: This is not tenable in any way.

original: gang yang gsal byed pa na re yan lag can gcig la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi sgra 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ci phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
analyzed: gang yang gsal byed pa na re yan lag can gcig la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi sgra 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ci phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
translated: The Clarifiers say: It is impossible for the words ‚Äúpart‚Äù and ‚Äúwhole‚Äù to apply to one thing without remainder and to one part, respectively.

original: 'on te ma lus pas 'jug ces bya ba'i dri ba 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma lus pas 'jug ces bya ba'i dri ba 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this question is not reasonable: ‚ÄúDo they apply to one part or to the whole?‚Äù

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' dag rjod par byed la /
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' dag rjod par byed la /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout remainder‚Äù means ‚Äúin its entirety,‚Äù and ‚Äúone part‚Äù means ‚Äúsome part.‚Äù

original: phyogs gcig ces bya ba yang du ma nyid yin na yang 'ga' zhig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ces bya ba yang du ma nyid yin na yang 'ga' zhig brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even though ‚Äúsome part‚Äù is a plurality, it is still ‚Äúsome part.‚Äù

original: ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi sgra de dag yan lag can gcig la mi 'thad do zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig gi sgra de dag yan lag can gcig la mi 'thad do zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This refutes the assertion that the words ‚Äúwithout remainder‚Äù and ‚Äúone part‚Äù are not tenable for one whole.

original: de skad du 'jig rten na snam bu 'di ma lus pa'am /
analyzed: de skad du 'jig rten na snam bu 'di ma lus pa'am /
translated: In the world, one says, ‚ÄúThis cloth is placed on a tray without remainder or with one part remaining.‚Äù

original: phyogs gcig gis gzhong pa na gnas so zhes bya bar snam bu la sogs pa la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig pa'i sgra 'jug pa mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis gzhong pa na gnas so zhes bya bar snam bu la sogs pa la ma lus pa dang phyogs gcig pa'i sgra 'jug pa mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: One sees that the words ‚Äúwithout remainder‚Äù and ‚Äúone part‚Äù are used for cloth, etc.

original: 'di nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that this is a mere designation.

original: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Because it engages without error. This has already been explained above.

original: de ltar rlung gi mthar thug pa'i rdzas rnam pa bzhi po bsal te ;
analyzed: de ltar rlung gi mthar thug pa'i rdzas rnam pa bzhi po bsal te ;
translated: Thus, having refuted the four types of substances that end with wind,

original: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag rtag par dang po nyid du bsal nas /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag rtag par dang po nyid du bsal nas /
translated: the self is refuted first as permanent.

original: da ni nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang yid rnams dgag pa'i phyir /üîΩ'jig pa la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: da ni nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang yid rnams dgag pa'i phyir / 'jig pa la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: Now, in order to refute space, time, direction, and mind,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúThrough the reason of destruction, etc.,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de la re zhig gzhan dag gis nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas sgrub @270a * //üîΩpar byed de /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzhan dag gis nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas sgrub @270a * // par byed de /
translated: Regarding that, first others establish a substance called space.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtag pa gcig bu sgra'i rtags can yod do //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtag pa gcig bu sgra'i rtags can yod do //
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThere is a permanent, single substance called space, which has the sign of sound.

original: 'di'i rtags ni sgra yin te yon tan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rtags ni sgra yin te yon tan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its sign is sound because it is a quality.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'jig pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'jig pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
translated: The argument is this: those things that have origination and destruction, etc., must be supported by something else,

original: bum pa dang mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like such things as a pot, a lamp, etc.

original: sgra 'di dag kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: sgra 'di dag kyang de bzhin te /
translated: And sound is like that.

original: de lta bas na 'di dag gis 'ga' zhig la brten par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag gis 'ga' zhig la brten par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be admitted that it is supported by something else.

original: gang 'di dag gi rten de ni shugs kyis nam mkha' ste nam mkhar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di dag gi rten de ni shugs kyis nam mkha' ste nam mkhar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that which is its support is by implication space, i.e., ƒÅkƒÅ≈õa.

original: de ltar sgra 'di ni sa la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi yon tan du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sgra 'di ni sa la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi yon tan du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, sound is not logically a quality of the four, earth, etc.,

original: mngon sum nyid yin pa na yon tan gyi rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rdzas ji srid du 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rten las gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin pa na yon tan gyi rgyu sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rdzas ji srid du 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rten las gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not preceded by a cause of a quality, because it does not arise as long as there is a substance, and because it is perceived as different from its support.

original: reg pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i chos las bzlog pa yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: reg pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i chos las bzlog pa yin par mthong ngo //
translated: The qualities of contact are seen to be the opposite of the qualities just explained.

original: mngon sum nyid yin pa na zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni rim par 'byung ba'i rdul phra rab tu gtogs pas ma nges pa nyid bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin pa na zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni rim par 'byung ba'i rdul phra rab tu gtogs pas ma nges pa nyid bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The specification ‚Äúwhen they are manifest‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the uncertainty that arises from the fact that they are included among the momentary atoms.

original: phyi'i dbang po'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi'i dbang po'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are not qualities of the self because they are the direct perception of the external sense organ and because they are apprehended by others as well as by oneself.

original: nga rgyal gyis rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa'i phyir bdag gi yon tan ma yin te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa'i phyir bdag gi yon tan ma yin te /
translated: They are not qualities of the self because they are apprehended by the self that is distinguished by pride.

original: bdag gi yon tan bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni de las bzlog par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni de las bzlog par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities of the self, such as pleasure, are seen to be the opposite of that.

original: rna bas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs dang dus dang yid kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: rna bas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs dang dus dang yid kyi ma yin no //
translated: They are not qualities of space because they are apprehended by the ear and not by space, time, or mind.

original: des na lhag par gyur pas yon tan du gyur pa'i nam mkha'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: des na lhag par gyur pas yon tan du gyur pa'i nam mkha'i rtags yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are qualities of the self that is distinguished by pride.

original: nam mkha' de yang sgra'i rtags can du khyad par gyi rtags med pa'i phyir gcig yin na /
analyzed: nam mkha' de yang sgra'i rtags can du khyad par gyi rtags med pa'i phyir gcig yin na /
translated: And that space is one, because it is not qualified by the sign of sound.

original: yon tan thams cad du dmigs pa'i phyir khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad du dmigs pa'i phyir khyab pa yin no //
translated: If it is one, it is all-pervading, because it is perceived everywhere.

original: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dang brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas so //
analyzed: yon tan can yin pa'i phyir dang brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas so //
translated: It is substance, because it possesses qualities and is not dependent on another.

original: ma byas ba'i phyir rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan dag gi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: ma byas ba'i phyir rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan dag gi tha snyad yin no //
