translated: It is permanent, because it is not produced. This is the conventional usage of others.

original: sngon dang phyis sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sngon dang phyis sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa ste /
translated: In order to refute time, he says, ‚Äúprior, posterior, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdzas kyi sgras gnyer ma dang skra dkar la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgras gnyer ma dang skra dkar la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù should be understood to include wrinkles, gray hair, and so on.

original: sngon ni pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ni pa'o //
translated: The prior is the father.

original: phyi ma ni bu'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bu'o //
translated: The posterior is the son.

original: cig car dang / yun ring mo dang myur du dang byed ba dang / byas pa dang / @270b byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di sngon dang phyis la sogs pa'i shes pa de ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: cig car dang / yun ring mo dang myur du dang byed ba dang / byas pa dang / @270b byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di sngon dang phyis la sogs pa'i shes pa de ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: The cognition of prior, posterior, etc., is the cognition of simultaneous, long-lasting, quick, doing, done, and will do, which is the activity of the sun, etc.

original: rdzas las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: rdzas las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: It is a reason that is different from substance,

original: gnyer ma dang sgra dkar la sogs pa'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyer ma dang sgra dkar la sogs pa'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is not like the cognition of wrinkles, white hair, and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of a pot and so on.

original: 'di'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang shugs kyis dus yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang shugs kyis dus yin no //
translated: And the cause of that is time, which is understood by implication.

original: 'di ltar re zhig sngon dang phyi ma'i shes pa 'di yul gyis byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig sngon dang phyi ma'i shes pa 'di yul gyis byas pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, first, the cognition of prior and later is not produced by the object,

original: phyi ma'i phyogs cha na gnas pa'i rgan po la sngon zhes shes pa skye ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du snga ma'i phyogs cha na gnas pa'i gzhon nu ma yang phyi ma zhes bya ba yin bas so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i phyogs cha na gnas pa'i rgan po la sngon zhes shes pa skye ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du snga ma'i phyogs cha na gnas pa'i gzhon nu ma yang phyi ma zhes bya ba yin bas so //
translated: because the cognition of prior arises in the old man who is situated in the later part, and likewise, the young woman who is situated in the earlier part is called later.

original: skra dkar dang gnyer ma la sogs pas byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skra dkar dang gnyer ma la sogs pas byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not produced by white hair, wrinkles, and so on,

original: de'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the cognition of that.

original: bya ba byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not produced by the action,

original: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is dissimilar to the cognition of that.

original: de skad du yang mdo las 'phyi ba dang / snga ba dang cig car ba dang cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang / myur du zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rtags dag yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las 'phyi ba dang / snga ba dang cig car ba dang cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang / myur du zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rtags dag yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe signs of time are: later, earlier, simultaneous, not simultaneous, long, and quick.‚Äù

original: 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid dang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni nam mkha' bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid dang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni nam mkha' bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The qualities of this, such as impermanence, oneness, and so on, are to be understood like space.üîΩIn order to establish the directions, he says:

original: phyogs bsgrub pa'i don du shar dang nub la sogs blo rnams las zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩlus can gyi rdzas kyi dbang du byas nas lus can gyi rdzas dag kho na la de las 'di ni shar ro //
analyzed: phyogs bsgrub pa'i don du shar dang nub la sogs blo rnams las zhes bya ba smos te / lus can gyi rdzas kyi dbang du byas nas lus can gyi rdzas dag kho na la de las 'di ni shar ro //
translated: The cognitions of east, west, etc.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / byang shar dang / 'og dang steng la sogs pa zhes bya ba shes pa bcu po 'di dag las byung ba de ni phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / byang shar dang / 'og dang steng la sogs pa zhes bya ba shes pa bcu po 'di dag las byung ba de ni phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: From among the ten cognitions of embodied beings, the cognitions of embodied beings, taking material substances as their objects, are the cognitions of east, west, south, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above.

original: de skad du yang mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las /
translated: The S≈´tra says:

original: 'di'o snyam pa gang las yin pa de ni phyogs kyi rtags yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di'o snyam pa gang las yin pa de ni phyogs kyi rtags yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The reason is the cause from which the cognition ‚Äúthis is it‚Äù arises.

original: gang las 'di'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gang las 'di'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi shes pa yin la /
translated: The cognition ‚Äúthis is it‚Äù is the cognition of the specific property.

original: khyad par gyi shes pa yang glo bur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi shes pa yang glo bur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that the cognition of the specific property should be adventitious.

original: phan tshun du lus can gyi rdzas la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du lus can gyi rdzas la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they depend on the substance of the body, because they are mutually dependent.

original: phan tshun bsten pa nyid kyis gnyi ga med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa nyid kyis gnyi ga med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were mutually dependent, it would follow that neither would exist.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir rtags 'di dag ni phyogs kyi yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir rtags 'di dag ni phyogs kyi yin no //
translated: Since there is no other reason for these signs, they are the reason.

original: phyogs de'i yang gcig pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni dus gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs de'i yang gcig pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni dus gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: The qualities of that reason, such as being one, permanent, and pervasive, will be understood later.

original: phyogs gcig yin na yang 'bras bu'i khyad par las @271a * //
analyzed: phyogs gcig yin na yang 'bras bu'i khyad par las @271a * //
translated: Even if it is one part, the variety is due to the difference in the effect.

original: shar la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sna tshogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sna tshogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Due to the difference in the east, etc., there is variety.

original: sbyor ba ni gang 'di shar dang nub la sogs pa'i shes pa de ni lus can gyi rdzas las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang 'di shar dang nub la sogs pa'i shes pa de ni lus can gyi rdzas las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The argument is this: The cognition of east and west, etc., has as its causal ground a real entity that is different from the substance of the body,

original: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir bde pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir bde pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is unlike the cognition of that, like the cognition of pleasure, etc.

original: yid kyi rtags bshad ba /
analyzed: yid kyi rtags bshad ba /
translated: The explanation of the mark of mind.

original: shes pa rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe cognition arises in sequence,‚Äù etc.

original: dbang po dang don du ma phrad pa cig car nye bar yod na yang shes pa rim gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang don du ma phrad pa cig car nye bar yod na yang shes pa rim gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when there is simultaneous proximity of the sense faculty and the object, the cognition is seen to arise in sequence.

original: gang zhig nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa skye ba dang / mi skye bar 'gyur ba dbang po dang don las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa skye ba dang / mi skye bar 'gyur ba dbang po dang don las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa yin no //
translated: There is a cause other than the sense faculty and the object, from which the cognition arises and does not arise, depending on proximity and remoteness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa rim gyis skye ba na ste shes pa 'byung bas yid rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa rim gyis skye ba na ste shes pa 'byung bas yid rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, when the cognition arises in sequence, i.e., when the cognition occurs, one infers the mind.

original: de skad du yang mdo las shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The non-simultaneous arising of consciousness is the mark of the mental faculty.üîΩThe syllogism is:

original: sbyor ba ni gang 'di gzugs la sogs ba rtogs ba de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang 'di gzugs la sogs ba rtogs ba de ni /
translated: The realization of form and so on

original: mig la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu la ltos pa yin te /
translated: depends on causes other than the eye faculty and so on,

original: rim gyis skye ba'i phyir /üîΩshing rta la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba'i phyir / shing rta la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because they arise sequentially,üîΩlike a chariot and so on.

original: zin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: zin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe elements that are grasped . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te spyir sgra 'di dag brten pa yin pa tsam zhig sgrub na de'i tshe gtan tshigs grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyir sgra 'di dag brten pa yin pa tsam zhig sgrub na de'i tshe gtan tshigs grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If the general point being established is simply that these sounds are dependent, then the reason is unestablished.

original: 'di ltar sgra rnams ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rnams ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: This is because sounds are held to be caused by the elements that are grasped and not grasped.

original: de dag kyang 'byung ba rnams la de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis brten pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'byung ba rnams la de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis brten pa kho na yin te /
translated: And those elements are dependent on the elements that are their effects.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni zin pa la sogs sogs de dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid thob pas 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu rnams la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni zin pa la sogs sogs de dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid thob pas 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu rnams la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the appropriated, etc. The effects are dependent on the causes, because they obtain the nature of being related to them.

original: zin ba ni sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyis bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: zin ba ni sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyis bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: The appropriated are those that are appropriated by the mind and mental factors.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can nyid bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can nyid bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes those that are not appropriated, but have the great elements as their cause.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni zin pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni zin pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the great elements that are appropriated, etc.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsnga ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // snga ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: sgra rnams 'ga' zhig la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma yin no /
analyzed: sgra rnams 'ga' zhig la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúThe former‚Äù refers to the statement, ‚ÄúSome sounds are dependent, etc.‚Äù That is not a proof, because it is a fault of proving what is already established.

original: snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the idea.

original: ci ste lus can ma yin pa rtag pa gcig pu khyab pa'i rdzas dang 'du ba nyid kyis 'di dag khyad par can la brten par sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste lus can ma yin pa rtag pa gcig pu khyab pa'i rdzas dang 'du ba nyid kyis 'di dag khyad par can la brten par sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that they are established as being dependent on a special substance, which is permanent, unitary, and pervasive, but not corporeal,

original: de'i tshe bsgrub bya @271b rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub bya @271b rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: then the reason is unestablished, because there is no example that is similar to the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs gis ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston pa ni nam mkha' gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gis ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston pa ni nam mkha' gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúspace is one‚Äù and so on shows that.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'grub min zhes bya ba snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'grub min zhes bya ba snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthese‚Äù is connected with the previous phrase ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni /üîΩde bzhin rim min sogs thob 'gyur //
analyzed: dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni / de bzhin rim min sogs thob 'gyur //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe thesis is contradicted by inference‚Äù shows that.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way, there would be no order, and so on‚Äù shows that.

original: 'di dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i nam mkha' dang 'du ba mi 'grub bo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i nam mkha' dang 'du ba mi 'grub bo zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthese‚Äù is connected with the previous phrase ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di dag rtag pa dang gcig bu'i nam mkha'i rdzas dang 'du bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rtag pa dang gcig bu'i nam mkha'i rdzas dang 'du bar gyur na /
translated: If these were to be established as being substances that are permanent and unitary and are conjoined with space,üîΩthen they would be like space.

original: de'i tshe cig car skyes pa'i sgra du ma bzhin du de ma yin pa'i 'dus pa'i sgra dag kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i dus kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe cig car skyes pa'i sgra du ma bzhin du de ma yin pa'i 'dus pa'i sgra dag kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i dus kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, like the many sounds that are produced simultaneously, the sounds that are not that would also occur only at the time that is desired,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir dang / rten gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir dang / rten gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is not incomplete and because they have the same support.

original: rtag pa 'di gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa 'di gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that this permanent thing does not depend on another.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang 'du ba nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang 'du ba nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that what does not assist would come together,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could come together with anything.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rim can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rim can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow, absurdly, that it would not occur in sequence.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu thams cad kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu thams cad kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that it would follow, absurdly, that all the faults of being apprehended by all persons and so on would also ensue.

original: 'di ltar rna ba ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rna ba ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: In this way the ear is of the nature of space.

original: nam mkha' yang gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang gcig nyid yin te /
translated: And space is one.

original: de lta yin dang der phyin pa'i sgra rnams thams cad kyis kyang thos par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni cha shas med pa nyid kyis 'di ni bdag gi rna ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang der phyin pa'i sgra rnams thams cad kyis kyang thos par 'gyur ro // de ni cha shas med pa nyid kyis 'di ni bdag gi rna ba'o //
translated: If that were so, then all sounds that reach there would be heard.üîΩBut that is not so, because it is partless.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi'o zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi'o zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is individually determined, ‚ÄúThis is my ear,‚Äù ‚ÄúThat is someone else‚Äôs ear.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gang gis ma mthong ba'i 'du byed kyis rna ba'i sbubs su der yongs su gcod pa'i nam mkha' ni rna ba nyid yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga'i nang du sgra dmigs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis ma mthong ba'i 'du byed kyis rna ba'i sbubs su der yongs su gcod pa'i nam mkha' ni rna ba nyid yin te / de nyid kyi phyir kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga'i nang du sgra dmigs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If you think that the space that is limited to the cavity of the ear is the ear itself, because it is not seen when the ear is seen,üîΩthen sound would be perceived inside the mouth, nose, and so on.

original: rna ba'i sbubs de nyid la gnod pas 'on pa la sogs par gzhag go zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: rna ba'i sbubs de nyid la gnod pas 'on pa la sogs par gzhag go zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you think that the ear is the cavity of the ear, and that the ear is damaged by something that causes deafness,

original: 'di yang mi rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: nam mkha' ni cha med pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i dbye ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni cha med pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i dbye ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Space is partless, so it is not reasonable to divide it in that way.

original: kun du brtags pa'i yan lag gi rnam par dbye ba rnams ni don dam par dngos po'i rnam par dbye ba sgrub par byed pa don byed pa sgro btags pa'i dbang gis bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i yan lag gi rnam par dbye ba rnams ni don dam par dngos po'i rnam par dbye ba sgrub par byed pa don byed pa sgro btags pa'i dbang gis bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The divisions of the imagined members are not established by the power of the superimposition of the establishment of the division of entities in the ultimate, because

original: chu la me zhes nye bar btags pa na 'bar ba'am sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩci ste nam mkha'i phyogs @272a * //
analyzed: chu la me zhes nye bar btags pa na 'bar ba'am sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no // ci ste nam mkha'i phyogs @272a * //
translated: when one superimposes ‚Äúfire‚Äù on water, it does not burn or heat.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: If one says that the phrase ‚Äúone part of space‚ÄùüîΩrefers to

original: ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug pa nyid brjod pa yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba 'di yang spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa ma khyab par 'jug pa nyid brjod pa yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba 'di yang spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: the nonpervasive, that is also rejected.

original: gzhan yang bum pa dang rna ba'i sbubs la sogs pa yang tha mi dad pa'i nam mkha' gcig dang 'brel pa nyid kyis yul mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa dang rna ba'i sbubs la sogs pa yang tha mi dad pa'i nam mkha' gcig dang 'brel pa nyid kyis yul mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, a pot, the cavity of the ear, and so on would be the same place because they are related to the one nondifferent space.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa kho nas gcig dang 'brel pa de kho nas gzhan la yang yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa kho nas gcig dang 'brel pa de kho nas gzhan la yang yin no //
translated: The one related to space by its nature is related to the other by that very nature.

original: de ltar na gzhan na yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang mngon sum 'dod pa'i yul du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan na yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang mngon sum 'dod pa'i yul du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, even a pot that exists elsewhere would be an object that appears to direct perception,

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it would be related to space, which is the nature of direct perception.

original: de'i yul na gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i yul na gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like a pot that exists in the field of that space.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra rnams kyang yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra rnams kyang yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, sounds would also be the same object.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po 'ga' zhig shin tu nye ba dang ring pa'i yul tha dad na gnas par shin tu grags ba gang yin pa de 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po 'ga' zhig shin tu nye ba dang ring pa'i yul tha dad na gnas par shin tu grags ba gang yin pa de 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the many faults such as this would ensue: It would contradict the well-known fact that some things exist in different places, some very close and some very far away.

original: de bzhin du dus dang phyogs sgrub par byed pa dag la yang spyir grub pa la sgrub la khyed par du gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba ma grub cing dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus dang phyogs sgrub par byed pa dag la yang spyir grub pa la sgrub la khyed par du gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba ma grub cing dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Likewise, in the case of the establishment of time and direction, in general, the proof is established, but in particular, the reason is not established as concomitant, and the thesis is also contradicted by inference.

original: khyad par can gyi brda 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi brda 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúThe arising of a sign of a particular‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: khyad bar can gyi brda ni mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa las skyes pa'i don rnams la mdun dang rgyab kyi brda'o //
analyzed: khyad bar can gyi brda ni mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa las skyes pa'i don rnams la mdun dang rgyab kyi brda'o //
translated: A sign of a particular is a sign of front, back, etc. with respect to things produced from front, back, etc.

original: de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: The mental activity that arises from that is effort.

original: de 'di la rgyu mtshan du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di la rgyu mtshan du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is the reason for this, and it is called that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of mutual dependence.

original: shes pa 'di ni khyad par can gyi dngos po'i brda'i rgyu mtshan yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni khyad par can gyi dngos po'i brda'i rgyu mtshan yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This cognition is the reason for the sign of a particular thing.

original: de'i phyir rgyu tsam sgrub na grub ba la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu tsam sgrub na grub ba la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the mere cause is being proven, it is a proof of what is already established.

original: khyad par grub na rjes dpag pas gnod pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang snga ma bzhin no zhes ston pa dang / gtan tshigs kyang 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par grub na rjes dpag pas gnod pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang snga ma bzhin no zhes ston pa dang / gtan tshigs kyang 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: And in order to show that the reason is contradictory because it proves the opposite of what is intended, he says:

original: cha med dngos gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha med dngos gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA partless thing is one.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dus dang phyogs dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dus dang phyogs dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to time and direction.

original: mdun rgyab la sogs pa'i shes pa dus dang phyogs zhes bya ba dngos po cha med pa gcig pa zhig rgyu mtshan can du 'dod /
analyzed: mdun rgyab la sogs pa'i shes pa dus dang phyogs zhes bya ba dngos po cha med pa gcig pa zhig rgyu mtshan can du 'dod /
translated: The cognition of front, back, etc. is called time and direction. It is asserted that a single partless thing is the cause.

original: de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de yang ma grub ste /
translated: But that is not established.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes bskyed par @272b byed pa'i yul yin te gang gis mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa'i shas pa des byas par 'gyur ba cha shes med pa la ni mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes bskyed par @272b byed pa'i yul yin te gang gis mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa'i shas pa des byas par 'gyur ba cha shes med pa la ni mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod
translated: Because it is an object that produces a cognition that conforms to its aspect. By what is it made? A partless thing does not have a division of front, back, etc.

original: pa yang yin no //
analyzed: pa yang yin no //
translated: And it does exist.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it proves the opposite of what is wanted, the reason is contradictory.

original: gal te 'brel ba can tha dad ces bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi len dogs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te 'brel ba can tha dad ces bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi len dogs par byed do //
translated: If you think that the reason is not contradictory because it is related to something else,

original: ci ste yang gang phyogs dang dus dang 'brel pa can gyi phyi dang nang gi dngos po me mar dang lus la sogs pa de dag la mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang gang phyogs dang dus dang 'brel pa can gyi phyi dang nang gi dngos po me mar dang lus la sogs pa de dag la mdun dang rgyab la sogs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: then if the internal and external things that are related to space and time, such as a lamp and a body, exist in the front and back,

original: des na dus dang phyogs de dag kyang 'brel pa can du gtogs pa'i mdun rgyab la sogs pa 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na dus dang phyogs de dag kyang 'brel pa can du gtogs pa'i mdun rgyab la sogs pa 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: then space and time are included among the things that are related, such as the front and back.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you think that the reason is not contradictory.

original: 'dir lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa /
translated: Here, the reply is:

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: In that case,

original: de dag don med ma yin nam //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag don med ma yin nam // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are they not meaningless?üîΩIf you imagine that,

original: de ltar rtog na dus dang phyogs de dag med par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na dus dang phyogs de dag med par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then space and time would not exist.

original: de'i bsgrub par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'brel pa can de nyid kyis bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar dus ni /
analyzed: de'i bsgrub par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'brel pa can de nyid kyis bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar dus ni /
translated: because the effect that is to be established, which is related to the time, is established by that very time.üîΩThus time is the cause of the arising of the cognition of

original: snga ma dang / phyi ma dang / skad cig dang / thad cig dang / mig btsums pa dang / mthar dang / cha dang / yud tsam dang / nyin zhag dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: snga ma dang / phyi ma dang / skad cig dang / thad cig dang / mig btsums pa dang / mthar dang / cha dang / yud tsam dang / nyin zhag dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: prior, subsequent, instant, simultaneous, blinking, end, part, moment, day, half-month, month, and so on.

original: phyogs kyang shar dang nub la sogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyur 'dod de /
analyzed: phyogs kyang shar dang nub la sogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyur 'dod de /
translated: And direction is asserted to be the cause of the positing of east, west, and so on.

original: tha dad pa 'di mtha' dag kyang de dag gi bdag nyid la yod pa tha dad pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa dag la yang yod par kun du rtog pa de ni don med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di mtha' dag kyang de dag gi bdag nyid la yod pa tha dad pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa dag la yang yod par kun du rtog pa de ni don med do //
translated: Since all of these differences exist in those that have difference in their nature, the conception that they exist in differences is pointless.

original: yid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang spyir rgyu tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: yid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang spyir rgyu tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The reason proving the mind is also a proof of what is already established if it merely proves a cause in general.

original: mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩkhyad par du rtag pa gcig bu'i yid sgrub par byed na rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod ba dang / gtan tshigs kyang 'gal ba yin no zhes ston ba ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // khyad par du rtag pa gcig bu'i yid sgrub par byed na rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod ba dang / gtan tshigs kyang 'gal ba yin no zhes ston ba ni /
translated: Other than the eye, etc.

original: yid ni rtag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid ni rtag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If one proves a permanent, unitary mind, then there is no pervasion, the thesis is undermined by inference, and the reason is contradictory. This is demonstrated by If the mind is permanent, etc.

original: 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase it would undermine what is accepted

original: mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that it would prove that the mind, which is different from the eye, etc., is dependent on impermanent causes.

original: de lta ma yin te rgyu rtags pa nyid yin na rgyu ma tshang med pa'i phyir shes pa rnams rim gyis skye ba 'gal bar @273a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rgyu rtags pa nyid yin na rgyu ma tshang med pa'i phyir shes pa rnams rim gyis skye ba 'gal bar @273a * //
translated: If it were not so, and the cause were permanent, then because there would be no incompleteness of causes, it would be contradictory for cognitions to arise in sequence.

original: 'gyur ro ; / gtan tshigs 'gal ba de nyid bzhad gad du byed pa sngon du 'gro bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ro ; / gtan tshigs 'gal ba de nyid bzhad gad du byed pa sngon du 'gro bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very contradictory reason, preceded by laughter, he says:

original: bde gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe Sugata and the tirthikas assert that the mind is established or not established.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde bar gshegs pa dang / mu stegs byed dag 'dod pa'i yid grub pa dang ma grub par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩshes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di byas ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde bar gshegs pa dang / mu stegs byed dag 'dod pa'i yid grub pa dang ma grub par bya ba'i phyir / shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di byas ba yin te /
translated: The sutra was composed in order to refute the assertion of the Sugata and the tirthikas that the mind is established or not established.üîΩThe non-arising of consciousness simultaneously with the object is not a reason for the mind.

original: phyogs gcig la dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems te /
translated: The meaning of the root text is that the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is to be supplied to the phrase ‚Äúthe non-arising of consciousness simultaneously with the object.‚Äù

original: bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the summary of the meaning.

original: yan lag gi don brjod pa /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod pa /
translated: The explanation of the component parts of the root text.

original: bde gshegs pa dang phyi rol pa ste mu stegs ba de dag gis bstan pa yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: bde gshegs pa dang phyi rol pa ste mu stegs ba de dag gis bstan pa yang de dag yin la /
translated: The Sugata and the tirthikas, the non-Buddhists, assert that the mind is established or not established.

original: yid kyang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde dag go rims bzhin du grub pa dang ma grub pa'am /üîΩyang dag par grub pa'am /
analyzed: yid kyang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de dag go rims bzhin du grub pa dang ma grub pa'am / yang dag par grub pa'am /
translated: The word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThey are established or not established in order.üîΩOr they are established or not established in reality.

original: lhan cig pa'i grub pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i grub pa de'i phyir te /
translated: Or they are established or not established simultaneously.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
translated: That is the reason.

original: de yang ji ltar mdo gcig gis don 'gal ba gnyis go bar byed ce na dgag bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar mdo gcig gis don 'gal ba gnyis go bar byed ce na dgag bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words ‚Äúnegation‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: dgag pa dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba gzhan gyi yid ma grub par bya ba'i phyir rtags ma yin no zhes dgag pa'i tshig bton nas bstan la /
analyzed: dgag pa dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba gzhan gyi yid ma grub par bya ba'i phyir rtags ma yin no zhes dgag pa'i tshig bton nas bstan la /
translated: The words ‚Äúnegation‚Äù are uttered in order to teach that the reason is not established because it is not established in the mind of the other.

original: bde bar bshegs pa pa'i yid grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan du dgag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: bde bar bshegs pa pa'i yid grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan du dgag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-negation‚Äù is stated in order to establish the mind of the Sugata.

original: yang 'on te ji ltar tshig gcig la dgag pa dang bcas pa dang dgag pa med pa gnyis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'on te ji ltar tshig gcig la dgag pa dang bcas pa dang dgag pa med pa gnyis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, how can both negation and non-negation be established in one word?

original: bzlas pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bzlas pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words ‚Äúby repetition‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: 'di bzlas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di bzlas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúby the method of repetition.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las /
translated: From the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles:

original: rdzas kyi tshig gi don brtag pa ste bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: rdzas kyi tshig gi don brtag pa ste bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter on the examination of the meaning of the word substance.

original: // / yon tan la sogs pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir rdzas rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // / yon tan la sogs pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir rdzas rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute the qualities, etc., he says, ‚ÄúThe substances, etc.‚Äù

original: rdzas rnams bkag pa nyid kyis yon tan dang las la sogs pa khyad par gyi mthar thug pa rnams bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzas rnams bkag pa nyid kyis yon tan dang las la sogs pa khyad par gyi mthar thug pa rnams bsal ba yin te /
translated: The qualities, actions, etc., which are the ultimate distinctions, are refuted by the refutation of the substances alone.

original: de dag ni de la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are dependent on the substances.

original: rten med pa na yang brten pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis gnas pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa na yang brten pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis gnas pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And when there is no basis, it is not tenable that the dependent exist by their own power.

original: der brten pa ste de ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos sam brgyud pas rdzas la brten pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: der brten pa ste de ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos sam brgyud pas rdzas la brten pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Dependent on that, i.e., on the substances, they are accepted‚Äù means that they are accepted as being dependent on the substances, either directly or indirectly.

original: 'di ltar yon tan dang las dag ni dngos kho nar rdzas la brten pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan dang las dag ni dngos kho nar rdzas la brten pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the qualities and actions are accepted as being dependent on the substances directly.

original: de skad du yang mdo las /üîΩ@273b yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas la brten pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las / @273b yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas la brten pa /
translated: As it says in a sutra:üîΩThe characteristics of the qualities are dependent on the substances.

original: yon tan gyi ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag la rgyu ma yin pa ltos pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag la rgyu ma yin pa ltos pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The qualities are said to be independent of the possessor of the qualities and of the distinctions, and they are not causes.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas gcig pa can yon tan med pa can ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag la ltos ba med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas gcig pa can yon tan med pa can ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag la ltos ba med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The definition of action is: that which is not a cause of inherence, non-existence, quality, or disjunction, without regard to a single substance.

original: rdzas gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Single substance‚Äù means ‚Äúthat which is based on a single substance.‚Äù

original: yon tan kha cig ni rdzas du ma la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan kha cig ni rdzas du ma la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Some qualities inhere in many substances.

original: ji ltar ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, inherence, disjunction, etc.

original: spyi dang bye brag rnams kyang kha cig ni rdzas la 'jug pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag rnams kyang kha cig ni rdzas la 'jug pa kho na yin te /
translated: Some universals and particulars inhere only in substances.

original: dpe nas nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe nas nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, existence, etc.

original: yon tan dang las nyid la sogs rdzas dang 'brel pa'i yon tan dang las kyi tshig gi don la 'jug go //
analyzed: yon tan dang las nyid la sogs rdzas dang 'brel pa'i yon tan dang las kyi tshig gi don la 'jug go //
translated: The words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúaction‚Äù refer to qualities and actions that are related to substances.

original: spyi chen po yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas la sogs pa tshig gi don gsum la 'jug go //
analyzed: spyi chen po yod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas la sogs pa tshig gi don gsum la 'jug go //
translated: The word ‚Äúexistence‚Äù refers to the three categories of substance, etc.

original: de lta bas na rdzas bkag nas 'bad mi dgos par yon tan la sogs pa yang bkag par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshig gi don lhag ma brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni rdzas brtag pa nyid du rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzas bkag nas 'bad mi dgos par yon tan la sogs pa yang bkag par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshig gi don lhag ma brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni rdzas brtag pa nyid du rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the refutation of substance is not necessary, the refutation of quality and so on is also accomplished. Therefore, the result of the analysis of the remaining topics is complete in the analysis of substance alone.

original: 'o na 'du ba dgag pa logs shin tu brtsam par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'du ba dgag pa logs shin tu brtsam par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: But the refutation of contact must be undertaken separately.üîΩContact is not tenable

original: 'du ba'ang gang du gang gi yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'du ba'ang gang du gang gi yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: in any of the five ways.

original: tshig gi don lnga la 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni 'du ba yin par brjod de /
analyzed: tshig gi don lnga la 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni 'du ba yin par brjod de /
translated: The nature of the five topics is said to be contact.

original: rdzas la sogs pa 'brel pa can rnam pa lnga bsal ba yin na gang du gang gis 'du ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa 'brel pa can rnam pa lnga bsal ba yin na gang du gang gis 'du ba yin te /
translated: If the five types of related things, such as substance, are eliminated, then in what and by what is there contact?

original: gang du yang 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang du yang 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: In none at all. This is the meaning.

original: rten dang brten pa thams cad bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa thams cad bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all bases and the based are refuted.

original: de la re zhig yon tan rnams khyad par du dgag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig yon tan rnams khyad par du dgag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the refutation of the particularities of quality will be explained.

original: de la mdo las gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa rnams dang / grangs dang / tshad dang / so so pa nyid dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la mdo las gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa rnams dang / grangs dang / tshad dang / so so pa nyid dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang /
translated: Form, taste, smell, tactility, number, measurement, separateness, conjunction, disjunction,

original: blo rnams dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dag dang / 'bad pa ni yon tan dag go zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: blo rnams dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dag dang / 'bad pa ni yon tan dag go zhes 'byung ste /
translated: otherness, non-otherness, cognition, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, and effort are qualities.

original: dang gi sgra las lci ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / snum pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / sgra rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: dang gi sgra las lci ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / snum pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / sgra rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates heaviness, fluidity, viscosity, composition, virtue, nonvirtue, and sound.

original: de la gzugs ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: Form is apprehended by the eye.

original: sa dang chu dang me la gnas so //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me la gnas so //
translated: It exists in the elements of earth, water, and fire.

original: ro ni lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: ro ni lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: Taste is apprehended by the tongue.

original: sa dang chu la gnas so //
analyzed: sa dang chu la gnas so //
translated: It exists in the elements of earth and water.

original: dri ni snas gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dri ni snas gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Smell is apprehended by the nose.

original: sa la gnas so //
analyzed: sa la gnas so //
translated: It exists in the element of earth.

original: reg pa ni lus kyi dbang @274a * //
analyzed: reg pa ni lus kyi dbang @274a * //
translated: Tactility is apprehended by the body.

original: bos gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bos gzung bar bya ste /
translated: and the other three are to be grasped by the eye.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang rlung la gnas so //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang rlung la gnas so //
translated: They are located in earth, water, fire, and air.

original: 'di dag gi gzugs la sogs pa dang po bzhi dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gzugs la sogs pa dang po bzhi dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the first four, beginning with form, he says,

original: rags pa'i rdzas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rags pa'i rdzas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúin a gross substance,‚Äù and so on.

original: rags pa nyid gyi rdzas la 'du ba rnams ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba nyid yin te ;
analyzed: rags pa nyid gyi rdzas la 'du ba rnams ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba nyid yin te ;
translated: The collection of atoms is characterized as the object of perception in a gross substance.

original: de'i phyir rags pa la zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rags pa la zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúin a gross substance.‚Äù

original: rdzas de la yang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gal te gcig pa nyid de cha shas med par 'dod na /
analyzed: rdzas de la yang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gal te gcig pa nyid de cha shas med par 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if the four aspects of a gross substance, such as blue, are asserted to be one, that is, partless,

original: de'i tshe sgo gseb la sogs pa'i bu gar 'jug pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa'i snang ba phra mos kyang khang pa'i phugs la sogs par gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ches che ba dang 'du ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo mngon par gsal
analyzed: de'i tshe sgo gseb la sogs pa'i bu gar 'jug pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa'i snang ba phra mos kyang khang pa'i phugs la sogs par gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ches che ba dang 'du ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo mngon par gsal
translated: then even a subtle light entering a crevice and so on would reveal the nature of the blue and so on that is collected in a very large gross substance, such as a pot, located in the rear of a house and so on.

original: ba na rdzas ji snyed pa mtha' dag la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba dang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba na rdzas ji snyed pa mtha' dag la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba dang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you maintain that the substance is perceived in its entirety, then the form, etc. that reside in the substance will also be perceived in their entirety.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the substance has no parts.

original: gang gis phyogs gcig gis mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba gcig la cha yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis phyogs gcig gis mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba gcig la cha yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that one part of the substance is perceived.

original: bu ga'i snang bas zhes bya ba ni mtshon ba ste /
analyzed: bu ga'i snang bas zhes bya ba ni mtshon ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúlight‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe light of a hole‚Äù is a metaphor.

original: sa'i phyogs gcig tu chus mngon par gsal ba na phyogs gzhan du yang mngon par gsal ba dang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i phyogs gcig tu chus mngon par gsal ba na phyogs gzhan du yang mngon par gsal ba dang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one part of the earth is illuminated by water, then it follows that the other parts of the earth are also illuminated and perceived.

original: me la sogs pa dang aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig gi shan tsam reg pa dang myangs pa na /
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig gi shan tsam reg pa dang myangs pa na /
translated: If one part of fire, etc. or the mango, etc. is touched or tasted,

original: rdzas de la 'du ba de snyed pa'i reg pa dang / ro dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas de la 'du ba de snyed pa'i reg pa dang / ro dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the contact and taste of the entire substance will be perceived.

original: 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa mtha' dag dmigs pa dang / mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa mtha' dag dmigs pa dang / mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the entire blue, etc. is perceived and illuminated,

original: yangs pa'i yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yangs pa'i yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn a vast region‚Äù and so on.

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at that occasion.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bu ga'i snang bas so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bu ga'i snang bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOf that‚Äù means of the appearance of the hole.

original: de'i ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams tha dad par khas len pa nas la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas bzhin du rdul phra rab tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams tha dad par khas len pa nas la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas bzhin du rdul phra rab tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that the atoms of blue and so on are accepted as different, and because the atoms have a measure, they become the nature of substance, like the substance of the atoms of blue and so on.

original: yon tan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the nature of qualities.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rdul phra rab tha dad pa rnams la yon tan du tha snyad byed na ming la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rdul phra rab tha dad pa rnams la yon tan du tha snyad byed na ming la rtsod pa med do //
translated: If one conventionally designates the different atoms that have become like that as qualities, there is no dispute about the name.

original: rdul nyid yin na yang brten pa nyid las yon tan nyid du rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul nyid yin na yang brten pa nyid las yon tan nyid du rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if they are atoms, one does not know that they are qualities because they are supported.

original: yod pa dang med pa la rten mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la rten mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is untenable that they are supported in the existent and the nonexistent, and because it is an extreme absurdity.

original: 'di ltar yan lag can gyi @274b rdzas kyang yan lag gi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir de yang yon tan du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag can gyi @274b rdzas kyang yan lag gi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir de yang yon tan du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the substance that is the possessor of parts is also a quality, because it is based on the substances that are its parts.

original: de la gcig la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gcig nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grangs te /
analyzed: de la gcig la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gcig nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grangs te /
translated: Number is the characteristic of oneness, etc., which is the cause of the conventions of one, etc.

original: de yang rdzas gcig pa dang rdzas du ma pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rdzas gcig pa dang rdzas du ma pa yin no //
translated: It is either a single substance or many substances.

original: de la gcig gi grangs ni rdzas gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gcig gi grangs ni rdzas gcig pa yin la /
translated: The number one is a single substance.

original: gnyis nyid la sogs pa ni rdzas du ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid la sogs pa ni rdzas du ma yin no //
translated: Twoness, etc., are many substances.

original: de la rdzas gcig pa la ni rtag pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag tu sgrub bar chu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs par gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas gcig pa la ni rtag pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag tu sgrub bar chu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs par gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In regard to a single substance, one should understand that it is established as both permanent and impermanent, like form, etc., which is included in the atoms of water, etc.

original: rdzas du ma ni du ma'i yul can gyi blo dang lhan cig pa'i gcig las grub pa la ltos pa'i blo 'jig pas 'jig pa dang / la la rten 'jig pas kyang 'jig pa yin te zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas du ma ni du ma'i yul can gyi blo dang lhan cig pa'i gcig las grub pa la ltos pa'i blo 'jig pas 'jig pa dang / la la rten 'jig pas kyang 'jig pa yin te zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The destruction of the many is understood to be the destruction of the cognition that is based on the one that is simultaneous with the cognition of the many.

original: gzhan dag grangs rnam pa gnyis po 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub ba dang // khyad par gyi blo yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang grub par sems so zhes grag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag grangs rnam pa gnyis po 'di yang mngon sum nyid kyis grub ba dang // khyad par gyi blo yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang grub par sems so zhes grag go //
translated: Others believe that these two types of number are established by direct perception and that the cognition of difference is also established by inference because it is dependent on another reason.

original: de la 'di'i 'gegs pa bshad pa /
analyzed: de la 'di'i 'gegs pa bshad pa /
translated: In this regard, the refutation of this is stated:

original: de min ngo bo las ldog pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de min ngo bo las ldog pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: There is no number apart from the entities.

original: bsdus pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i glang po la sogs pa gang dag la ming sbyor ba de las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du chud pa'i grangs zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i glang po la sogs pa gang dag la ming sbyor ba de las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du chud pa'i grangs zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The so-called number that is included among the objects of perception does not exist apart from the entities such as elephants that are distinguished by collection, etc.

original: de ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: de ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
translated: It is the object of a convention that is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni snang du rung bar 'dod de /üîΩde skad du yang mdo las grangs dang tshad rnams dang / so so ba nyid dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / las ni gzugs can gyi rdzas dang 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni snang du rung bar 'dod de / de skad du yang mdo las grangs dang tshad rnams dang / so so ba nyid dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / las ni gzugs can gyi rdzas dang 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is asserted that it is suitable to appear,üîΩit says in a sutra:

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNumber, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, otherness, non-otherness, and action are apprehended by the eye because they are conjoined with physical substances.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi blo las grangs 'grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par gyi blo las grangs 'grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not established from the cognition of difference.üîΩTo demonstrate that, he says,

original: 'dod pas rab tu sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pas rab tu sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is applied by desire,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gcig go //
translated: Because it is like this, there is one cognition.

original: shes pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la grangs med par yang gcig la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du grogs la sogs pa med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa rang gi 'dod
analyzed: shes pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la grangs med par yang gcig la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du grogs la sogs pa med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa rang gi 'dod
translated: In the same way, with regard to things such as a pot that are without companions, etc.,

original: pas brda byas pa de la yid la byed pa gang yin pa gzo pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa gcig 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'di ma @275a * //üîΩnges pa yin no //
analyzed: pas brda byas pa de la yid la byed pa gang yin pa gzo pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa gcig 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'di ma @275a * // nges pa yin no //
translated: one should understand that the cognition of one, etc., is not definite, since a cognition that conforms to the convention that is desired by oneself, such as one, etc., arises in the mind of one who is engaged in that convention.

original: shes pa de dag la ni grangs yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de dag la ni grangs yod ba ma yin te /
translated: Those cognitions do not have number,

original: de dag rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir dang / grangs ni yon tan nyid yin pas rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir dang / grangs ni yon tan nyid yin pas rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not substances and because number is a quality that is based on substance.

original: ci ste shes pa 'di dag la 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa 'di dag la 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: If you think that this number is imputed to those cognitions,

original: ci lta bu ni gcig yin te /üîΩ'dir chos mthun pa yang grogs med pa'i phyir ro snyam du 'dod na shes /
analyzed: ci lta bu ni gcig yin te / 'dir chos mthun pa yang grogs med pa'i phyir ro snyam du 'dod na shes /
translated: what is the one like?üîΩHere, the similarity of attributes is not due to the absence of a companion.

original: de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that, then no!

original: shes ba 'di ni btags pa yin par mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes ba 'di ni btags pa yin par mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not unreasonable to impute this consciousness,

original: shes pa 'di ni 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this consciousness engages without error.

original: dper na khung bu pa la ba lang zhes shes pa 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: dper na khung bu pa la ba lang zhes shes pa 'khrul pa ste /
translated: For example, the consciousness that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù in regard to a hole in the wall is erroneous.

original: ba lang lta bu ni ba lang yin gyi ba lang nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang lta bu ni ba lang yin gyi ba lang nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The cow-like thing is a cow, but not the cowness,üîΩbecause it lacks a hump and so on.

original: nog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du shes pa gcig la sogs pa 'di 'khrul pa gcig lta bu ni gcig dang 'dra ba yin gyi gcig nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du shes pa gcig la sogs pa 'di 'khrul pa gcig lta bu ni gcig dang 'dra ba yin gyi gcig nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, this consciousness that is like one in a single consciousness and so on is similar to one, but it is not one.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But it is not like that.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la ci 'dra ba'i blo ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba shes pa la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la ci 'dra ba'i blo ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba shes pa la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses of pot and so on are not like the unmistaken consciousnesses that occur in regard to pots and so on.

original: 'di snyam du shes pa 'di 'dra ba la ltos nas brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag gi rten du gyur pa'i rdzas gang yin pa der gtogs pa'i gcig nyid la sogs pa las don gcig la 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa 'di 'dra ba la ltos nas brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dag gi rten du gyur pa'i rdzas gang yin pa der gtogs pa'i gcig nyid la sogs pa las don gcig la 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: It is not said in dependence on such a consciousness, but rather, the oneness that belongs to the substance that is the basis of those is the same as the oneness of the substance that is the basis of the qualities.

original: yon tan dang las dang 'du ba la sogs pa la gcig la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
analyzed: yon tan dang las dang 'du ba la sogs pa la gcig la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of oneness and so on with regard to qualities, actions, and inherence and so on is the same as the consciousness of oneness and so on with regard to substance.üîΩTo anticipate this qualm, he says,

original: don gcig la ni 'du ba'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don gcig la ni 'du ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because they are the same in being one.

original: 'dir lan smras pa /üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the response is:üîΩIf it is as you say,

original: gal te shes pa 'di rdzas de dang 'du ba'i gcig nyid la sogs pa las shes pa gcig dang bde ba la sogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rdzas dang 'du ba rnams la de'i tshe de ltar shes pa gcig go zhes bya ba yin du chug mod
analyzed: gal te shes pa 'di rdzas de dang 'du ba'i gcig nyid la sogs pa las shes pa gcig dang bde ba la sogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rdzas dang 'du ba rnams la de'i tshe de ltar shes pa gcig go zhes bya ba yin du chug mod
translated: If this consciousness is the same as the oneness and so on of the substance that is the basis of those, then the consciousness of oneness and so on with regard to the substance that is the basis of the qualities, actions, and inherence and so on would be the same as the consciousness of oneness and so on with regard to the substance that is the basis of the qualities, actions, and inherence and so on.

original: / shes pa gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: / shes pa gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the cause of the cognition of two, three, four, etc.?

original: gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de la gnyis nyid la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgang yang tshig gi don drug dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod pa dang sdang bdag dang / las rnam pa lnga dang / gzhan dang gzhan khyab pa dang ma khyab ba'i spyi rnam pa gnyis dang ma yin pa'i spyi rnam pa gnyis dang /
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de la gnyis nyid la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no // gang yang tshig gi don drug dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod pa dang sdang bdag dang / las rnam pa lnga dang / gzhan dang gzhan khyab pa dang ma khyab ba'i spyi rnam pa gnyis dang ma yin pa'i spyi rnam pa gnyis dang /
translated: If it is of the nature of one, it cannot be of the nature of two, etc.

original: dngos po gcig dang / 'du ba gcig ces bya ba 'di brjod pa de la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dngos po gcig dang / 'du ba gcig ces bya ba 'di brjod pa de la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the cause of the statement that there are six categories, pleasure and pain, desire and aversion, the five kinds of action, the two kinds of universals, the pervasive and the nonpervasive, the two kinds of nonuniversals, the single entity and the single collection?

original: de la don gcig la 'du ba'i grangs ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la don gcig la 'du ba'i grangs ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such thing as a single collection in a single entity.

original: de @275b lta bas na khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yang brtag bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de @275b lta bas na khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yang brtag bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because it is not a pervader, it is not reasonable to imagine it.

original: gzhan yang gal te don gcig la 'du ba'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te don gcig la 'du ba'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, if there is a single collection in a single entity, or if there is another,

original: rang gi blos brtags pa'i rgyu brjod pa de lta bu yang don gcig la 'du ba la sogs pa las skye ba'i shes pa 'di brtags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi blos brtags pa'i rgyu brjod pa de lta bu yang don gcig la 'du ba la sogs pa las skye ba'i shes pa 'di brtags par 'gyur te /
translated: The expression of a cause imagined by one‚Äôs own mind is also imagined in this cognition produced from a collection of one thing and so on,

original: dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because there is no other entity.

original: / de lta yin dang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta yin dang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would be mistaken.

original: de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i khye'u la me'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i khye'u la me'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because there is no reason for its engagement, like the cognition of fire in a Brahmin boy.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that.

original: de'i phyir gang bshad pa'i nyes pa las mi 'da' ba kho na'o //üîΩglang po la sogs shes pa las //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang bshad pa'i nyes pa las mi 'da' ba kho na'o // glang po la sogs shes pa las //
translated: Therefore, it is only not beyond the fault explained.üîΩFrom the cognition of an elephant and so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs grub par bya ba'i phyir rnam phug pas smras pa'i tshad ma dogs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs grub par bya ba'i phyir rnam phug pas smras pa'i tshad ma dogs par byed do //
translated: in order to establish the number, the one who is pierced by the arrow speaks of a valid means of knowledge.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: dmag gi shes pa ni glang po che dang rta dang shing rta la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: dmag gi shes pa ni glang po che dang rta dang shing rta la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The cognition of an army has a reason other than elephants, horses, chariots, and so on.

original: glang po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir gos sngon po'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: glang po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir gos sngon po'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: because it is unlike the consciousness of an elephant, etc., like the consciousness of blue cloth.

original: de las gzhan las byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan las byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from something else‚Äù means

original: glang po che dang rta dang shing rta la sogs pa de las gzhan ni de las gzhan no //
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang shing rta la sogs pa de las gzhan ni de las gzhan no //
translated: something other than an elephant, horse, chariot, etc.

original: de las byung ba gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúwhich has.‚Äù

original: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúIt is not so, because of the application of desire, etc.‚Äù

original: glang po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i brda'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi rgyu mtshan can du 'dod pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: glang po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i brda'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi rgyu mtshan can du 'dod pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is asserted that the internal reason is the mental attention to the convention, etc., which is different from the elephant, etc., this is simply an argument establishing what is already established.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brda dran pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brda dran pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the memory of the convention, etc.

original: ci ste brda gzo ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po rgyu mtshan can nyid du bsgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste brda gzo ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po rgyu mtshan can nyid du bsgrub par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the thing which is different from the application of the convention, etc. is the reason,

original: de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no zhes thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa'i thabs kyis ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no zhes thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa'i thabs kyis ston pa ni /
translated: This is taught by the method of stating the consequence.

original: 'di nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis /
translated: This is stated in the line:

original: blo la sogs pa'ang grangs su 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa'ang grangs su 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of one and so on would also become number.‚Äù

original: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bshad pas de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bshad pas de nyid kyis /
translated: Since it was explained that ‚Äúbecause it is not similar to the cognition of that,‚Äù

original: gcig gi blo dang gnyis kyi blo dang las lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang grangs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gi blo dang gnyis kyi blo dang las lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang grangs su 'gyur te /
translated: the cognition of one, the cognition of two, the five actions, and so on would also become number.

original: gcig la sogs pa'i blo de la yang de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'i blo de la yang de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cognition of one and so on is not similar to the cognition of that.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de lta bas na ma nges pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma nges pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is indeterminate.

original: gzhan yang gnyis nyid la sogs pa'i grangs rdzas du ma gang yin pa de'i blo du ma dang lhan cig ba'i gcig nyid las grub par khyed cag gis smras pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan med pa yin no /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis nyid la sogs pa'i grangs rdzas du ma gang yin pa de'i blo du ma dang lhan cig ba'i gcig nyid las grub par khyed cag gis smras pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan med pa yin no /
translated: Moreover, the assertion that the cognition of the number of many substances such as two and so on is established from one that is concomitant with many is groundless.

original: @276a * // zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: @276a * // zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This is taught by the following:

original: gal te blo la ltos pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te blo la ltos pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the cognition of one and so on is based on the mind,

original: tsam smos pas gcig nyid dang gnyis nyid la sogs pa de'i spyi dang 'brel ba can gyi shes pa rnam par gcod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tsam smos pas gcig nyid dang gnyis nyid la sogs pa de'i spyi dang 'brel ba can gyi shes pa rnam par gcod pa'i don du'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to exclude the cognition of their universals, such as oneness and twoness.

original: blo de zhes bya ba ni bgrang bar bya ba dag la gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo brda gzo ba tsam gyis ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: blo de zhes bya ba ni bgrang bar bya ba dag la gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo brda gzo ba tsam gyis ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the mind that counts, such as the cognition of two, three, four, and so on, is merely a conventional expression?

original: de lta na ni nus pa mthong ba rgyu nyid du brtags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni nus pa mthong ba rgyu nyid du brtags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do, then the observed capacity would not be imagined to be the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the reasons would be endless.
