original: 'di ltar ltos pa'i blo yod na yod pa'i phyir de dang de med na yang med pa'i phyir der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa'i blo yod na yod pa'i phyir de dang de med na yang med pa'i phyir der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, if the mind of dependence exists, it exists; if that and that do not exist, it does not exist. It follows the positive and negative concomitance that pertains to it.

original: de kho na brtag par rigs kyi gzhan du ni 'khru sman dang phrad nas lto 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba yang brtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na brtag par rigs kyi gzhan du ni 'khru sman dang phrad nas lto 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba yang brtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is proper to examine reality, but it would be absurd to say that the stomach is cleansed by contact with a purgative.

original: bsdu ba la sogs pa las ldog cing dngos po las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par mngon par 'dod pa'i gnyis nyid la sogs pa snang ba'am 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba la sogs pa las ldog cing dngos po las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par mngon par 'dod pa'i gnyis nyid la sogs pa snang ba'am 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that the appearance or perception of duality, etc., which is asserted to be the characteristic of perception, is the opposite of collection, etc., and different from the thing.

original: gcig du ma la 'jug pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / spyi dang 'du ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig du ma la 'jug pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / spyi dang 'du ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is because the application of one and many is refuted, and because the refutation of universals and inherence would follow.üîΩThe explanation of the refutation of magnitude is:

original: che dang ring sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa tshad kyi tha dad kyi rgyu ni med do //
analyzed: che dang ring sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa tshad kyi tha dad kyi rgyu ni med do //
translated: The cause of the difference of magnitude does not exist.üîΩMoreover, magnitude is of four kinds:

original: de yang chen po dang rdul phra rab dang / ring po dang / thung ngu zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang chen po dang rdul phra rab dang / ring po dang / thung ngu zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: great, subtle, long, and short.

original: de la chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among them, great is of two kinds:

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa ni nam mkha' dang / dus dang phyogs dang bdag rnams la ni mchog tu chen po nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni nam mkha' dang / dus dang phyogs dang bdag rnams la ni mchog tu chen po nyid do //
translated: Permanence is the supreme greatness of space, time, direction, and self.

original: mi rtag ba ni rdul phra rab gsum pa la sogs ba'i rdzas rnams la'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ba ni rdul phra rab gsum pa la sogs ba'i rdzas rnams la'o //
translated: Impermanence is the substances of the three atoms and so on.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, atoms are of two types:

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
translated: permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa ni rdul phra rab dang / yid la zlum pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rdul phra rab dang / yid la zlum pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The permanent is the atom and the mind, which have the characteristic of a circle.

original: mi rtag pa ni rdul phra rab gnyis pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rdul phra rab gnyis pa nyid do //
translated: The impermanent is the second atom.

original: autpala dang / skyu ru ra dang / bil ba la sogs pa chen po la yang /
analyzed: autpala dang / skyu ru ra dang / bil ba la sogs pa chen po la yang /
translated: Even in the case of a large thing, such as a lotus, a myrobalan fruit, or a bilva fruit,

original: khyad par du 'phags par 'byung ba'i dngos po la ltos nas btags nas rdul phra rab tu brjod de /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags par 'byung ba'i dngos po la ltos nas btags nas rdul phra rab tu brjod de /
translated: it is called an atom in dependence on a thing that is especially large.

original: skyur ru'i che ba'i tshad ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i autpala ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyur ru'i che ba'i tshad ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i autpala ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A myrobalan fruit is not the size of a lotus.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to other things.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab gsum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i chen po dang ring ba dag dang / rdul phran gnyis 'byar pa'i rdul phra rab dang / thung du dag @276b ba khyad bar ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab gsum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i chen po dang ring ba dag dang / rdul phran gnyis 'byar pa'i rdul phra rab dang / thung du dag @276b ba khyad bar ci yod ce na /
translated: If the dimension of the great and the length of the three minute particles, etc., are not established, and if the dimension of the short and the length of the two conjoined minute particles are not established, what is the difference between the great and the long, and the short and the long?

original: brjod ba de la chen bo nyid dang ring po nyid dag la phan tshun khyad par yod de /
analyzed: brjod ba de la chen bo nyid dang ring po nyid dag la phan tshun khyad par yod de /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: The great and the long are mutually different.

original: chen po rnams las ring po 'on cig / ring po rnams las chen po 'on cig ces bya ba'i tha snyad tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po rnams las ring po 'on cig / ring po rnams las chen po 'on cig ces bya ba'i tha snyad tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the expressions ‚ÄúBring the great from among the great‚Äù and ‚ÄúBring the long from among the long‚Äù are seen to be different.

original: rdul phra rab dang thung du dag gi khyad par yang de mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon sum nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan dag gi lugs yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang thung du dag gi khyad par yang de mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon sum nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan dag gi lugs yin no //
translated: The difference between the minute and the short is also directly perceived by yogins. This is the system of others.

original: gzhan dag ni chen po la sogs pa 'di yang gzugs la sogs pa las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid du 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chen po la sogs pa 'di yang gzugs la sogs pa las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid du 'grub pa ste /
translated: Others say: The great, etc., are established as being different from form, etc.

original: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra'i blos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra'i blos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the object of a mind that is unlike the consciousness of that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sems te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sems te /
translated: It is like pleasure and so on.

original: de la re zhig gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi dbang po'i blo dang mi 'dra ba'i mngon sum gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi dbang po'i blo dang mi 'dra ba'i mngon sum gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the reason is because it is the object apprehended by a direct perception that is unlike the sense consciousness that has form and so on as its object,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: then at that time the reason is not established.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs par chen po la sogs pa'i tshe da bab da po'i blo la snang ba bzhin par ma dmigs so //üîΩci ste rdul phra rab dang chen po'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs par chen po la sogs pa'i tshe da bab da po'i blo la snang ba bzhin par ma dmigs so // ci ste rdul phra rab dang chen po'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Apart from the things such as form that exist in that way, the entity that is the object of the mind that conceives of a pot and so on is not observed to be like the appearance to the mind of a pot and so on.

original: de lta bu rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang yin pa de de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de lta bu rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang yin pa de de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the reason is because it is the object of a mind that is unlike the consciousness of that,

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: then in that case also the reason is not established.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that can harm the position that is contrary to that.

original: 'di la don dam par gzung bar bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don dam par gzung bar bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, ultimately, there is not the slightest thing that can be apprehended,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is conceptual.

original: phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de dag la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de dag la /
translated: Those who see form, etc., as engaging in the aspect of being directed toward one part, etc.,

original: de dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brda byas pa'i dor chen po zhes des pa skye ba 'ba' zhig tu grang do //
analyzed: de dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brda byas pa'i dor chen po zhes des pa skye ba 'ba' zhig tu grang do //
translated: in order to demonstrate that form, etc., is different from that which is not like it, the idea of a ‚Äúgreat cloth‚Äù arises.

original: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, another entity is not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i des pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i des pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, since the idea does not exist apart from form, etc., the reason is also not established.

original: dam bca' yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: dam bca' yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin te /
translated: The thesis is also undermined by perception.

original: mngon sum du 'dod pa'i chen po la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dod pa'i chen po la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because the so-called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù directly perceived is not perceived as anything other than form, etc.

original: de lta bas na tshad de yang phyogs gcig tu phyogs pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i don la don de de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa la brton @277a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad de yang phyogs gcig tu phyogs pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i don la don de de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa la brton @277a * //
translated: Therefore, that measure is also based on the object, form, etc., which is engaged in one direction, etc., as different from that which is not such an object.

original: nas de'i bdag nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: nas de'i bdag nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why not accept it as that very nature?

original: de lta na ni ma mthong ba dang mi rigs pa'i dngos po brtag par bya mi dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma mthong ba dang mi rigs pa'i dngos po brtag par bya mi dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be unnecessary to investigate unseen and unreasonable things.

original: tha dad nyid kyis ni zhes nyid kyi sgras bstan to //üîΩ'di ltar phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mang po mthong ba'am /
analyzed: tha dad nyid kyis ni zhes nyid kyi sgras bstan to // 'di ltar phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs par 'jug pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mang po mthong ba'am /
translated: By ‚Äújust‚Äù in ‚Äúby difference just,‚Äù the word ‚Äújust‚Äù is stated.

original: rig pa na ring po'o zhes tha snyid du byed la /
analyzed: rig pa na ring po'o zhes tha snyid du byed la /
translated: Thus, when many forms, etc., are seen or cognized as engaged in one direction, the convention ‚Äúlong‚Äù is used.

original: de la ltos pa'i nyung dur skye ba la thung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i nyung dur skye ba la thung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In dependence on that, when there is production as less, it is called ‚Äúshort.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa de dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa de dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be applied to the great and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bkag pa bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pa dag las chen po la sogs pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bkag pa bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pa dag las chen po la sogs pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as form and so on are refuted, the great and so on are also refuted in terms of the concepts of one and many.

original: gzhan la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du gsal rab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar khad bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩkhyed kyi kun du brtags pa'i chen po nyid la sogs pa med na yang khang bzangs kyi phreng la sogs pa dag la chen po la sogs pa'i shes pa skye bar nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du gsal rab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar khad bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / khyed kyi kun du brtags pa'i chen po nyid la sogs pa med na yang khang bzangs kyi phreng la sogs pa dag la chen po la sogs pa'i shes pa skye bar nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is clear that the reason is not ascertained because the reason is seen to apply to what is nonexistent in other cases as well, he says, ‚ÄúJust as in the case of a mansion,‚Äù and so on.üîΩEven though the great and so on that you imagine do not exist, you experience the cognition of great and so on in relation to a row of mansions and so on.

original: gang kho nar khang bzangs la sogs pa la phreng zhes bya ba'i yon tan dang 'du ba de la chen po la sogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gang kho nar khang bzangs la sogs pa la phreng zhes bya ba'i yon tan dang 'du ba de la chen po la sogs pa yang yin te /
translated: In just the same way, in relation to a mansion and so on, the cognition of great and so on arises in relation to a row, which is a quality and a collection.

original: des na don gcig la 'du ba'i stobs las de bzhin du chen po zhes bya ba de lta bur de'i phreng ba la sogs par tha snyad du byas ba yin no zhes bya ba de skad du yang brjod par mi nus te /üîΩde yang rang gi gzhung dang 'gal lo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na don gcig la 'du ba'i stobs las de bzhin du chen po zhes bya ba de lta bur de'i phreng ba la sogs par tha snyad du byas ba yin no zhes bya ba de skad du yang brjod par mi nus te / de yang rang gi gzhung dang 'gal lo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that the convention ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is made in that way with respect to a garland, etc. due to the power of aggregation in one object.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this also contradicts your own texts, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe house, etc.‚Äù

original: khyim rnams la zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: khyim rnams la zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: The house, etc. refers to mansions, etc.

original: brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags dang rgyang grags kyi phyed la sogs pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags dang rgyang grags kyi phyed la sogs pa'i tshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who desires to express‚Äù refers to the measure of a kro≈õa, half a kro≈õa, etc.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: khang bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khang bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe house, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis ni khang bzangs ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis ni khang bzangs ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan du 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, you assert that the quality of the self that possesses a house, etc.

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin te /
translated: is a part, but not a substance that possesses parts.

original: rigs mi mthun pas rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pas rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because substances of different types do not combine.

original: yon tan rnams ni yon tan med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung yin pas yon tan de yang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni yon tan med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung yin pas yon tan de yang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the text states that qualities do not have qualities, the quality of being long also does not have a quality of being long.üîΩIf that were so, then the qualities of a mansion and so on would not be called a garland because they would not have another quality called a garland.

original: de lta yin dang khang bzangs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la phreng ba zhes bya ba'i yon tan gzhan med pa'i phyir khang bzangs kyi phreng zhes bya ba 'di nyid du mi 'gyur na chen po dang thung du zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ga la
analyzed: de lta yin dang khang bzangs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la phreng ba zhes bya ba'i yon tan gzhan med pa'i phyir khang bzangs kyi phreng zhes bya ba 'di nyid du mi 'gyur na chen po dang thung du zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ga la
translated: How could they be called long or short?

original: 'gyur / 'di ltar phreng ba ni grangs kyi rang bzhin du 'dod la grangs @277b kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur / 'di ltar phreng ba ni grangs kyi rang bzhin du 'dod la grangs @277b kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: A garland is asserted to be a type of number, and number is a quality,

original: rdzas kho na la brten gyi yon tan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kho na la brten gyi yon tan la ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is based on substance alone, not on a quality.

original: ci ste yang phreng ba yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du 'dod pa de lta na yang rdzas kyi rten ni rdzas kho na yin gyi yon tan ni ma yin pa'i phyir phrang ba khang bzangs la brten pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste yang phreng ba yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du 'dod pa de lta na yang rdzas kyi rten ni rdzas kho na yin gyi yon tan ni ma yin pa'i phyir phrang ba khang bzangs la brten pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: But if you assert that a garland is the intrinsic nature of its parts, then it is not tenable that a garland is supported by a mansion, because the support of a substance is only a substance, not a quality.

original: ci ste phreng ba rigs kyi rang bzhin du khas len par byed na de lta na yang rigs rten so so la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gcig kyang khang bzangs kyi phreng bar brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste phreng ba rigs kyi rang bzhin du khas len par byed na de lta na yang rigs rten so so la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gcig kyang khang bzangs kyi phreng bar brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that a garland is the intrinsic nature of a class, then it follows that a single class would be called a garland of mansions, because each support of a class is completely filled with the nature of the class.

original: shing ljon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing ljon pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like a tree.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te'ang khyim ni ldan pa yin /
analyzed: gal te'ang khyim ni ldan pa yin /
translated: If a house is endowed with a garland,

original: phreng ste de la ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: phreng ste de la ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be so?

original: gal te rigs yin khyim gcig la'ang //
analyzed: gal te rigs yin khyim gcig la'ang //
translated: If it is a class, a single house

original: phreng zhes brjod 'gyur ljon shing bzhin //üîΩzhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phreng zhes brjod 'gyur ljon shing bzhin //üîΩzhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: would be called a garland, like a tree.

original: gcig dang ring po dang chen po la sogs pa tha snyad du byed pa mi 'thad pa yang de'i gnas skabs kho na te /
analyzed: gcig dang ring po dang chen po la sogs pa tha snyad du byed pa mi 'thad pa yang de'i gnas skabs kho na te /
translated: It is also not tenable to designate a single thing, a long thing, or a great thing conventionally.

original: phreng dang de'i rten khang bzangs la sogs pa la gcig nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir dang / shing la sogs pa la yang brjod par 'dod pa'i ring po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phreng dang de'i rten khang bzangs la sogs pa la gcig nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir dang / shing la sogs pa la yang brjod par 'dod pa'i ring po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because a garland and the mansion that is its basis do not have the qualities of being a single thing, and so on, and because a tree and so on do not have the length, and so on, that is desired to be expressed.

original: khang bzangs kyi phreng mang po rnams la phreng ba phreng ba zhes su 'gro ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te /üîΩrigs la rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phreng mang po rnams la phreng ba phreng ba zhes su 'gro ba'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te / rigs la rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A garland of many mansions would not be called a garland because a class does not have a class.

original: ris pa / phreng mang po la de yi sgra //
analyzed: ris pa / phreng mang po la de yi sgra //
translated: A garland of many is the sound of that.

original: ji ltar rigs la rigs med phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs la rigs med phyir //
translated: Just as a class does not have a class.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //üîΩdes na btags pa'i rten de 'dzin ba'am /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no // des na btags pa'i rten de 'dzin ba'am /
translated: This is what is explained.üîΩTherefore it is not tenable that the basis of imputation is apprehended or

original: yang rten de gnas pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang rten de gnas pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that the basis remains.

original: phreng la sogs pa la chen po la sogs ba'i shes pa 'di 'khrul pas 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phreng la sogs pa la chen po la sogs ba'i shes pa 'di 'khrul pas 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of largeness, etc., with regard to a garland, etc., is not a case of erroneous engagement.

original: de lta bas na nye bar brtags par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar brtags par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to impute it.

original: dngos kyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa ni brtags par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos kyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa ni brtags par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to impute that which is not different from the actual cognition,

original: ha cad thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cad thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything would follow.

original: ji skad du /üîΩphreng la sogs la che nyid sogs //
analyzed: ji skad du / phreng la sogs la che nyid sogs //
translated: As it is said:

original: nye bar btags pa gang 'dod pa //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa gang 'dod pa //
translated: The largeness, etc., of a garland, etc.,

original: btags min dngos dang khyad med pa'i //
analyzed: btags min dngos dang khyad med pa'i //
translated: is imputed, but not real.

original: shes pa'i bzung bya yin phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bzung bya yin phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of a cognition

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //üîΩde la gang gi dbang gis 'di 'di las so so ba nyid yin no zhes ldan pa'i rdzas las logs su byed pa de ni logs su byed pa de ni logs su byed pa'i rgyu so so ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no // de la gang gi dbang gis 'di 'di las so so ba nyid yin no zhes ldan pa'i rdzas las logs su byed pa de ni logs su byed pa de ni logs su byed pa'i rgyu so so ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: that is not different from the real.üîΩThe cause of difference is called difference.

original: de yang bum pa la sogs pa las don gzhan du gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang bum pa la sogs pa las don gzhan du gyur ba yin te /
translated: It is different from a substance that possesses it, and it is different from a pot, etc.

original: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought of the opponent is the same as before: ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by a cognition that is different from the cognition of form, etc.‚Äù

original: de la yang tshad bzhin du gtan @278a * //
analyzed: de la yang tshad bzhin du gtan @278a * //
translated: Here, the response is the same as before:üîΩ‚ÄúThe reason is not established, and if it were established, it would be contradictory.‚Äù

original: tshigs ma grub pa nyid dang / ma nges pa bzhin no zhes zhe la bzhag nas so so ba'i rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di ltar 'di la yang gzugs la sogs pa las dben pa don gzhan du gyur ba gzhan so so ba nyid ces bya ba mngon sum gyi blo las mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs ma grub pa nyid dang / ma nges pa bzhin no zhes zhe la bzhag nas so so ba'i rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar 'di la yang gzugs la sogs pa las dben pa don gzhan du gyur ba gzhan so so ba nyid ces bya ba mngon sum gyi blo las mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Thinking this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúBecause of the individual causes, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIn this case, too, the reason is not established, because the cognition of the sense faculties, such as the eyes, is not established as a separate entity that is different from form, etc.

original: 'di la de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos gzung bar bya ba nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di la de'i shes pa dang mi 'dra ba'i blos gzung bar bya ba nyid ma grub po //
translated: This is because it does not appear to the cognition of direct perception as a separate entity that is different from form, etc.üîΩTherefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by a cognition that is different from the cognition of form, etc.‚Äù is not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of the object, the cognition that apprehends it does not exist.

original: so so ba zhes bya ba de rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: so so ba zhes bya ba de rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: ‚ÄúIndividual‚Äù is not established by the power of the conceptual consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag nyid rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag nyid rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those things, such as form, remain in their own nature.

original: dngos po thams cad rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyis ltos pa na so so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po gzhan ma grub po //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyis ltos pa na so so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po gzhan ma grub po //
translated: Since all things are the basis for the convention ‚Äúindividual‚Äù by virtue of their own nature, which is the opposite of that which is of a homogeneous or heterogeneous type, therefore other things are not established.

original: de lta bas na gang dag logs shig gi tha snyad de brjod pa 'di so so ba nyid kyi rgyu las yin par brjod pa de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dag logs shig gi tha snyad de brjod pa 'di so so ba nyid kyi rgyu las yin par brjod pa de ci'i phyir /
translated: Thus, why do those who assert that the convention ‚Äúindividual‚Äù is due to a cause of individuality

original: rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dngos po'i mthar thug par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dngos po'i mthar thug par mi 'dod de /
translated: not assert that the nature of a thing that is a different essence from that which is of a homogeneous or heterogeneous type is the final nature of a thing?

original: de'i mthar thug pa nyid rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mthar thug pa nyid rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is thought that it is not reasonable that it is the final nature of a thing.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason is indeterminate.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de rang bzhin gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de rang bzhin gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have a nature that is a different entity are said to be ‚Äúdistinct.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang yin la dngos po yang yin te /üîΩde dag la mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang yin la dngos po yang yin te / de dag la mthar thug pa ste /
translated: They are also ‚Äúthings.‚ÄùüîΩThey are ‚Äúultimate‚Äù in the sense that they are complete.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the sentence should be analyzed.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyis 'jug pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyis 'jug pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is seen to apply to the discordant side of the thesis, he says,üîΩJust as the qualities of pleasure, etc.,

original: ji ltar phan tshun tha dad pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar phan tshun tha dad pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: are not distinct from each other,

original: bde ba la sogs pa yon tan rnams la so so ba nyid kyi yon tan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yon tan rnams la so so ba nyid kyi yon tan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The qualities of pleasure, etc., do not have the quality of distinctness,

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because qualities do not have qualities.

original: ci ste yang phun tshun ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyis de dag so so zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang phun tshun ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyis de dag so so zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: But if you say that they are distinct in the sense of being mutually exclusive,üîΩthen the reason is not established.

original: de la yang logs shig gi tha snyad kyi yan lag gi rgyu mtshan ston par byed pa de bzhin du rdzas su mngon par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: de la yang logs shig gi tha snyad kyi yan lag gi rgyu mtshan ston par byed pa de bzhin du rdzas su mngon par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa /
translated: And just as the reason for the expression ‚Äúseparate from that‚Äù is shown, so also for a pot, etc.,

original: gzhan la yang rang las tha dad pa'i so so nyid kyi ming can gyi yon tan gzhan med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang rang las tha dad pa'i so so nyid kyi ming can gyi yon tan gzhan med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: which are asserted to be substantially real, there would be no other qualities, which are different from them and which have their own names.

original: de dag las shes pa 'di btags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag las shes pa 'di btags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this cognition is not imputed from them,

original: dngos kyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam @278b du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos kyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam @278b du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because it is not different from the actual cognition.

original: yang na logs shig gi tha snyad ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can du bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bshad pa ni ji ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na logs shig gi tha snyad ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can du bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bshad pa ni ji ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the expression ‚Äúseparate from that‚Äù is taught to have a real basis in the form of a different nature, and the thesis is explained to be contradicted by inference, as in the case of ‚Äúmutually,‚Äù etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag phun tshun du ldog pa'i bdag nyid de dag ni rang gi tha dad pa'i so so ba nyid la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag phun tshun du ldog pa'i bdag nyid de dag ni rang gi tha dad pa'i so so ba nyid la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The application is this: those which are mutually exclusive identities are not based on their own individual separateness.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like pleasure, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang phan tshun ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang phan tshun ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And pots, etc. are mutually exclusive identities. This is a natural inference.

original: gcig la du ma yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig la du ma yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: One does not have many.

original: 'du ba yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel pa mi 'thad pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa la de'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: 'du ba yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel pa mi 'thad pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa la de'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: And because the connection is refuted, the connection is not tenable. And the consequence that the convention of pleasure, etc. does not exist is an invalidating cognition.

original: de la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to refute the possession and the differentiation,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe other,‚Äù etc.

original: go rims bzhin du rdzas rnams la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i shes pa'i rgyu ma phrad pa dag gi phrad pa dang / phrad pa rnams kyi ma phrad pa'i rang bzhin gang yang rung ba dang / gnyi ga'i las las byung ba dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rdzas rnams la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i shes pa'i rgyu ma phrad pa dag gi phrad pa dang / phrad pa rnams kyi ma phrad pa'i rang bzhin gang yang rung ba dang / gnyi ga'i las las byung ba dang /
translated: Conjunction of inherence in the substance is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the substance.üîΩConjunction of possession is the cause of the cognition of the possession of substances.üîΩConjunction of inherence is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of substances.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the particular is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the particular.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the universal is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the universal.

original: ldan ba las byung ba dang / ldan pa las byung ba'i ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs so //üîΩ'di yang gzhung lugs tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: ldan ba las byung ba dang / ldan pa las byung ba'i ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs so // 'di yang gzhung lugs tsam yin gyi /
translated: Conjunction of inherence in the particular and universal is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the particular and universal.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the substance is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the substance.üîΩConjunction of possession is the cause of the cognition of the possession of substances.üîΩConjunction of inherence is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of substances.

original: 'di dag dngos po de nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gzhan gyis de dag brtags pa ni don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag dngos po de nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gzhan gyis de dag brtags pa ni don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Conjunction of inherence in the particular is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the particular.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the universal is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the universal.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the particular and universal is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the particular and universal.üîΩConjunction of inherence in the substance is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the substance.üîΩConjunction of possession is the cause of the cognition of the possession of substances.üîΩConjunction of inherence is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of substances.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: Conjunction of inherence in the particular is the cause of the cognition of the inherence of the particular.üîΩCon

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.üîΩAnd there is no proof of the existence of the connection or the distinction of the other.

original: gzhan gyi ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a non-observation of the omnipresent.

original: 'on te ldan pa yod min na //
analyzed: 'on te ldan pa yod min na //
translated: But if the connection does not exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal ba'i lugs bstan pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal ba'i lugs bstan pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed do //
translated: then the argument is inconclusive, because it teaches the system of the Realists.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gal te ldan pa zhes bya ba don gzhan du 'gyur ba med par gyur na /üîΩde'i tshe zhing dang sa bon dang chu la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med par gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa zhes bya ba don gzhan du 'gyur ba med par gyur na / de'i tshe zhing dang sa bon dang chu la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med par gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: If the so-called connection does not exist as a separate object,üîΩthen at all times the effect, such as the sprout, would not exist, because there would be no distinction between the field, the seed, the water, etc. But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu mi rtsom pa'i phyir zhing la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la @279a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu mi rtsom pa'i phyir zhing la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la @279a * //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is not produced at all times, the field, etc.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is dependent on other causes.

original: dper na 'jim gong dang dbyug gu dang chu dang skud pa la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa byed pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim gong dang dbyug gu dang chu dang skud pa la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa byed pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the potter, etc. are dependent on the clay, the stick, the water, the thread, etc. in order to make the pot, etc.

original: ltos ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa 'di ni ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: ltos ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa 'di ni ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: That which is dependent is related.

original: gzhan yang ldan pa 'di rdzas dag gi khyad bar nyid du rtogs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de las don gzhan nyid du mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
analyzed: gzhan yang ldan pa 'di rdzas dag gi khyad bar nyid du rtogs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de las don gzhan nyid du mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
translated: Moreover, this relation is established by direct perception as being a separate object from the related things, because it is to be understood as a special quality of the substances.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la la las ldan pa'i rdzas long shig ces brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la la las ldan pa'i rdzas long shig ces brjod pa na /
translated: For example, when someone says to someone else, ‚ÄúTake the related substances,‚Äù

original: rdzas gang dag gi ldan pa kho na dmigs pa de kho na len gyi rdzas tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas gang dag gi ldan pa kho na dmigs pa de kho na len gyi rdzas tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: only those substances whose relation is perceived are taken, not just any substance.

original: gzhan dun gang yang rung ba len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dun gang yang rung ba len par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, any one of them could be taken.

original: 'di dag thams cad bzlog nas rnam par dbye ba sgrub ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad bzlog nas rnam par dbye ba sgrub ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All of this can be applied to the proof of the distinction as well, in reverse.

original: gzhan yang gal te ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba 'di dag dngos po 'di las don gzhan du gyur par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba 'di dag dngos po 'di las don gzhan du gyur par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if these, possession and separation, were not different objects from this thing,

original: khyad bar med par yang dngos po 'di ni bar med pa yin la /
analyzed: khyad bar med par yang dngos po 'di ni bar med pa yin la /
translated: then without distinction, this thing would be without interval,

original: 'di ni bar dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i blo tha dad par ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni bar dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i blo tha dad par ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: and this thing would have an interval. How could the different cognitions arise?

original: khyad par gyi shes pa ni dngos po'i khyad par med par skye par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi shes pa ni dngos po'i khyad par med par skye par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: A cognition of distinction is not suitable to arise without a distinction in the thing,

original: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe yod bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe yod bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would exist in all ways at all times.

original: gzhan yang rdo ba dang seng ldeng la sogs pa shin tu ring ba na gnas pa na yang yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i skyes bu la bar med par nges pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di 'byung ba dang / gang yang shing gi rtse mo phra mo la 'brel pa na chu skyar la sogs pa cung zad rtse mo phra mo dang bar med pa yin yang bar dang bcas par nges pa gzhan 'di yang yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdo ba dang seng ldeng la sogs pa shin tu ring ba na gnas pa na yang yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i skyes bu la bar med par nges pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di 'byung ba dang / gang yang shing gi rtse mo phra mo la 'brel pa na chu skyar la sogs pa cung zad rtse mo phra mo dang bar med pa yin yang bar dang bcas par nges pa gzhan 'di yang yang 'byung ste /
translated: Also, when the tip of a tree is connected to a crow or something else, even though there is no interval between the tip of the tree and the crow, the cognition that there is an interval definitely occurs.

original: rnam pa gnyis po 'di yang de ma yin pa la de lta bu'i ngo bos 'jug pa'i phyir 'di ni log pa'i blo yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po 'di yang de ma yin pa la de lta bu'i ngo bos 'jug pa'i phyir 'di ni log pa'i blo yin no //
translated: Since both of these two aspects engage with a nature that is not that, they are mistaken cognitions.

original: log pa'i blo ni dngos kyi don nyams su myong ba med par gang du yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: log pa'i blo ni dngos kyi don nyams su myong ba med par gang du yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: A mistaken cognition does not occur in any way without the experience of an actual object.

original: ba lang mthong ba nyams su myong ba med par ba men gyi dngos po mthong ba las 'di ni ba lang ngo snyam du 'khrul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba lang mthong ba nyams su myong ba med par ba men gyi dngos po mthong ba las 'di ni ba lang ngo snyam du 'khrul ba ma yin no //
translated: Without the experience of seeing an ox, one does not mistake a gayal for an ox.

original: de lta bas na 'khrul pa'i blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan dngos kyi don 'ga' zhig brjod par bya dgos gor ma chag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khrul pa'i blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan dngos kyi don 'ga' zhig brjod par bya dgos gor ma chag go //
translated: Therefore, it is certainly necessary to state the reason for this mistaken awareness.

original: de brjod na yang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de nyid grub la /
analyzed: de brjod na yang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de nyid grub la /
translated: And even if it is stated, the distinction between possession and non-possession is established.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan gzhan sgrub par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan gzhan sgrub par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to establish a reason for this awareness other than those.

original: gzhan yang lha spyin rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo 'di skye ba na rgyu mtshan gang gis skye ba yin zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha spyin rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo 'di skye ba na rgyu mtshan gang gis skye ba yin zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Moreover, when this awareness called ‚ÄúDevadatta with earrings‚Äù arises, it must be said that it arises due to what reason?

original: skyes bu dang rna cha tsam du @279b 'byung bas bskyed par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu dang rna cha tsam du @279b 'byung bas bskyed par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable to be generated by just a person and earrings,

original: der thams cad du lha spyin dang rna cha dag gi de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der thams cad du lha spyin dang rna cha dag gi de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case it would follow that the earrings would exist everywhere.

original: gzhan yang gang kho na 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig tu yod par dmigs pa de kho na gzhan du sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten na tha snyad 'jug par mthong ste /üîΩgal te yang khyed cag gis ldan pa nam yang ma dmigs na de'i phyir 'di dag pa rna cha med pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang kho na 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig tu yod par dmigs pa de kho na gzhan du sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten na tha snyad 'jug par mthong ste / gal te yang khyed cag gis ldan pa nam yang ma dmigs na de'i phyir 'di dag pa rna cha med pa'am /
translated: Moreover, we see that in the world, when someone sees something somewhere, he affirms or denies its existence elsewhere.

original: rna cha can zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par dbye ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna cha can zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par dbye ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you never perceive possession, then you would have the expressions ‚Äúwithout earrings‚Äù and ‚Äúwith earrings‚Äù in the sense of a distinction.

original: 'di ltar 'di la nag pa rna cha med pa zhes bya ba 'des rna cha bkag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la nag pa rna cha med pa zhes bya ba 'des rna cha bkag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, in the expression ‚Äúblack without earrings,‚Äù the earrings are not denied,

original: yul dang dus kyi bye brag gis yod phar nges pa'i lus can de ni dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi bye brag gis yod phar nges pa'i lus can de ni dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that the body exists in a particular place and time, and it cannot be denied.

original: nag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the black,

original: de ni de dang grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dang grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established and happy just as it is.

original: de lta bas na nag pa rna cha dang ldan pa 'gegs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nag pa rna cha dang ldan pa 'gegs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äúblack with earrings‚Äù denies possession.

original: de bzhin du nag pa rna cha can zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i ngag 'dis kyang nag pa dang rna cha dag gang yang rung ba sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nag pa rna cha can zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i ngag 'dis kyang nag pa dang rna cha dag gang yang rung ba sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the expression ‚Äúblack and having earrings‚Äù does not establish either the black or the earrings,

original: de dag grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are already established.

original: lhag mar gyur pas ma grags pa'i ldan pa nyid sgrub pa yin par go'o //
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pas ma grags pa'i ldan pa nyid sgrub pa yin par go'o //
translated: It is understood that the establishment is of the possession that is not well known as a remainder.

original: de lta bas na gang gi dbang gis nag pa rna cha can dang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa rab tu rnam bar phye ba nas rtog par 'gyur ba ldan pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi dbang gis nag pa rna cha can dang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa rab tu rnam bar phye ba nas rtog par 'gyur ba ldan pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa
translated: Therefore, the thing that is the basis for the distinction of negation and affirmation, such as ‚Äúnot black and having earrings,‚Äù and so on, is the existent thing, possession, and so on, which is imagined.

original: kho na'o // sogs pa'i sgras khyad bar nyid du blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: kho na'o // sogs pa'i sgras khyad bar nyid du blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the previously explained ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù and so on.

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: Reply: He says,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa rtag tu 'bras bu byed par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de las bon la sogs pa khyad par med pa nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa rtag tu 'bras bu byed par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de las bon la sogs pa khyad par med pa nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: But that seeds and so on are not without difference is not established,

original: skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyi dngos po thams cad khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyi dngos po thams cad khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things that disintegrate moment by moment are causes that give rise to the attainment of a different state.

original: gang yang / zhing dang sa bon chu sogs rnams //
analyzed: gang yang / zhing dang sa bon chu sogs rnams //
translated: And as for the statement, ‚ÄúThe field, the seed, water, and so on,‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de la yang spyir ltos pa nyid tsam zhig sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la yang spyir ltos pa nyid tsam zhig sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that if you prove mere dependence in general, you are proving what is already established,

original: yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven if they exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: yod na yang sa bon la sogs bar chad med pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub bar nus pa ni kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa nyid yin pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin
analyzed: yod na yang sa bon la sogs bar chad med pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub bar nus pa ni kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa nyid yin pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin
translated: Even if they exist, we also assert that seeds and so on, which are not obstructed and so on, are capable of producing their effects, such as sprouts, in dependence on other states. Therefore this is proving what is already established for us.

original: no // de la bar chad med pa la sogs pa'i gnas skab  kyi khyad par rnams @280a * //
analyzed: no // de la bar chad med pa la sogs pa'i gnas skab  kyi khyad par rnams @280a * //
translated: The special states of the uninterrupted path, etc.,

original: gang dag gnas skabs gzhan la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gnas skabs gzhan la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: are so called because they exist in other states.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gal ba med pa'i rkyen gyis gnod pa med pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gal ba med pa'i rkyen gyis gnod pa med pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the absence of harm by adverse conditions, etc.

original: gnas skabs gzhan gang la bar te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gang la bar te /
translated: The other states are those in which

original: ring ba na gnas pa dang 'gal bas gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu skye ba la gegs byed pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ring ba na gnas pa dang 'gal bas gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu skye ba la gegs byed pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: the absence of harm is present, i.e., the absence of obstruction to the arising of the effect, etc.

original: gnas skabs kyang rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyang rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa ma grub bo //
translated: Since the states are not different from the nature, there is no possession that is a different object.

original: ci ste khyed cag gis mngon pa'i 'dod pa'i ldan pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan zhig la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i chos kyis gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges
analyzed: ci ste khyed cag gis mngon pa'i 'dod pa'i ldan pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan zhig la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i chos kyis gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges
translated: But if you assert that the possession that is desired in the Abhidharma is something else that is related, then in that case, the reason is not established as being concomitant with that kind of phenomenon, and so it is not ascertained.

original: pa nyid dang / dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid dang / dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: And the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: 'di snyam du khyed chag la gang gi phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyed chag la gang gi phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur na /
translated: You may think as follows: ‚ÄúIf you prove mere relatedness, then it would be a proof of what is already established.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan la ltos pa'i zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan la ltos pa'i zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: But we think that the field and so on are causes that give rise to the effect in dependence on other specific states.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes dogs pa la /
translated: How do we understand that they are related to something else that is different in meaning?‚Äù

original: gal te chu la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te chu la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: ‚ÄúIf water and so on . . .‚Äù

original: gal te ldan pa tsam la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe dang po btab pa nyid kyi zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa tsam la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe dang po btab pa nyid kyi zhing la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to depend on mere possession, then it would follow that the result of the field, etc. would arise from the first instance of planting,

original: phyis gzhan du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis gzhan du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because later on, there would be no incompleteness of the cause.

original: ci ste dang por btab pa'i tshe mi 'byung na rgyu ma tshang ba nyid kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste dang por btab pa'i tshe mi 'byung na rgyu ma tshang ba nyid kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it does not arise at the time of the first planting, then it would not be produced by the incompleteness of the cause, and there would be no difference between that state and the state of nonproduction.

original: snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang mi skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang mi skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that later on, it would not be produced, just as before.

original: zhing la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i ldan pa la ltos pa rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i ldan pa la ltos pa rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical for a field, etc. to depend on possession that does not assist, because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: ldan pa rnams ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa rnams ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical for possession to be intermittent,

original: de'i rgyu zhing la sogs pa rnams rtag tu nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhing la sogs pa rnams rtag tu nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of possession, the field, etc. are always present.

original: ci ste ldan la bskyed par bya ba de yang zhing la sogs pa'i las la sogs la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ldan la bskyed par bya ba de yang zhing la sogs pa'i las la sogs la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod na ma yin te /
translated: But if you assert that the seed that possesses the sprout is dependent on the field, etc.,

original: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because the same objection and analysis apply to that.

original: 'di ltar las de yang ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed ces brgal zhing rtog na ci zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar las de yang ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed ces brgal zhing rtog na ci zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur /
translated: In that case, if you ask, ‚ÄúWhy doesn‚Äôt the seed produce the sprout?‚Äù what can be said in reply?

original: de'i rgyu @280b skul bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu @280b skul bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause its cause does not impel it,‚Äù

original: de la ci'i phyir med ces rgyu rtag par khas len pa la thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir med ces rgyu rtag par khas len pa la thams cad du brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: then why does that cause not exist? The same objection and analysis apply to the assertion that the cause is permanent.

original: gang gi ltar na dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa yin pa de'i ltar na rgyu'i rgyud pa thog ma med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te / rgyu snga ma snga ma la rag las par 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: gang gi ltar na dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa yin pa de'i ltar na rgyu'i rgyud pa thog ma med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te / rgyu snga ma snga ma la rag las par 'gyur ba'i
translated: But if you say that all things are impermanent, then it is not the case that all things would arise simultaneously, because they would be dependent on prior causes.

original: phyi ma phyi ma de dag thams cad cig car ba'i rgyu ma tshang bas mi nye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bas na khyed cag gi lta ba kho na la zhing la sogs pa thams cad du myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhing la sogs pa ldan pa gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma de dag thams cad cig car ba'i rgyu ma tshang bas mi nye ba'i phyir ro // de lta bas na khyed cag gi lta ba kho na la zhing la sogs pa thams cad du myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhing la sogs pa ldan pa gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma
translated: because all of those later and later causes are incomplete and do not approach the result.

original: yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the field and so on are not dependent on another possessing the result, because in your view it would follow that the result, such as the sprout, would arise in everything, such as the field.üîΩAnd also,

original: gang yang // de yang khyad par nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: gang yang // de yang khyad par nyid yin phyir //
translated: because it is a specific characteristic,üîΩand so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: in response to that, he says,

original: bar chad med par skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bar chad med par skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that arises without interruption, and so on.

original: gang gis de mthong ba las khyad par can gyi rdzas len par byed pa ldan pa can gyi dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa rtogs pa po'i mthong ba'i lam du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de mthong ba las khyad par can gyi rdzas len par byed pa ldan pa can gyi dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldan pa rtogs pa po'i mthong ba'i lam du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the one who perceives the specific substance that is taken up from seeing that does not enter the path of seeing that perceives the possession that is a different object from the thing that possesses.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sngar byung ba'i bar dang bcas pa skye ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de las khyad par can bar med pa skye ba'i dngos po gang dag yin ba de dag kho na ldan pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar byung ba'i bar dang bcas pa skye ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de las khyad par can bar med pa skye ba'i dngos po gang dag yin ba de dag kho na ldan pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is used to refer to those things that are different from the state of arising, which includes the past, and that arise without an interval.

original: ldan pa'i sgra ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par las byung ba nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgra ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par las byung ba nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is used in reference to a particular state.

original: de nas rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po ldan pa'i sgra'i yul gyi dngos por gyur pa mthong ba gang yin pa de dag kho na lan par byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po ldan pa'i sgra'i yul gyi dngos por gyur pa mthong ba gang yin pa de dag kho na lan par byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Then, those things that are seen to be the objects of the word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù in that way are referred to as ‚Äúendowed,‚Äù but not others.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams sgras ma bskul ba'i don la sgras 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams sgras ma bskul ba'i don la sgras 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are rational do not engage in the meaning of a word that is not expressed by the word.

original: gang yang / gal te 'di na de med ces bya ba la sogs ba smras pa de la bar chod gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang / gal te 'di na de med ces bya ba la sogs ba smras pa de la bar chod gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, someone might say, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist here, etc.,‚Äù in response to that, he says, ‚ÄúThe other that is obstructed, etc.‚Äù
